We received a phone call from the front desk verifying that everything was ok with the room. We had a room on the 26th floor with a city view. The room size was nice. There was also a window seat that was pretty nice although I didn't use it. The bed was very comfortable and the linen was soft. The hotel has a concierge service which was extrememly helpful. LeaAnn and Brian (concierge service) were very helpful and friendly with asisting us with directions and places to dine. Earnest, the doorman was very cool, funny and down to earth and also helped us with navigating the city. Chloe and Jasmine at the front desk were also nice. Shoutout to Al for helping us with our pictures. One advantage this hotel has over others is the zipcar service. Prior to traveling to San Francisco, I was told about zipcar. That is the most convenient option ever!! The Intercontinental actually has zipcars based at the hotel. That saved us hundreds on a rental car and parking fees. I also noticed there were always chauffeurs on ready at the hotel garage. The hotel is a short walking distance from Union Square, Market St. etc. The Westfield Mall is right around the corner. I also liked the(1 location of the hotel because it wasn't congested with tourist. We were always greeted by someone whenever we left and returned to the hotel. Jason even remebered my name a few days after had last seen me. You can take the Bart from the airport to Powell St. and you will be about two blocks (10 min. walk) from the hotel. My wife didn't want to walk with luggage from the Bart station to the hotel so we caught a cab. The cab far was about $4.50 both times. It will only cost you $8.10 each was to/from the airport. That is cheaper than a cab and those shared van rides. I read and post reviews on trip advisor like others and it's been a great help for preparing for this trip. I think the main two complaints I read were parking fees which were about $50-60 a night and internet usage for about $15 a day. Well I solved those issues quickly. I bought my laptop and tethered from my cellphone for internet usage. I signed up for zipcar and used the service while we were there. $7/hr for car usage? You can't beat that!!!!! The hotel is the only one that has zipcars stationed there so you don't have to go find zip car locations. There is a link on the Intercontinental website for a special for the zipcar signup. That also took car of the $50-60 parking charge so there it is! The only thing I would have liked to have seen was a tub/shower vs. shower room only. Kudos to the entire staff at Intercontinental San Francisco for their professionalism and prompt service. We will definately return to this hotel if we visit San Francisco again. Actually we will so my wife can go to Napa Valley to a winery. There is so much to do in San Francisco, but you can't get it all in four days like we tried....lol!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if attending a conference”
Reviews.Author: PhotoMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights attending a conference at Mascone Center. Location is pretty good but it's only about 1-2 blocks from slightly shady SoMa characters - just keep east of hotel. The room was as expected for an Intercontinental Hotel - excellent. Clean, comfortable, modern and quiet. The staff and service was fantastic. Ate breakfast at restaurant twice - very good and room service for dinner once which was also good. They do charge for internet but I found it to be fast. The mini bar fridge had those annoying sensors for automatic charge - lucky I called soon after my wife moved / touched some things. Took the hotel car to the airport - slightly more expensive but beats queuing up for taxi. Would return in future esp. when my conference is in SF every 2nd year.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DrDave2
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights for a conference at the Moscone Center. My room was on the 16th floor looking south and ,even only half way up the tower, had a fine view. The room was large and comfortable, with good facilities and a very comfortable bed. The staff are very helpful and the location is excellent. I didn't eat meals in the hotel - I found local coffee shops to be ideal for breakfast at a fraction of the cost, and used the Real Foods store just a block away for dinner. My only gripe is the internet connection, which can be slow in the evenings. That is quite surprising for such a new hotel. Time to upgrade the broadband guys!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Irvmckinney
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the InterContinental San Francisco and it was an amazing experience. The hotel has this beautiful modern and new feel to it, with a very nice decor. My room was so amazing as well,my bed was so cozy it made me feel as if i never wanted to leave. The location was perfect as well, the hotel is so close to everything, you can just walk and walk and find so many things to do. I arrived fairly late and the front desk manager Mr.Ngo was very helpful and polite, We werent quiet ready to call it a night and Mr Ngo was more then helpful with making this wonderful list of some really good places to eat being that it was so late at night still. Overall i had an amazing stay and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel terrible Internet”
Reviews.Author: Normfrommiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 days for a conference. The hotel is very new, the club is good and the room on the 31st floor was well appointed with a good view. The big problem is the Internet for which they charge $15 a day. It periodically slows down to a slow crawl to the point where it takes 2 minutes for a page to load. I ended up using my ATT dongle to pick up Internet from the cell phone network. For this reason I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, shiny and new!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller20203
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is a great place to stay in SF. The staff is polite and professional. The rooms are a good size and very modern. The door to the bathrooms is a sliding screen that doesn't lock, not ideal for privacy. But overall it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: BruceTravels
Reviews.Content: Overall excellent stay and value. Easy in and out and close to freeways. Be careful if you need to park - very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The Finest Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: leemd1
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m am currently here for a return visit. Plan to arrive at this hotel with very high expectations and you will not be disappointed. This property sets the standard of what a 5-star property should be. The Intercontinental San Francisco is exceptional. From the moment you enter the property you are made to feel very welcome and appreciated. The rooms are large, roomy, and airy. They are extremely well maintained and impeccably clean. They are furnished beautifully and the beds are extremely comfortable with high quality linens. All information and pictures on their website are very accurate. I highly recommend the Intercontinental Club during your stay for food presentations throughout the day and exceptional guest services by Anu and Gina.. The goal of the employees at the Intercontinental is delivering excellent customer service and superior accommodations. They succeed without exception. Stay at the Intercontinental San Francisco and prepared to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “One of Two Intercontinentals in the city,this is more suited to the business minded and perfect for that purpose........”
Reviews.Author: talentpicker
Reviews.Content: After twenty five years as a guest of the Mark Hopkins I was anxious to stay at the newest Intercontinental in San Francisco,I arrived to a warm greeting in a massive lobby area and was quickly escorted to a suite on the Club Floor levels,this was huge with a spectacular view,very modern furnishings and totally practical for the busy executive.At midday I tried out the Club Lounge and was shown around,lunch had a large buffet of fresh cut sandwiches and a large couldron of delicious creamy tomato soup that was piping hot with lots of crusty bread choices for dipping,ideal on the cold day.Abundant tea and coffee and the usual juices and sodas,plenty of seats and other happy clients.Downtairs had restaurants but the main focal point was a large bar area that has the most comprehensive offerings of Grappa and Malt Whiskies,the barman made some fabulous cocktails and together with the usual snack menu became the mainstay to meet and greet friends and colleagues until dinner time and later till the wee hours with your wife or girlfriend,it had a very pleasant and lively atmosphere from very early on,Great facilities wonderful service and a great breakfast in the morning.Very sound,new and good security very evident all around.Perfect location close to the Convention Center and a good Limo service to and from SFO.I liked it and will be happy to return and its well within corporate budgets for staff and business people but not so suited as a touristy hotel.........................

Reviews.Title: “5th Visit as Good as the First”
Reviews.Author: Brbiam
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Intercontinental since it opened almost 3 years ago. This past Thanksgiving weekend was our 5th stay. I would not stay anywhere else in the city. The rooms are large and lovely. The views (from the 15th floor up, especially) are wonderful of the bay and the Bay Bridge (the higher you go, the better the Bridge view). The location near Moscone Center is a bit out of the way from Union Square but cabs are easily obtainable and the walk to both Union Square (5 blocks) and the very upscale Westfield Mall ( 2 blocks) are easy and enjoyable. Staff is very pleasant and accomodating to our every request, no matter what time of the day or night. 5 visits so far and another one planned for February. That says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: Akhilk
Reviews.Content: Great service, great hotel! Very convenient for biz travel. Rooms are great, very modern and spacious. The bar in the lobby is great and food quality is good as well. Concierge is very well informed and extremely helpful. However, the neighborhood could have been better as it may seem down market. However accessibility to the bart and main street is not a concern at all.

Reviews.Title: “Only SF hotel for me”
Reviews.Author: Garrett L
Reviews.Content: I am in San Francisco every 6-8 weeks, and this is the only hotel where I will stay. Because I am so stubborn about staying here, I have been fortunate enough to experience the entire range of rooms. I have found that the "Superior" level rooms are the best deal--you get a great room with a great view at a competitive rate. Umbrellas in all rooms are a nice touch as well. The room service IS expensive (stayed with a friend, both of us ordered big breakfasts and ended up paying about $80), but worth every penny. Everything comes in a timely manner EXACTLY as it was ordered. Even the minibars aren't hideously overpriced ($8 beers, etc...) It is expected that the staff is helpful, but it always stands out when even the bellmen and the valets are courteous and accommodating (which they are). Location is blocks from Union Square, as well as restaurant and bars, but the immediate neighborhood is very quiet. I just left two three weeks ago, and am all set up to check in again in two weeks--I can't wait. (And if you're a particularly tall Asian male, the bellman should probably remember your face--he always remembers mine)

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: Hardwings
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny and serves any purpose with excellent concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Number72_7073
Reviews.Content: Over the past few years, when I have 'spent the night' in a hotel in The City, they've all been disappointments--Westin St. Francis, The Palace, Hotel Vitale--all have let me down. I had about given up hope, and then I tried the IC San Francisco. I found the efficiency of the staff refreshing, my reservation was in order, my Ambassador level in Priority Club was recognized, room service, and house keeping were all at the level I did not find at the earlier mentioned hotels. I found the bar and breakfast service all excellent. The hotel is very modern and very new. While there were no faults with the room, the lobby and elevator area were already showing signs of wear, surprising giving the hotel's age. I pointed this to a porter when I left, and this young fellow from Brazil (interesting guy, had been a fireman I think) showed genuine concern and advised that I contact the hotel as the hotel wants feedback to fix these things. It was very refreshing to see this in a downtown San Francisco hotel. Hopefully in the future I'll spend a longer stay at this hotel and see what they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best Intercontinental hotels...”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: This is what can be called a "flawless" hotel visit. The Intercontinental San Francisco is a new hotel, openned 2010. Overall very modern and stylish, nice rooms and decor. But probably the best and what sets hotels apart is the committment to service from the staff. On this sense, from the front desk to concierge, bartenders to housekeeping, the common denominator was an excellent disposition and attitude of service towards the client. These hotel follows the everyrule on the Intercontinental book and for that I have to say "thank you" for a flawless stay. Hotel is nicely located in downtown area, full of shops, cafe's, resturants, a Mall, movies, etc. etc. Nice place to stay solo, with wife, family or just visiting. The hotel Club Room is very nice also, special recognition to "Luis" who always wants to make your visit special. Excellent variety of drinks and spirits in the afternoon, complete breakfast in the morning. Concierge was also very proactive, from emails before arriving, to help with dinner reservations, car rental or just checking movie times...thanks William. Overall, I can truly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco and expecting a great experience at a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great!”
Reviews.Author: jeonyc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 10 times and each time is just like the first. The property is clean and nice. The location is outstanding for any Moscone events. Although on the fringe of a good neighborhood, it is only literally a block from the touristy areas. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: natnordy
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk were less than excellent. But, i had good service followed by a less than friendly front desk fellow. The wi-fi was $15 per day, which i found outrageous. I was attending a work conference, and was dissapointed wi-fi wasnt included in $350/night room. I reserved a King bed room, but got a double bed room. Room was nice and large as was the bathroom. Nice sitting area next to window.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental as it should be”
Reviews.Author: Andreassn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in November. I must say that I was satisfied. Great rooms. Very comfy beds. No noise from other rooms or hallway. The view over the bay was great. Be sure to ask for a room on the higher floors. During our stay they had a major issue with internet service which was not solved until our second day. But they were accommodating and offered us another room with working wifi. All the staff members are very friendly. We had the pleasure to meet Justin and Jason at the front desk. The really know what service is all about. I would recommend that you try the food outlets at the hotel. The bar offers good wine and service. The breakfast is a very good start to your day. I would recommend the buffet option as it offers food with high quality. The location is located in the Soma area next to the convention center and just a block away from Westfield shopping center. Even though we had the issue with the Internet not working, which was necessary for us. They made our stay a memorable one and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “new five star in Soma”
Reviews.Author: Fredontheroad
Reviews.Content: in the hippest area of the city stands the newest 5 *, with numerous great restaurants within blocks, two shopping malls, two multiplexes, the convention center, Union Square and Market Street all steps away. The hotel offers every amenity expected from an upscale city hotel, with friendly and professional staff and state-of-the art rooms equipped with the latest green technology.

Reviews.Title: “Great SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garbo25
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in other Intercontinental Hotels and of that group, the SF Intercontinental stands out. Every room and public area is immaculate. The staff is friendly and professional. Location is a little bit on the negative side but it is right next to the Moscone Center and the Contemporary Jewish Museum. Market Street and the Westfield Mall are two blocks away. Union Square is walking distance. Rooms are very quiet with large bathrooms. Lap pool and workout areas very clean. At this level of service I expected free Internet

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Moscone Convention Center.”
Reviews.Author: FayeJ42
Reviews.Content: I was attending a meeting at the Moscone Center and this hotel is adjacent to it. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The rooms are clean and high quality. Internet was about $14/day. The gym is included with no extra fee. There is a lap pool. Standard mini-bar. Nice views of the Bay. Minor issues: There was a lot of road noise despite the fact that we were on floor 24. The gym was overcrowded with no machines available at peak times (6-8 am).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but didn't feel any wow factor”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this hotel as I've always been pleased with InterContinental but I found this stay to be average at best. Welcome was quick but quickly assigned the 7th floor with stunning views of the Burlington Coat factory. My tip is to request a higher floor. Despite being a triple room, breakfast was only for two people. A below average room and no real welcome, I felt that my rate purchased via Expedia and no Priority Club status got me this below average welcome. Room was spacious, nice and clean. Bed was excellent and extra layer on top of the mattress was excellent. As usual, no free internet in these upscale hotels which is somewhat ironic. Breakfast buffet in the morning is lovely and so was the staff. This was probably the highlight of the stay here. Location was good and a short walk from Market Street. A nice property but I'd try elsewhere for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service/staff - value less than ideal...”
Reviews.Author: jennkk
Reviews.Content: First time in San Francisco - we were there during Fleet Week and the end of the Oracle convention - so hotels were booked like crazy. Were excited to stay, seemed competitive with San Francisco prices. Intercontinental has a GREAT staff, very very approachable and they went out of their way to make stay the best - Concierge had restaurant tips that were impeccable ( VISIST the Grove for breakfast!) and restaurant host helped with interconnect connections well beyond what was expected. Hotel is very slick, modern, clean. Feels luxurious - however, after having tried a 5/5 Intercontinental in Monterrey and Hong Kong - we felt underwhelmed with this particular location. As mentioned in another review, there is a pipe-mixup with hot and cold water in showers (we were on the 12th floor) the same was said by our friends on a higher level. When you want hot, its cold, and vise versa - not the end of the world if you were ready to tinker for a bit pre-shower, but unexpected changes during your shower were just irritating. I would say the rooms were serviced and cleaned everyday - but not to the satisfaction I experienced at other hotels - unreplemished coffee station one day, counter area in bathroom the other, etc. But hotel cleaning staff were accommodating when I caught them in hall for linens or coffee creams. Beds were VERY comfortable, No sound from other rooms entered unit. We enjoyed our stay, but were not blown-away. We would try another hotel next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: hellraizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel in October. Good value and good location. Very close to the Westfield mall and china town. About 1 mile from pier 39. The rooms are a decent size, but no fan in the bathroom and a sliding door that does not lock on the bathroom was a negative. We had room service once which was fast and good. There is a convenient liquor store and mart just a block from the hotel. We did not use the pool or other facilities. Overall a very good stay. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is attached to the convention center and is sleek, clean and modern.”
Reviews.Author: International-Dov
Reviews.Content: Perfect business stay. Nice bed. If you are in SF for a convention this is the place to be for ease of access and a comfortable facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superb service”
Reviews.Author: kitty811
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Ambassador membership provides welcome fruit, nuts and water (usually Evian). Water replenished daily. Also a free in room movie per visit, wifi and room upgrade - Excellent gym with nice equipment plus water, towels, fruit and magazines - Luce restaurant has delicious dishes - Rooms are large and well-appointed. Super comfy beds and roomy bathrooms - Cozy robes and slippers (disposable); in room safe - Short walk (5-10min) to BART (in Bloomingdales' mall) and tons of restaurants - Great service from all staff (bellmen, front desk, room service, mgt) - Guests from all over the world: Makes travel more interesting... Cons: - Vigilence (extra) required while walking near hotel after dark (especially one block down, around 6th St). I've never had any problems but be aware... Opt for a taxi provided by hotel - Sometimes there's street noise along Howard (e.g., police/fire dept sirens) so bring earplugs

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite InterContinental hotels. Great staff, really nice rooms and good location. I wish all InterContinental properties were this good & if it weren't for the fact that Priority Club Rewards lacks a decent mid-level chain, I would be Platinum Elite :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed. Expected more for the Price, Expensive WIFI”
Reviews.Author: juliette1953
Reviews.Content: The location is on the edge, wouldn't walk alone at night. The building was clean and crisp, convention styling. The floor to ceiling windows are a nice touch, bed was great. No place for two to sit and enjoy a cocktail or coffee. The WIFI was $14.95 per day PER DEVICE! OUCH. We paid the extra $80.00 for the club room which was superb with excellent staff, truly excellent. The extra expense took care of my seating and WIFI concerns, plus they provide the cocktails and coffee. I will try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Californiaboy101
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental San Francisco is a great hotel! The lobby is in great condition and very beautiful! The lobby bathrooms are a little confusing in the floor plan but I was fine with it. The room was great! floor to ceiling windows on one wall. The only thing that was wrong with our room (I don't think it's in all rooms our room was 1601) but there was several long skinny cracks in the ceiling but I wasn't bothered. It is also a tough place to get taxis. Anyway this is a great hotel in a great location and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “No COLD water?”
Reviews.Author: cardio-2
Reviews.Content: Typical convention hotel with a nuance that was a first for me. I've been without hot water, but never without cold. Repaired some how, no explanation. Room had items left over from previous occupant, the a/c rattled and groaned like some 3rd world country unit. Room service was poor and the restaurant "Luce" seemed offended we wanted a to go bag late at night. There are much better in SFO

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: supertraveler24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights, Sept. 2 to Sept. 9, 2011 in a large, king room on the 38th floor with floor to ceiling windows and an amazing view of the bay and the bridges with the city in the foreground. It was absolutely gorgeous. The room was very large, the bed outstandingly comfortable. The bathroom had wonderful amenities and huge, plush towels. The front desk staff and concierge made restaurant suggestions and were helpful and accommodating. We especially enjoyed The Grove restaurant, a casual breakfast and lunch restaurant with a very nice menu and outstanding quality of food. The tv inthe room was a very, large, flat screen. There was a pod coffee/, tea making machine. The bedding and linens were very upscale. We travel very often and stay in all lmanner of hotels and this was one of the all around nicest hotels we've stayed in. We will certainly return to this hotel when we are again in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: USCanTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental on business while attending a convention. While checking in, the front desk and concierge staff were extraordinary helpful and also make some great restaurant recommendations. As a part of the conference we hosted a reception at this hotel, and the catering staff were also wonderful. Reception food was excellent and the breakfast buffet, while a bit pricy, was delicious. Although the hotel is a few blocks away from the hustle and bustle of union square, I liked having a bit of distance from the crowds. The room was clean, although starting to show a few signs of wear such as wallpaper starting to lift in the bathroom and between the dresser and wall really needs some dusting. Unfortunate choice of tile decor as what was supposed to look like marbling in the shower (I assume) I thought just ended up looking dirty - but it was not - the room was well cleaned. Beautiful floor to ceiling windows in the room and comfortable bed. In-room safe was convenient and easy to use. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I went back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars.....what a joke”
Reviews.Author: pbrory
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel expecting a wonderful stay at a 5 star hotel in San Fransisco, what we got was a cold, industrial hotel, with an unhelpful staff, and a closet of a room. The staff was unhelpful and unwelcoming. The room was about big enough for its queen size bed......and that's about it. We would have been much happier at a Best Western.........I would not stay here again if the room were $150 a night much less $450!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: iduj
Reviews.Content: We overall enjoyed our stay at the Intercontinental. Great location: downtown next to the Moscone Center, but a little tucked away from the craziness of Market St. The room was good sized and comfortable. It was definitely a business traveler hotel, as the extras were costly: !4/day for internet, fee for printouts in the business center (although boarding passes were free). One unexpected perk: we needed a Zipcar for a trip to Napa and found a car parked in the hotel garage that the valet retrieved and returned for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conference”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for my conference at the Moscone Center. Very convenient to conference center and to many other hotels and restaurants. It is a bit far for Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown, but it is a quick cab or trolley ride away. The hotel is clean, professional and everyone was courteous. Highly recommend for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel which can also be a fun vacation getaway”
Reviews.Author: sonnet4
Reviews.Content: We have been loyal Intercontinental customers for too many years I care to remember...When in San Francisco, we usually stay at the Mark Hopkins, but their customer service has been declining ever since they became part of the Holiday Inn chain and especially since they moved their Club lounge from one of the higher view floors to the lobby level. This is the second time we tried the Intercontinental on Howard Street. The hotel is less elegant and serene than the Mark Hopkins. It is situated in a crowded area by the Convention Center close to the Tenderloin district. The first time we stayed, we were impressed by their friendly front desk and their willingness to accomodate our needs. When we wanted a weekend getaway, we decided to try them again. When we checked in, we were met with an efficient, but unyielding clerk who was unwilling to give us the room and services we needed. I was ready to move to another hotel when Janet, another front desk person, took over. Janet went out of her way to get us a beautiful room similar to the one we had on our previous visit. Her courtesy, efficiency and tact restored our faith in the Intercontinental brand. The service we had this time was comparable to the outstanding service we received at the Amstel, Manila, and Bali Intercontinental; it was top notch! I highly recommend the corner rooms on the higher floors for a panoramic view of the city. The floor to ceiling windows give the rooms a spacious, airy feeling not found in the regular rooms (which are mediocre at best). The buffet breakfasts are quite tasty, but they are not quite as delicious as at the Mark Hopkins! I missed the eggs benedict on Sunday morning! Parking rates here are as exorbitant as at the Mark Hopkins, but here there is a parking lot across the street which is much cheaper, but it has no in and out possibilities at night. We had free parking with our package deal which made things much easier. One advantage of the hotel is that it is around the corner from great shopping and that it is right by the Chieftain, a great Irish pub, should one require a tasty libation or some Irish stew cooked in Guinness! For anyone daring to venture into less desirable neighborhoods near the hotel, there are superb Thai restaurants nearby. This hotel might lack the exclusive and sedate ambience of the Mark Hopkins, but their rates and services are superior if one is lucky enough to get the right person at check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, large well decorated rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: Toffee80
Reviews.Content: Wow! We had an amazing stay at this hotel. We stayed for 8 nights overall and each one was wonderful. The staff were very helpful and went beyond the call of duty to make sure we had everything we needed and were looking for. As it was my birthday they even arranged for a personalised dessert dish to be left in the room. Wonderful surprise. Our first room had floor to ceiling windows with a beautiful view over the docks and sea. The bed was one of the best i have ever slept in. We were never disturbed by noise from other rooms or outside. Location wise its hard to beat. Just a 5 min walk to the cable car station and the main squares in the city. Also its right next door to the Moscone convention centre. We stayed in an club room which meant we has access to the club lounge allday. Breakfast there is great, eggs, salmon, pastries, fruit and a variety of cereal, cakes and bagels. We also went there in the evening and chatted with the friendly staff while enjoying local wines and snacks. Its well worth upgrading to a club room if you feel you will have the time to use it. Car parking is expensive but thats the only fault i can offer with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharonHouTX
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only a few blocks from Union Station, BART and the cable cars. As this was my first time in San Francisco (from Texas), I kept looking for hotels that included free parking. The parking rate was $60, but I realized I didn't need a car in the city and used public transportation during my two day stay, returning to the Oakland airport for a car to travel through Napa Valley. The service at the hotel was outstanding. Our room was quiet, even though it was on the corner with floor to ceiling glass on two sides. The beds were extremely comfortable with down comforters and lots of pillows. I booked a very good rate on hotwire, which made the stay even better. I definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: bd007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adjacent to the Moscone Convention Centre. It always appears to be very busy. The rooms are large clean and have floor to ceiling windows which provide a great view. Compared to most hotels the rooms are very quiet (including the airconditioning system). The beds are incredibly comfortable. The breakfast in the main restaurant ($28 for buffet), is great. I guess you get what you pay for. The gym is large has alot of equipment and a pool. The only complaint i have is around the internet access, which is $14 a day (the only hotel i have been in, in SFO that charges a fee. To add insult to injury, a message pops up on your computer every 10 seconds telling you how much time access time you have left.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: bruno68
Reviews.Content: Very new and modern. Beautifully appointed. Not an ounce of personality though, but no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: onedude
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the InterContinental San Francisco (875 Howard) on three occasions in the last six months, and I have to admit for a large hotel, they deliver a consistently good result for guests. Rooms are whisper quiet, beds are comfy and luxurious, and even the smallest rooms (the queen bed) are still well appointed with all the trimmings one comes to expect when staying with a premium brand. Small things I notice as a business traveler that make a difference: * More than 3 quality towels available in the bathroom, meaning 2 guests can shower twice without needing to call housekeeping * Full size pillows (some Holiday Inn properties have serious smaller pillow issues) * An iron that steams, and also has a retractable cord * Good lighting in bathrooms and around beds and desks * Keycard elevator access, ensuring only hotel guests get to the floor * Bellhop staff trying extra hard to find those elusive SF taxis * Quick, hot and tasty room service I'm getting to San Francisco a lot for work these days, and I'm really pleased with what's on offer from this hotel. Would recommend. * Confirmation of rate at check-in, and electronic signing to save paper/green credentials

Reviews.Title: “Booked a killer deal here on priceline”
Reviews.Author: djrhoffman
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with this hotel. Even if I hadn't gotten it for a steal of a rate I would still have been thrilled with the service and amenities. Great location too. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: s s
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room (standard double overlooking street). Excellent, attentive staff. Breakfast buffet ( and a la carte) too expensive - but typical for hotel that caters to business guests on an expense account. Starbucks nearby, and other cafes a short walk. Near to public transit and cable car.

Reviews.Title: “My Home away from Home in SF”
Reviews.Author: LeTerrible
Reviews.Content: Although my Brother and other family memebers lives in SF and I've spent time here since I was a boy, I don't like staying with family members! I love this hotel for this reason as they treat me very well as a return guest and being 'Ambassador Club/Platinum Priority club' doesn't hurt :) Still, I dare say that everyone is treated wonderfully by the hotel lobby staff from the bellboys to the reception desk. I am always upgraded from a Deluxe room to an Executive room which has sweeping vistas of the bay and about 2/3's of SF. This view is almost 1/2 of the windows in the room and is worth the executive room,alone, The amazingly comfortable bed with flat screen TV, nice sized modern room with amenities and a modern bathroom are always Tops. I will say that since I started coming to this hotel since its inception, it has been kept up very well. The Gym and pool are as pristine and user friendly as possible and the spa is a nice oasis of calm and hedonism. I would only think that in a few years...the bathrooms, which are still lovely, will need some minor updates. Again...for a 5* hotel that is in walking distance from Union Square, the Embarcadero and Market street....the prices and specials are very reasonable. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SMillington
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights as part of our honeymoon. Very nice modern hotel only 5-10mins walk from the heart of union square. Very quick check in and out at the front desk. We had complimentary champagne delivered to our room with a personal welcome note. The rooms are very large, clean and well furnished, just what you expect from a new hotel. The staff was all very helpful and offered some great recommendations for exploring the best of San Francisco. We hired a rental car and used the valet parking option for one night. Valet was very efficient, however, I did feel 50dollars for the night was quite excessive in relation to what we paid elsewhere, but this was only a minor issue. If we visit San Francisco again we would definitely return to the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: BabyKatcher
Reviews.Content: The hotel is typical for the Intercontinental. Huge, beautiful, everything you can think of to ask for - they have it. The bed and bathroom were wonderful. Our view was great. We lucked out with hotwire on getting this room for a crazy discounted price for San Fran. The only bad thing is the location. It is walking distance to Union Square, but if you have reservations booked at a restaurant in a completely different area of San Fran trying to get a taxi can be a nightmare! As in get ready early, be prepared to wait up to 45 minutes, then pay $30 because you have to take the limo so you don't miss your reservation. We were telling taxi drivers that they could make tons of money by stopping here, but because the hotel is located on a one way street they said it's not a great area to stop at??? The explanation still doesn't make since to me, but because of this I don't think we would ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDBSB
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice staff and rooms. The view from the room was amazing and everything seemed to be clean and well-kept. Location is reasonable, but just not perfect - it's a ten minutes walk to Union Square and a few blocks away from Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Building. Courteous Staff. Fantastic Food”
Reviews.Author: hoffboy
Reviews.Content: I judge hotels on three criteria; building, staff, and food. I'm pleased to report that the Intercontinental San Francisco is a beautiful building, tastefully decorated, and impeccably clean. The rooms (even the smaller ones) come with niceties that really enhance the feeling of being well looked after. The staff was very courteous and attentive, even when the restaurant/bar got a little busy. And the food...my God the food. Be sure to try the burger, and the tuna! I will definitely be going back. In fact, my next trip is booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, recommended for business or leisure.”
Reviews.Author: yaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental San Fran for a vacation with family members in June 2011. The hotel was in a good position, far enough away from the busyness of Union Square but only a few minutes walk when needed. There were great views of the harbour from the upper floors. The rooms were clean and large enough for us. Recommend Blue Bottle cafe for breakfast and coffee just a couple of minutes walk away - a little hard to find so ask the concierge/front desk for directions. Heading back to San Fran in Jan 2012 for a conference at the Moscone Centre and have chosen to stay at the Intercontinental again - looking forward to heading back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for At&t Park and Downtown shopping”
Reviews.Author: Jim A
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my five day stay at the Intercontinental in early September. While the hotel seems geared toward the business traveller in terms of its facilities and advertising material, if you are a person happy to walk to the tourist attractions, the Intercontinental is perfect for a vacation. AT&T Park is a fairly easy walk in one direction, the Westfield Centre, Union Square and the Cable Cars are about five minutes away in the other direction. My room on the 21st floor also had a great view toward the bay.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrickatcigcards
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in mid-September. It was difficult to find any fault with it and all the staff were super helpful and friendly. My special thanks go to Dorian and Ernest for treating us so well (especially my little grandson - Liam). The rooms were extremely comfortable, the hotel was very clean and customer service was exemplary. I would take my family there anytime and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: yabutravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights last week while on business. It's a great hotel and exceeded my expectations. In a city that had hotels bursting at the seams due to multiple tech conferences, I was lucky to have gotten a room there for less than $300/night (corporate rate). Before arriving, I looked it up on bed bug registry and was alarmed to find that bed bugs had been found here before but if they did have a pest problem, it's long been taken care of since the room was spotless and meticulously kept. Yes, I checked for bed bugs. It's a new-ish hotel so the whole place felt light and airy. I was on a high floor with a gorgeous view of the bay and watched the sunrise each morning. The only problem I had was the drain which was clogged on the first night but they took care of that right away. Staff was nice and super friendly. 24 hr gym was good. The jacuzzi was in a weird spot though. Overall, I would recommend for business or pleasure. Short walk to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with fab location”
Reviews.Author: Etherlycc
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 4 night stay about 10am having paid $20 for an early check in and were told that our room was not quite ready but they took my mobile number and said they would ring me as soon as it was. There was a starbucks around the corner so we went for a coffee. Within 30 mins the hotel had rang us to say our room was ready. We checked into our room on the 27th floor before 11am, this was excellent and considering we had tickets for the afternoon baseball game (1.30 start) we were delighted to have our cases unpacked before headed to the stadium. The hotel has a great location, just 1 block away from Bloomingdale and a 10 minute walk to Union square. Our room was very spacious, a king bed loverly bathroom and tea/coffee maker and fridge. We found in our room a 15% discount voucher for Bloomingdales and as it was also Labour day a big sale was on but we still got 15% off the sale prices. This was an excellent saving and my wife had a great time there!!!! Staff were all very helpful and attentative. It was not cheap to stay but I would thoroughly reccomend this hotel and we will stay with this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yayhasplz
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel that is definitely a step up from your standard Holiday Inn Express (my usual hotel). I liked it, but just wasn't wowed. Considering the cost, I just was a little disappointed. It did have a nice bed, clean floors, ipod docking station (this was a nice touch) and other fun amenities, but basically it was just a regular room. Our room was actually very small with just a queen bed. Service was good, we didn't eat any on site food, but there are tons of restaurants close by. We also didn't use the parking because we took bart from San Leandro. Transportation is a breeze to this place- you can get a bus pass or a bart ticket and travel all over the Bay. I liked this place but would only return if I had an amazing deal for the room that I couldn't pass up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dillyma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for two nights in September for a business trip. I had many hotels to choose from in the same price range, but I chose the Intercontinental because it looked beautiful, had good reviews, and I had never stayed there. The staff is very friendly and helpful, everyone from the door men to front desk to room service. I was always greeted when entering and leaving the hotel. Check in was a breeze. The rooms are very nice - modern and clean. The beds are very comfortable and the sheets are sooo soft. The bathroom is well-appointed but a little dim. I do like more light when I get ready in the morning, but I just turned on the hall light and it was fine. The bathrooms only have a shower (no tub), but it is big and has good water pressure. I did order room service my first night and the food was really good for room service. The second night we went to a restaurant called Zero Zero which is just a couple blocks from the hotel. This is an excellent restaurant - gourmet pizza & pasta. I would highly recommend it. All in all, I had a very pleasant stay and would return to the Intercontinental again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: NRLong
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. Nice. Not spectacular. I was hoping for a little more spectacular. Rooms were nice, pretty clean, beds good, bathrooms okay, closets okay, I just wanted to be wowed. The view was okay. The people were pretty nice. Just nothing amazing. I was not dissatisfied, but if I go to San Fran again with the same budget, I will stay somewhere with more oomph or more personality.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomppayne
Reviews.Content: What a great advert for the hotel brand. A, sadly, very short 4 night stay here was very enjoyable. A very modern, beautifully decorated throughout and very helpful staff. My first trip to San Fran was met with an early problem. Do I stay at the brand new Intercontinental San Fran on Howard St or do I opt for the historic Intercontinental Mark Hopkins. I decided to go with the newer one as my taste is in the more modern looking hotels. I did visit the MH and have written a review on probably the best location in the city. The Intercontinental San Francisco had some amazingly helpful staff, made me feel very valued as a Platinum Ambassador member and did make all the effort I could have asked for. The barman also knows his drinks and the bar itself is a great place to unwind. My only gripe was no access to the club lounge even though I had kindly been upgraded to a club room. Otherwise I cannot fault my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: regisr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco for 6 nights for business and leisure. The hotel is well situated near Market Street, Powell Station, Union Square and the Moscone Center. The room are very large, clean and comfortable. It is not the best Intercontinental I have stayed but nevertheless I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerber77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is impeccably maintained. The club room and swimming pool are an added bonus. The front desk staff, in an effort to seem efficient, are sort of unfriendly and more interested in dealing with the convention crowd, but that's okay, we weren't needy travelers. Our man, Luis in the Club Room was fantastic, really friendly and helpful. The restaurant was nice as well. They checked our bags when we arrived too early for check-in and retrieved them quickly. Our hair dryer was broken, and they quickly provided us with another one when requested. We got a great deal on our room rate thru Expedia. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel bad clientele”
Reviews.Author: skirkla1
Reviews.Content: As usual of late had to request the removal of all the feather under and over the bed, which was accomodated very nicely and quickly. Surprised the housekeeper put a sheet on top with a hole in it. Stayed over a weekend when a large football party group created all night disturbances with no intervention by hotel staff. Brought it to the attention of security and subsequent nights not quite so bad. Very nice hotel, well trained staff, good location, poor choice by management to book groups of rowdies in what should be a four star hotel. Don't think this hotel should charge for internet access....nickel and dime mentality not part of a four or five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5Continents
Reviews.Content: Well located, iconic hotel in SF. Best breakfast view you could get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WallabyGold
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably more for business travellers than holiday makers, but that said it was perfectly adequate for us. Front desk service was a bit snooty but otherwise teh service was great. We had room service the first night we were there as we had arrived late and it was great, but a little expensive. Location wise, it's walking distance (just) to union square and AT&T park, plus the westfield mall is close by as well, so pretty good for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Some "good surprises"”
Reviews.Author: CEUS69
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located within walking distance of Union Square, cable cars, next to Moscone convention center...many quaint restaurants and pubs as you walk around the block...big city block however...wear comfortable walking shoes! The surprise? The excellent host bar and treats on the spa floor that we came across quite by accident...top shelf liquor with mini delectable rack of lambettes on the day we dropped by...unexpected and welcome surprise to conclude our day! Our accomodations were very comfortable, clean....extra pillows provided...loved our stay...will come again! Agree with others, park around the corner for more reasonable fees...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, attentive staff, great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: ATXworldwide
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business recently. Check in was very smooth, and I was upgraded to a room on a higher floor because of my Priority Club status. The room had a great view of the south bay and South San Francisco, including AT&T baseball park. Seeing the fog blow in at night was very nice. The staff were attentive when I was going out from the hotel, telling the taxi driver my destination which is a classy touch anywhere that can avoid miscommunication. I didn't use any concierge services although I noticed many other guests taking advantage of their services. My flight left very late, well after checkout time, and the staff kept my bag secure while I enjoyed the city and later spent some time in their lobby and enjoyed their restaurant which was excellent although pricey. I would definitely stay here again, between this hotel and Mark Hopkins, the other Intercontinental Hotel in SF that's a few blocks away on top of Nob Hill, it's a hard choice because they're both very nice. For what it's worth, it's much easier to walk from this hotel because you're not at the top of a steep hill.

Reviews.Title: “Is what it is !”
Reviews.Author: Ramsfan14
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is located directly next to the San Francisco convention center on Howard Street, approximately two blocks from Union Square. the hotel is clean, well appointed and staff are helpful and businessllike. The electronic minibar is technology gone a muck. Valet parking $50+, a recommendation is go online and make a reservation at 533 Jones street, covered parking $17 with in and out privleges, approximately 4 blocks away from hotel. The location is somewhat of a concern, at night the streets located near the hotel are vacant from pedestrian traffic with exception of individuals who create an atmosphere which is prevelent throught most of the city. Big cities are what they are, Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice outside of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: Don't park at the hotel, use the Mission Street Garage behind the hotel. It will save you 20-30 dollars per day. It is perfectly within walking distance from Market Street/Union Square. And if the distance is still too far, there are plenty of shopping to do in between. The corner junior suite is big, and the wrap around floor to ceiling windows allow you to watch the fog roll in and out of the city. The lobby can get crowded and noisy at night (bar/restaurant). We walked around town, visited the museum of modern art, and ate at the restaurants along SOMA. The area is relatively safe at night, provided you don't wander West or South of the hotel. Overall, you will get a bigger room for the price when compared to the hotels located immediately around Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Please people save yourselves stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: petewithleese
Reviews.Content: My wife and checked in for three nights for a special occasion. The room we were allocated was small, dirty (tiles around bath were very stained and uninviting) We were upgraded once I'd pointed out our dissatisfaction but other than being given a bigger floorspace there were no obvious benefits. The staff were tired, at times rude, totally uninterested. We had the worst checkout experience of more than twenty years worth of numerous multi destination trips with a member of staff walking away and slamming a door after questioning a phone charge to our room that was incorrect. This place seems to get rammed by outsiders for the weekend breakfast buffett and as a result runs out of dishes unless you get up early. The swimming pool and spa is just horrible... a forty foot long but three foot wide pool is coupled with a dirty jacuzzi that only has room for six people. Please if you read this..... find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Wonderful Room! Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: JackiG82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental in San Francisco and were surprised by how nice and accommodating the staff was. From the valet, to the front desk, bartender, and concierge, all were very courteous and very helpful. Our room was perfect and had a great view of the water. The bathroom was large enough for both of us to get ready and the bed was soooo comfortable! I'm also still craving the coffee we had there, I think we may need to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “We will never go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeanInMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My partner and I reserved our room at The Intercontinental San Francisco three months before our check-in date, and our intention was to have a bit of romantic extravagance on our one night in SF. After a 16 hour flight from Melbourne to Los Angeles and a long drive up Interstate 5 (our onward journey after SF was to Burning Man Festival and we had collected our van from LAX), heavy traffic on the Bay Bridge meant that we didn't actually arrive at the hotel until 7:30pm, well after their 3pm check-in time. We had valet parking included in our rate, which was for a king room with two walls of glass promising great views over San Francisco (fog meant we probably wouldn't have seen much anyway), and after handing over our van we were greeted by a nice enough gentleman at front desk. He informed us the room we had reserved was not available yet due to the hotel's loyalty program, which includes 4pm check-outs, and that loyalty member had been in the room that day. That is all well and good, but by 7:30 one would think housekeeping would have had ample time to service the room - the gentleman invited us to enjoy two free (standard) drinks in the bar. Nice sentiment, but after our drive all we really felt like was a shower. He showed us to a table and promised to get back to us regarding the status of our room. We would have been in the bar for 30 minutes before we decided to go outside to get some air. When we came back inside the man who was helping us was nowhere to be seen, so we took a seat in the waiting area by the concierge desk in full view of the front desk area. The hotel's lobby and bar area are vast, but we thought sitting in such an obvious place we would be recognized and helped out. After waiting for about 20 minutes, to no avail, I approached the front desk to see if anything had happened. I explained the situation to the lady, and she had no idea what I was talking about and barked at me to see my ID. As someone who works in the hotel industry, I was in shock as to how this woman thought she had the right stuff to work in a frontline customer service role. My initial patience about the situation turned to rage. She said they had a room ready, which in no way resembled the one we had reserved, and although much larger was on a lower floor with views of the concrete buildings surrounding the hotel. I snatched the room keys and stormed off. From my point of view, the initial check-in experience dictates to a great extent the overall enjoyment of the stay, and our experience pretty much sunk the ship before it even left port. The room we had been "upgraded" to was large, with a beautiful big bathroom that we loved, but somehow the trial we went through getting there had sullied the entire experience. The staff at this hotel need a lesson in internal communication and a major rethink of their approach to customer service. Maybe we just got hit with a double whammy of two people completely frazzled by their jobs. The excuse they gave us for our room not being ready basically said to us, "our rewards members are more important than you and your $400 is meaningless to us in the grand scheme of things". I don't see how a hotel can expand their customer base when they are sidelining potential new members to pander to their current ones. We are both really patient people and this experience turned us into fuming messes. We will definitely be returning to San Francisco, but there is no way we will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: sports
Reviews.Content: After a mix up at another hotel we ended up the InterContinental. We had no reservations but they were able to find us a room and we were checked in and in the room in 15 minutes. The room was very clean and bright and the bathroom was very nice. The front desk was always friendly and helpful and doormen always had a smile. It was my husband and my birthday and they sent a nice pastry selection to our room. I agree with the other reviewers that the parking fee is a lot and should be reduced for people staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NO SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: JGonzalez30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a centralized location. The service at this hotel was horrible. I arrived half and hour prior to the 3pm check in time. The service clerk was polite and told me my room was not ready yet. I sat down in the lobby right in front of her. An hour later I checked again and was told my room was not ready and it would take 30-45 minutes. After an hour 2 hours of my original arrival and exhausted I checked again if my room was ready it, it finally was. Had I not asked I would of been waiting longer after two clerks saw me and was sitting infront of them waiting for my room. When checking out the clerk told me they had a big conference and guest checked out late. I was never offered another room, but was charged as if I had checked in at the regular time, and never got an apology just an explanation. I have had better luck with hotel service in Las Vegas on a busy holiday weekend than I have ever had at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel but bad neighborhood and unnecessarily expensive WiFi”
Reviews.Author: warlicht
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night at the end of a business trip to the Bay Area. The hotel is up to the Intercontinental standard with nice and spacious room and an elegantly designed lobby, bar and restaurant area. The people at the front desk are helpful and take good care of the guests. A couple of things make me not want to return to this hotel though. First of all the area around the hotel is not great. Their are many homeless people around the hotel and on the way back to hotel I walked one block too far and tried to cut back to the main street but had to walk through an incredibly sketchy street with drug dealers and junks - this street is about 2-3 minutes from the hotel entrance. Good thing it was during the day. Second of all, the WiFi is 14.95 USD a day. This might be one of my pet peeves but I think that any hotel at this level should have free WiFi included, possibly with a premium paid service. Lastly, the bellman was not very helpful when I asked him where I could get a quick breakfast and return within 40 minutes. He kept insisting I should eat in the hotel, but I did not want to pay 28USD for a quick bite and ended up looking for something else. There are literally 4-5 decent breakfast places that are about 5 minutes walking from the hotel. I think there are better options in the same category and considering the terrible neighborhood I would pay more for a better location as well.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for conference groups”
Reviews.Author: kk-trebla
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental San Francisco is big, conference hotel, a bit overwhelming during private holidays. Located in the central place of SF with good airport connection by BART. I recommend rooms on club floors with the nice view on the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel . . . for the most part”
Reviews.Author: rocsmom0304
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on the 27th floor with my hubby and two daughters, ages 7 and 8. The rooms are great, our view was amazing! Super comfortable, spacious and very clean overall. The closets are nice sized and we were able to put our 3 suitcases, 3 backpacks and 10 pairs of shoes on the floor with enough space to get around the room. My only complaint of the rooms would be that the beds are soft, so if you like your beds soft, you will love these. For me, they were too soft and I woke up w/a little back ache every morning, but with all the walking we did, I still managed to sleep very well. We used the pool and hot tub all but one night. The pool is nice, but is a lap pool, not a play/splash pool. It would have been nice if there was a play pool, but so be it. If you happen to go while there are lap swimmers, playing is not appreciated. We were able to play some of the time and it worked out well as my girls ended up swimming laps with me the rest of the time -- which they found rather fun! The hot tub was nice after long days of walking! I did use the fitness center twice and it was nice sized with newer equipment, television, towels and water. The concierge (don't remember his name) was nice, but I had done enough of my own research - thanks to TA - to know where I wanted to go for meals, sights, etc. We never ate in the hotel as there was always business people in suits and such at the lobby bar and restaurant. We always ventured out and about to the local eateries as there are so many great options!! Yes, parking is an additional $52 (we flew in) and WiFi is also additional (which we didn't get since I can find everything on my phone! :)). Surely a bummer, but also typical of SF hotels like the InterContinental. A great stay -- no major complaints. We would stay again should we be back in the Bay Area!

Reviews.Title: “Supreme hotel with ideal location and high quality”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: InterCon San Francisco is a true international quality first class hotel with plenty of good amenities/features and with an ideal location next to Westfield Shopping Center. We visit it as tourist and it was great to be so close to Bloomingdales (where you as a hotel guest get 15% off) as well as the cable bus line and walking distance to everything. Both Avis and Hertz are close to when you need a rental car (I sincerely hope you not will rent at the Hertz station around the corner at Marriott - they are so rude there). Concierge service is top notch. They arranged everything prior our arrival in the best way, however they was really busy up-on front. I recommend to take the city combo tour with Alcatraz when you are here, they pick you up just outside the hotel. Had a spacious Club Room at 33rd floor, with everything you need in the room to have a comfortable stay. View is nice from top-floors (even if I think that you can get better views at other hotels since the neighborhood is almost only parkinglots and small houses). I'm glad I didn't had a room on lower level. Bathroom very nice and plenty of space, I like that it was both bathtub and separate shower. The Aromatheraphy amenities are of the best I have tried in a hotel. Overall well main tended and high standard. Club Lounge is a great value. They serve both breakfast that is amazing, as well daily soup for lunch, afternoon tea and hours devours in the evening. We didn't use the hours devours or afternoon tea but I'm sure it was as the same high quality as breakfast. Friendly service all over and check-in was very efficient. Large fitness center that was open 24 hours as well as a pool. Visit the spa, good treatments and relaxed atmosphere. But if you are a couple, it is boring, no space where you can relax together prior/post your massage treatments. Excellent room service with a lovely ice-cream I truly recommend. Had dinner at the Luce, it was very good but not as impressive as I thought with their 1 Michellin star. I'm sure I will be back to San Francisco and will not at all hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Double Check Your Bill”
Reviews.Author: Charles M
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night Staycation package. It is suppose to include parking and breakfast, including gratuity, each day. We were billed for one breakfast and three gratuities - totalling $112 in extra charges. Also we did not get the view we had been promised. Our friends had the same experience. I don't return to hotels I can't trust.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE staff”
Reviews.Author: msamrca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It looks great, it is pretty much in the center of the city (easy access to everything), nice decor, super comfy beds, nice views, etc. BUT there were major cons that really disappointed. First off, I don't understand why no one has complained about parking. It's ridiculous. Overnight parking at the hotel for guests is $60 per night. When we asked about this to the valet we just got attitude and a rude backlash, "Everyone pays for parking in SF." Really?! Yes, I understand parking is scarce and expensive in SF, but that is no excuse for (1) not accommodating guests who are paying a hefty price for the room, and (2) the unnecessary attitude. We parked one block away (off Mission and 5th) for 25/night. Another con was the room size. It was SMALL! But we could deal. What we had a hard time dealing with, however, was the snotty attitude of the person who checked us in and hotel staff in general. SO RUDE! We we were told we could do early check-in. Well, when we got there the guy checking us in was not friendly or inviting AT ALL, told us we couldn't check-in early and proceeded to tell us we were basically lying to him about having received approval prior. We were appalled (so embarrassing since other guests were standing around). Long story short, we eventually got a room. Throughout our trip, there were no greeters, people opening the door, etc. Everyone we came across just looked the other way. I don't think I would come back to this hotel (even though they have everything else going for them) solely because of the snotty, demeaning, rude service. It is completely unnecessary and we would much rather stay at a different hotel that doesn't treat their guests like lesser beings (and we'd probably pay less too).

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristinaR007
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great experience. Check in was smooth. Room spacious and well-appointed. Bathroom nice with enough counter space for all of my toiletries and necesssaries. Fitness center was very good, although room key was temperamental. Room service pricey, but very tasty. Bed was wonderful. Super sleeping! Elevators prompt. Location near Moscone and shopping very convenient. Faxes were available quickly upon reciept (and that's not common). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Koter
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I was on a Mon-Fri business trip and it had everything I was looking for. A short walk to great shopping in Union Square, a great gym, good bar with friendly staff to help you unwind after a long day. The bed was super comfortable the bathroom was good and the room was just fine. I was on the 10th floor without a spectacular view but I did not spend a lot of timing looking out my window. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but rip-off”
Reviews.Author: treddd
Reviews.Content: 8 bucks for a bottle of water and having to pay for wifi (seems standard in san francisco but ridiculous anywhere else in california) - ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 20-something-vaca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb -- everything from the staff to the linens. The only draw back is some of the local color in the neighborhood. I didn't feel unsafe walking around by myself during the day, but I also wouldn't have gone walking south except that it was the direction of my office. There are some wonderful restaurants near the hotel -- my favorite was the Thirsty Bear, a local bew pub with a delightful tapas menu. Nice lap pool and gym, good (expensive) room service and restaurant, friendly and helpful staff, quiet rooms (great sleep!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Teryx510
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice but I really feel nickel and dimed after my stay. Upon arrival we were informed that there really weren't any good parking options nearby except to use the valet service at about $55 per night. Seriously?! $55 to park my car! When we finally made it to our room we were informed that wifi would be $15 extra and that if we even picked anything up from the minibar we would be charged for it and would have to dispute it to have the charge removed from our bill. All in all, it was a nice hotel but I didn't really enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “The club lounge is totally worth the extra cost.”
Reviews.Author: headebb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in a club room on the top floor (33). The room is good with a spacious bathroom. Did miss a place to store our luggage, since there are no wardrobes in the room. The staff is friendly but a little irregular in service level. The club lounge which is included if you stay in a club room is very good. They serve a good breakfast and it's a great place to plan your day before heading out on the town. In the evening it's a nice place to have a drink (complimentary) and unwind. The pool area is not that good. No changing rooms which means that you have to change in your room and then take the elevator. Altough we stayed at the top floor, you could hear sirens and other city noises throughout the night, but I guess that comes with the location so not really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good property, excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: eletnahc
Reviews.Content: As expected, the property is very good. The room and bathroom are excellent, spacious and comfortable. We got an excellent corner room on one of the higher floors with a fantastic view (one afternoon you could see the fog rolling in over the city). The hotel is quite close to Market Street (one of the shopping areas) and one of the main cable car turnarounds (quite fascinating to watch). In general, I found the hotels in San Francisco to be expensive and the Intercontinental rates were better when compared with similar properties but it was without breakfast and without the internet. The concierge, Bill Sutton, definitely deserves our praise for recommending some really good breakfast diners and cafes. He also recommended and booked a really good day trip to Napa/Sonoma Valley. We visited three different wineries and it was a day well spent. Thanks Bill. We also ordered room service on two occasions and found the food to be good and the portions quite large.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Ralff
Reviews.Content: To start, as a Platinum Ambassador I did not expect to be on the 8th floor with a view of Moscone's concrete and the bright all night lights of the "public sapce" area on the 6th floor. Good size room. Water diffuser in the sink tap is such a low flow that your toothbrush will not clean - painful. Restaurant is very good and very expensive - weird first course - menu is on line. Sommelier provides good recommendations. Because of our location, it was very quiet. Club Lounge is very good, with great selections and helpful personnel. This is a convention hotel. Reviews on parking and internet are correct. Use the packages.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect San Francisco Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lily1646
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental San Francisco is the perfect place to stay in San Francisco with wonderful rooms, great service and a terrific location. Itâ€™s only a short walk from BART at Westfields Mall or a very quick taxi ride from SFO. Everything is reached conveniently from the hotel on foot, especially the Moscone Center which is adjacent to the hotel, plus Union Square and all the shops around it, Chinatown, the Giants ballpark, Nob Hill, etc. The Fishermanâ€™s Wharf area is easily reached by vintage streetcars that are close by on Market St. Everyone in the hotel was exceedingly warm and welcoming throughout our stay including the greeters at the door, the bellmen, concierges, restaurant staff, and the congenial staff members who work in the Club Lounge, etc. We have stayed here a number of times and everyone with whom we had contact has been unfailingly attentive on every visit. The room was immaculate with lovely and comfortable furnishings that were nicely arranged. The bed was super comfy and the bath linens are luxurious. The floor-to-ceiling windows ensure the rooms are bright and most rooms have outstanding views. The Club Intercontinental was fabulous and always had something complimentary to eat along with a variety of beverages. For breakfast there were lots of fresh fruits, pastries, eggs, cheese, smoked salmon, meats, etc, and, on the weekends, there were mimosas, too. Yummy soup, bread and crackers were available midday and in the afternoon, tea sandwiches and sweets were served. For evening cocktails, there were hot and cold appetizers and a great assortment of wines along with the makings for mixed drinks. We highly recommend including the Club when staying here. The hotel focuses on being environmentally friendly, has the highest level of â€œGreen Buildingâ€� certification that is possible, and it has a special a partnership with Zipcar to benefit hotel guests who want an economical car rental in the form of an energy-saving Prius. Weâ€™ve stayed in a number of other San Francisco luxury hotels and now wonâ€™t stay anywhere but Intercontinental Hotel San Francisco on Howard Street..

Reviews.Title: “Would Only Stay Here on A Deal”
Reviews.Author: YukonSarah
Reviews.Content: For a 4.5 star hotel they are lacking. I called ahead and requested no feather bedding. Checked-in at 2:00pm and reminded them again. When we returned at 11:00pm that night there was still feather bedding, It took them almost an hour and two visits to get us non-feather bedding, The charge for internet (wireless or regular) or to use the business center is outrageous for a hotel of this size and reputation. We were on the 7th floor which had a lot of street noise so request higher up. Our room had a connecting door to another room and we could hear everything in there. The only positive is the location, Close to Union square and transportation. Super easy to go any where on public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of an unexpected (and rare) holiday and decided to live it up a little. Although I tend to shop for the most inexpensive rooms, I saw that this hotel offered a spectrum of standard, superior, deluxe - mostly having to do with how high up in the tower your room would be. So I splurged on the deluxe room. I figured it would be fun to be on the 24-30th floor. When we arrive, the front desk clerk gave us a room on the 9th floor - I said, but what about the deluxe room? she said we'd been "upgraded" to a corner executive room. Well big deal. True, it was in a corner, with nice views out to two very unattractive parking lots. Couldn't see anything of the city - or anything interesting at all, for that matter. And, as far as I could tell, it was no larger or more plush than any other room on the floor. So much for my splurge. We had gotten a special deal via my company which advertised a free upgrade to the "club" floor. But when we tried to go there, we were informed (very graciously) that this wasn't the case. All we got was free internet service - which was nice, to be sure - but not quite the same thing. I saw that they would deliver selected newspapers to our door each morning, so I ordered the NY Times. They did warn us that it wouldn't come until 8-10 am (what's up with that? At the San Jose Fairmont, where I often stay, the NYT is delivered about 5am). But it didn't matter - we never got a paper at all! The room had a very fancy automated coffee maker, but no way at all to make tea. Why are hotels so prejudiced against tea drinkers? On the good side, the pool was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LightningMcQueen79
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time in the Intercontinental San Fran. I was travelling for 5 weeks and this was the best hotel I stayed in on my whole trip. I will definitely stay there again and I can definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Best Room Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzardbreath
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there after attending Outside Lands. We weren't able to find a cab after the show, so by the time we got back to the hotel we were exhausted! We had not had dinnerâ€”except for some bites and we had been drinking (a lot!). I decided to order some room service â€“ we ordered the Tuna on white beans and a salad and chocolate mousse. The Tuna was amazing â€“ I never know what to expect with room service because even when the hotel has a Michelin rated restaurant, sometimes the food from in-room dining is mediocre at best.
