It was the perfect late night meal! Everything else was great as well. Check in was quick â€“ although we had a superior room we werenâ€™t able to get a king bed, instead had two queens, but the room was nice. The Hotel is welcoming and nicely decorated. My only complaint the whole cab situation. When I checked in they said to just call the front to have them hail me one. When I called they said I had to come down and have the Bellman do it, which was fine except that the Bellman didnâ€™t seem to know how to stay organized when hailing a cab for multiple parties. Yelling out â€œwhoâ€™s nextâ€� and performing more of a stand up routine than his job. I give him zero stars. Overall a good experience and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: violeto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental with my son and his friend both 11 years old. Our plan was to enjoy a day in the city and the next day take in a Giants game. The hotel is very posh and contemporary. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the time we arrived. We had a standard room with two queen beds and I would say it was average size and the bathroom was quite small. The boys used the pool for a brief period but being that it was indoor and more of a lap pool it didn't last long. The location of the hotel is perfect if you are planning on going to Union Square and it was also the closest hotel I could find to AT&T Park. The down side of this hotel was the cost in comparison to the accomodations. I expected a little more spaciousness with the room and bathroom. On a side note the parking is almost $60 per day. Overall the hotel was very nice but a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER! RIPOFF ELITIST ARTISTS”
Reviews.Author: Peggy L
Reviews.Content: I would put a zero but there is a button. They hide the cost of removing items from the fridge bc it's not posted on the fridge but in the room service book. If you are not paying attention then you will be charged for stuff MOVED in the fridge due to computer installed in fridge. BEWARE ESPECIALLY IF YOU HAVE KIDS! We got our room via priceline. As soon as we checked in it felt like we were treated differently bc we were priceline customers at the front desk. Then there is no sign on the fridge and we saw all these cute little bottles of liquor so we took them out to look at them. Luckily I read how much they cost bc it tells you in the menu binder that if you move anything in the fridge they will charge you. We had a hundred dollar tab that they would not remove until we left. (TOTALLY TRYING TO RIP OF PEOPLE WHO ARE NOT PAYING ATTENTION â€“ they charge $32 just to have an empty fridge if that is what you want! WTH) I went down the first time and the snobby guy we had checking in was like what's your room number and before we were even finished said next. I said did you get our number, he said I'll take care of it. The same day I check after dinner, it's still on there. Checkout time I go get it taken care of the lady says sarcastically, you moved everything? I'll take care if it after they check the room. I tell her we are from out of town and I'll wait in the lobby for it to be done bc of experience yesterday. She looks annoyed and says I believe you and takes it off. I ask for a receipt she says I cant give u one. I ask for her name, she then prints one and tells me May, like the month. Thinking I'm stupid, the girl working the desk next to her laughs at me and I tell them that's rude. She responds I'm not rude and if you want to talk to my manager she's right there. I hate stuck up service ppl. Worst experience of my life in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but geared to business”
Reviews.Author: jennToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: As expected, the hotel had fine service but it seems better suited to business travellers. Unless on expense account, most travellers wouldn't eat at hotel. Though we enjoyed our stay, we might opt for more of a boutique/more intimate place next time. Rooms are nice, of course, but there was no bathtub and of course no fridge, just the minibar. The Intercontinental is great for first-time visitors who want no surprises but on future trips we might choose one of the many other hotels in the area. The Moscone Centre area was clean and safe and close to restaurants, the ballpark.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh-did I really pay for this?”
Reviews.Author: GlassHalfFull17
Reviews.Content: The only thing I agree with is that the Intercontinental has a great location. It's a short walk to Union Square. Arrived at this hotel for a transition in between San Francisco and the drive to Napa after a cross country flight. PARKING IS $52 A NIGHT!! Maybe it's because I'm not an urban diva, but this was appalling!! Totally ridiculous. I love my morning coffee-no coffeemaker in our room! and if you think you'll get a bottle of water on the house, think again-you will pay around $6 for in room refreshments. So-WIFI is readily available at most hotels now at no cost. This hotel charges around $14 for 24 hour access. Again-are you kidding me?? That's more than I pay monthly at home! You call yourself a luxury hotel?? Please!! Save yourself the time-spend a little extra and stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive extra's”
Reviews.Author: Laur3
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is very nice it is still a block away from the action and parking was $52!!! We were surprised since the hotel we stayed at the night before included parking. th Breakfast very expensive - my husband shook his head to coffee and they poured him orange juice - $6! $45 for bacon and eggs for 2. We had an excellent Bellman Armando - friendly - thorough and very professional. The conceriege helped make reservations.

Reviews.Title: “You'll find every amenity in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: OBD2142
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the Moscone Center. Nice rooms w/ everything you need and more. Huge towels. Nice soaps. Robes, shower caps. Big TV, sewing kits, coffee maker, scale (who wants this?), magnifying mirror etc etc. Only hiccup was I had to call/visit desk 3 times to have dirty drapes cleaned over 2 days. I'd consider this a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and overall great value”
Reviews.Author: worldisabook
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a base for our girlfriends' weekend trip to SF and Napa. The location was great and was down the street from the Westfield Mall. There were a variety of stores around the area which was a big hit during a girls trip. There were also plenty of restaurants nearby including a Buca di Beppo across the street. It was within a few blocks from the Powell BART station and the Powell and Market street cable cars. The rooms were pretty spacious and beautifully decorated and were very clean. We all slept comfortably on the beds. We thought we had 2 queen beds during reservation but it turned out to be double beds. The bathroom had a sliding glass door with no lock. There was no bathtub but a pretty spacious shower. There was plenty of storage in the room and bathroom considering there were four ladies staying inside with a lot of accessories. Service was absolutely wonderful from the concierge staff who helped us out with free tastings in Napa to recommending places to eat around the neighborhood. The front desk were all courteous and helpful accomodating us by placing our other friends across the room from us. The bellmen always greeted us with smiles and were more than willing to help us out. We would absolutely stay here again for its convenient location and great overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4 star in good location with good service”
Reviews.Author: mcdermov
Reviews.Content: This hotel is towards the bottom of Nob Hill, near Chinatown, and walking distance from Union Square. We visited Fisherman's Wharf twice and I prefer the location we stayed in and would certainly use it as a base for any future trip to San Francisco. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. The rooms were comfortable. We did not eat in the hotel but got very good recommendations from front desk staff and the concierge including Cafe de la Press which is four blocks away. We had breakfast there, and although not inexpensive at $20 per head was excellent including the fluffiest pancakes I have ever tasted. Two negatives. (1) The Wi-Fi was not included in the room charge. (2) I phoned the concierge desk one morning to ask if there was a half price theatre ticket outlet in San Francisco. The person who answered the phone said the concierge would be in at 11 am and would know, but I explained I was about to go out and therefore they asked another staff memeber who said no. I went ahead and booked full price tickets on line, but in Union Square that afternoon, saw a half-price ticket booth similar to the one in Times Square in New York. If I had bought my tickets for Billy Elliot there it would have saved me $200! I got advice from the concierge when he was available about other matters and he was excellent. However I would have been better off if the staff just professed ignorance about the existence of the booth as I would have searched further for it.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Favorite Hotel in SF!”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times with my family and my parents stay here every time they are in SF. We absolutely love this hotel. It's a newer hotel that was built in SF a couple of years ago and has floor to ceiling windows in each of the rooms. The decor is modern and extremely nice and luxurious. The service is great and the food at Luce was amazing as well. This is a definitely must stay in SF as most other hotels in SF are fairly older. The quality and value that you get with this hotel is top notch. The location is the best and within walking distance to Union Square. The views from the hotel are amazing. I really wouldn't recommend anywhere else to stay in SF. It's our favorite place when visiting the city! I've also visited the spa once and it was an amazing experience! New and nice and complete with the floor to ceiling windows.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Cathy2241
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Room was very nice and bed comfortable with nice linens. Did not think there was coffee in the room but found it in the mini bar as we were ready to checkout. Very nice well stocked mini bar. Coffee and coffee pot was in bar but it was complimentary. We did not think to look in bar for coffee. Valet Parking is available but pricy. $50.00 per day. No other choices for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enzodamico11
Reviews.Content: Welcome at Front Desk lacked warmth and welcome. The agent did not provide any eye contact, seemed a bit disheveled and showed no personality. Our room was on the 31st floor (Concierge level). The room is clean, new and comfortable. Bathroom had a seperate tub and shower with good sink space. We enjoyed a drink in the lobby before heading out for dinner. The Bar has a nice theme 888 Grappa. Many beautiful Grappa bottled displayed with some interesting Grappa Cocktails in the menu. Our drinks were on the strong side. Sleep was nice. Bed is comfortable and nice soft linens. Breakfast in the morning at Luce was disapointing. Service was very friendly and efficient. The disapointment came from the food itself. When going through the buffet we noticed no pancakes or waffles. There was however a lable for Maple Syrup, but no syrup was there. We asked our server and he very soon brought pancakes and warm syrup to the table. The buffet seems to have problem holding the heat in the food. All food items (Eggs, sausage, bacon and oatmeal) had were too cold. Check out was efficient, but again lacked personality and sincerity.

Reviews.Title: “Pay Us, Pay Us More, Pay Us Even More, Now Give Us All Your Money”
Reviews.Author: SFINTCONCRAP
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in this having forked out for valet parking at the highest rate known to man. Want to use WIFi in this hotel? Fork our $15 Bucks, oh got a IPhone fork out another $15 bucks , Wife got a phone, fork out another $15 Bucks, - The front desk just called to tell me that having 5 wifi devices was excessive (for a family) - WTF , This hotel has raised opening your wallet into an art form. $8 for the water in the room. Walk past the Mini Bar - get charged. It should be illegal for this hotel to use the word Guest - Instead it should just be allowed to use the term SUCKERS

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: magsB
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Intercontinental after a long flight. Check in was quick and easy. Had a room on the 22nd floor and a surprise bottle of bubbly!!!!!!!!!!!!! It was our anniversary. The room was a great size and the bed was very big and comfortable. The lifts are very quick and efficient which is important to me as I hate elevators! The bathroom and the room were spotless. There are plenty of towels etc. We used the gym every day and it was one of the best we have used. We did not eat in the hotel as it is rather expensive plus there are so many restaurants to try. The staff are very friendly and efficient. Whenever we asked for advice they were very helpful. It is close to everything and we walked everywhere while in San Francisco. There is a shopping centre two blocks away and we had breakfast there a couple of times. There are many restaurants close by which you can walk to. The bar is very welcoming and the staff friendly. Some lovely cocktails. Excellent hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for convention area”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: A nice convention hotel, not a bad location for site seeing if you don't mind a good walk. Impressively green.

Reviews.Title: “Continues great”
Reviews.Author: Albina75
Reviews.Content: We have been at Intercontinental San Francisco,Howard St, for the second time and the Hotel continues to be a great choice. The rooms are spotless, modern, large. Consierges are the best, special mention to Ken, always willing to add that special touch to your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ryhy
Reviews.Content: The Inter Continental was a great highlight to our trip. We stayed on the gold floor which has a lounge and it was great. There was a good breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea as well as h'orderves plus dessert at night. We hardly ate out and if you make the effort to come back or just don't eat out you will save a ton and will still be able to enjoy splendid food. Don't worry about crowds as if it is full just ask if not already given one, for a breakfast voucher for the main restaurant on the lobby. I have to admit it is a little bit better as the place is nicer and there are a few more selections however it does cost about $30 per person for breakfast. ( a family of 4 or five, thats already almost the cost of the gold floor per day, extra). The hotel was in a good location about five to ten minute walk from Union Square however the view isn't the best. There is a shortage of taxis in the city at points so do be aware that it may be a 15- 20 minute wait for a taxi even being a hotel. We got a deal on the hotel and if you can too then its if definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: flyhigh1988
Reviews.Content: We vacationed here in October with 3 teens and a pre teen, the staff was incredibly helpful even giving my daughters inside scoop on great shopping places, were right around the corner from a LARGE mall and many eating establishments, it was a perfect location with ultra clean rooms! We loved every minute of our stay and will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: KevinTexas
Reviews.Content: I traveled to SF over Thanksgiving with my significant other. I booked a Junior Suite at the ICH. The hotel exterior is very modern with a sleek, blue glass (it's not privacy glass, so keep your shades closed at night ;)). The lobby is very nice with modern furniture and a nice bar. The check-in process was a little annoying. Priority Club Plat folks, don't expect an upgrade. The man who checked me in was borderline rude. I asked for a high floor since this was my birthday weekend and first time in SF (it really was!). He was annoyed at the way I booked the rooms (I had to make several reservation adjustments from changing plans, so I had 3 different reservations for the four nights). Then he said, "as a courtesy" I could keep the same room, but it was on the lower floor. When I got to the room, it had a breath-taking view of an exterior wall. I left my luggage in the room and went out for awhile. I came back and called down to the front desk. The woman I spoke with was very nice and offered me a room on the 32nd floor with a view. I was very happy with the move. See the pictures! The room is very nice and new. I had a corner JR Suite which has floor-to-ceiling windows, is shaped in an L with the shorter part of the L as the bathroom. Even the bathroom had floor to ceiling windows (remember to close the shades at night! haha) Through one window we had a view of the bay and the Bay Bridge, the other had views of downtown. All of the furniture was new and the bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was very nice with a separate shower and tub and organic bath products. Be careful of the minibar items, especially if you have children. They're within reach and charge when you pick them up. The hotel charges for internet, we used the WiFi on our phones. The hotel also charges for parking. The hotel is near the convention center. Overall, with the exception of the individual who checked me in, the ICH SF was awesome. I will probably not stay any where else the next time I go to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option if you are at the Mascone Center”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel because of the location, the gym, and the amenities. The spa is great. The key to really enjoying the Intercontinental is to be an Ambassador. You pay for this, but if you travel a lot like me, the free internet, fruit and water in the room, free upgrades, and free movie are a definitely perk. And, you get a free night a year at any Intercontinental. My room was great, with a beautiful view and a roomy bathroom. I had a nice fluffy robe, a corner room that was very quiet, and everything was clean and very tidy. I would definitely stay in again (it is close to the BART too, makes for easy transport to and from the airport at a reasonable price).

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, service, beds, everything”
Reviews.Author: bryggjaren
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a 7 night stay at this hotel. Dined at the restaurant for dinner twice which was excellent, breakfast was good though pricey. As others commented the internet fees are annoying especially at this price point and near Silicon Valley. Fantastic beds and service. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nickeled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: hola_y_saludos
Reviews.Content: i was here 3 nights with my family. the room was lovely and spacious, the beds and pillows very comfortable. the service was friendly and welcoming. the kids loved the pool! (though my son had some kind of allergic reaction to the pool disenfectant). the only complaint i have is the cost of all the extras and little "amenities"...parking is $53 a night, internet service in the room is $15 a night... the cost of items in the mini bar, and in the bar itself are ridiculous (4$ for a glass of milk!)... though i know almost everyone charges for these things, the intercontinental seems to charge even more!

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdbrick
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every time we go up to San Francisco and it is still a great hotel, especially for the price. Our family stayed in a suite which had plenty of room and was nicely appointed. We had great service for our entire stay. We hadn't been there for about a year yet the doorman still remembered us and greeted us like we were long time friends. Many of the luxury hotels are much more expensive and don't have the same service and amenities of the Inter Continental. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with great spa and staff”
Reviews.Author: crock28459
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite on the concierge floor with fantastic views of the city, the spa was open to late in the night which was great for us late travelers from the east coast, the therapist was great i and in no hurry like a lot of spas. the food was great as my wife tried the Vietnamese pork belly which i had many years ago in Saigon, she was dubious but actually loved the food. the staff was great and helpful to help you navigate san fran. the trolley car end of line was only two blocks and you could go almost the entire city from the trolley. would recommend this new hotel for San Francisco to anyone regardless of business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “If you are on expenses go for it...”
Reviews.Author: loubylou_owen
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is a Modern, clean and very well appointed hotel, ideal for business customers but don't expect anything to be included in the room rate. Our room was lovely, great bed, nice bathroom etc... not a great view but then again it is a city centre hotel so that's not unusual. However I wonder how many people have drank the $8!!!!! bottle of water without realising until the bill came, the mini bar was more expensive than the Ritz in Grand Cayman and that's saying something ... Even cheap hotels usually offer a complementary bottle of water! This is NOT a cheap hotel $285 per night but you still pay an extra $14 for internet in your room (which I found very unusual for a business hotel) and there isn't even a continental breakfast included. Fine if you are on expenses but if you paying your own way watch out for those extras. Top tip: Theres a lovely cafe round the corner which offers much better value for money for breakfast and an Irish Pub on the next corner if you want a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for an average service”
Reviews.Author: Feelkarma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of a long trip in the South West. This was the most expensive hotel of the whole trip and one of the worst regarding value for money. Good things: location not bad, modern and comfortable rooms, some of the staff were extremely kind and professional. Now the rest: be aware that if you plan on using the valet parking, it will cost you about 54 USD + tax per day! What a bad first impression. We negotiated a much better deal at the public parking across the street the second day... First room was Ok, don't expect any spectacular views but as mentioned, it was comfortable. We then tried to connect to the wifi - and there came the surprise: internet will set you back 15 USD per day. Really. In a 5 star hotel. We had free high speed internet in the Desert Rose Inn in the middle of the desert for a fraction of the price! Hotels still charging anything, let alone 15 dollars, for internet just haven't figured out in which century they are evolving. Basically, this means that for basic services such as parking and wifi, you have to pay almost 100 dollars per day in addition to the price of the room. That was before we discovered hair in the bath, at which stage we had to go down to reception just to be told that they would change our room. Yes, that was the solution, move to another room... The other room was slightly bigger (which we didn't really care about) but this meant we had to repack, call the bell boy, tip again, and unpack again. All in all, settling in took us about 3 hours and was a frustrating experience. While the staff were generally polite, this is clearly a hotel targetting business travellers who do not pay for their stay, and we had the feeling (for the first time in the US) that we didn't look bankable enough. I'll stay away from Intercontinental in the future, either for business or pleasure. There are plenty of other options around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: oblimov18
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel as it was the least expensive of the 4 to 5 star hotels - still expensive at $250 pernight but worth the money - excellent location, clean and modern, good service

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: hellesheto
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel InterContinental San Francisco, and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. I've stayed in different 5 star hotel in San Francisco before, and the InterContinental has been by far the best one yet. I'm very picky when it comes to hotels, but all the details came together to make our stay here non other than perfect. Decided to visit San Francisco for a weekend celebration with my wife and wanted to make sure that everything went perfect, so after carefully doing some research to find out where I had better chances of making this happen, I decided to go with the InterContinental, and it didn't let me down a single bit, by the contrary, it exceeded my expectations. Starting with the staff, they were extremely welcoming, friendly, receptive and helpful, they even gave us a room upgrade to make sure we were pleased with our stay. The hotel rooms are very modern and luxurious, pretty big bathrooms, very comfortable beds, large windows and an astonishing view of the city. We decided to stay in one night for dinner and ordered food from Luce. It was very good, way above the average in-room dining. We had the apple cobbler for dessert and it was so delicious that we're still craving it. Yes it was that good! The lobby is spacious and beautiful. A couple of friends came over Saturday night for drinks, the bar had a lot of life and we were all impressed with the quality of the mixed drinks (ask for the 4 corner special, not on the menu!). Regarding location, the hotel is not in the most touristic area of San Francisco if you're looking to be there. However, it's an average $6 cab ride to almost all the touristic and non-touristic spots within the city and the area is still pretty nice if you decide to go for a walk. I would highly recommend staying at the InterContinental to anyone planning a visit to San Francisco, the comfort, luxury, accommodations and staff makes it worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Worst thing in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Hassaan_Abdeen
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel just for its location and the pool for my son. And I got none! 1) Its location turned out to be not the best choice to be near the Union Square! 2) The pool was very cold and the indoor pool room was freezing. Even English people refused to use it. 3) I tried complaining at the front desk but got a cold rude response. 4) the Internet is not for free while in many cafes nearby it is so! 5) if you consult with the concierge about anything you get charged to your room per minute!!! That was a first to me!!! 6) we stayed on the 28th floor yet still every couple of hours we got to hear the sirens of ambulances and fire cars! 7) on the day of the checkout (after spending a whole week there) I requested a late checkout from the front desk and the answer was "checkout is at noon, we can give you till 2pm"!!! 8) the steam room is not for free, they charge you $20 + 30% gratitude !!! 9) the only good thing was the bill men who were very friendly and kind all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: downinit
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in more historic hotels in SF, it was an interesting change of pace to stay in a new and modern hotel, with very large rooms and modern amenities. The staff was very friendly. I arrived fairly early in the morning. so the only room they had available was on a lower floor, but I still got an slight room upgrade for being a gold member. There was still a decent view from the corner window, at least, but we were facing away from the city. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was almost as large as some hotel rooms in the city, with a separate tub and shower. The location was excellent, only a block behind the shopping center, which is located on top of the Powell Street BART/MUNI station. There is really no reason to have a car in SF, as almost everything is within walking distance, or at least a short ride away on the MUNI, making their outrageous parking fees irrelevant (and all hotels have absurd fees in the area). I do wish luxury hotels would join all of the much cheaper hotels in offering free wi-fi, but there is free wi-fi a block away inside the shopping mall, so it is not a big deal. I also do not like the mini-fridge sensor, as I prefer to buy my own beverages, rather than the overpriced junk they supply. But none of my complaints are at all unique to this property, all comparable hotel chains run the same scams, since many of their customer are on expense accounts or have limitless budgets. I will not hesitate to return here on my future visits to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience last year that we returned this year”
Reviews.Author: rogue_hiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco last year for the first time and were overwhelmed with the hotel itself and its top-notch staff. As part of the Ambassador Priority Club program, we received an immediate upgrade to a beautiful room on one of the top floors during both trips. In both years, the Club lounge experience was exceptional, both for the quality of the food/drink and the superb attention by the Club staff. Special kudos to Shajina, Regina and Luis for their unfailingly cheerful demeanor and professional attention to detail! We really can't say enough about you! Needless to say, I'll be renewing my Ambassador membership and will be staying at the Intercontinental San Francisco during my next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories”
Reviews.Author: arminator1124
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, one of the best vacations "of my life", my family had a great time and every single interaction with the staff was great, they all were helpful, corteous and exceeded all of our expectations, looking forward to comeback soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: firefly_333
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the San Francisco Intercontinental July 6-10 and loved it. The hotel is modern, stylish, and very comfortable. It is centrally located which makes it easy to get around on foot or by transit. All the staff we encountered were courteous and friendly, especially Jasmin at the front desk who went out of her way to make us feel welcome and offer suggestions about where to go. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will stay there everytime we are in Frisco”
Reviews.Author: Ward B
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly people, very polite and ready to serve. We havea 4 year old son and he had a great time, they treated him like royalty. All the staff went out of their way for everything we asked. Definitely a 4 1/2 star hotel working towards a 5. Food was great, close to everywhere we wanted to see, by taxi of course. The rooms were tastefully decorated and very clean. Shower was wonderful. Beds were comfortable and staff took extra care to make sure everything was clean and to one's satisfaction. We had a room with a view of the bay. We are going to make it a family tradition to go there every Fourth of July week.

Reviews.Title: “reliably comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sister_of_fatcat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was my first InterContinental experience and I left with a favorable impression of the brand. I'd always perceived the IC as generic, professional, and a tad boring - though in reality this also translates to a reliable, pleasant and comfortable choice. If you're after a cool vibe, strong and edgy decor, something quirky and unique to San Francisco, the IC will disappoint as too safe and bland a choice. If you're after comfortable rooms with a pleasant, modern decor in a very central location, with a spa, gym, indoor pool and jacuzzi, pleasant looking bar, separate restaurant, all accompanied by friendly and courteous service, you can't go wrong with the InterContinental San Francisco. (And unlike the sister property you don't have to scale hills to get there). The hotel has a corporate feel; being adjacent to the Moscone, I imagine it would be an excellent place to stay for business, meetings and conferences. The front office seemed to cope well with the high volume of guests when I was checking out, but the bellman's team seemed overstretched - the desk was unmanned and there were several full luggage trolleys in the lobby being attended to. Despite the rush, the team did notice me standing at the desk and I was attended to in a sensible amount of time. Having my own agenda, I didn't interact with the Concierge but I know the IC as a company pride themselves on their concierge service. I did not explore their dining and bar products (too many iconic SF places to fit in) but I appreciated the complimentary chocolates, fruits, nuts and water which were thoughtfully delivered. Overall a pleasant stay, and a hotel i would recommend to those seeking a reliable and modern hotel in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service at great location”
Reviews.Author: lichyun
Reviews.Content: I chose InterContinental San Francisco on my recent trip and we were completely thrilled with our hotel stay. I have been in San Francisco for three times because I love this amazing city and my hotel experience at IC San Francisco was without a doubt the best by far. First of the all, the hotel is new and both the guest room and the public area are well and luxurious decorated. Staff are extremely friendly and everyone will greet you if they pass you by. We got upgraded into a corner room which is more than spacious for two. We were also given access to the Club Lounge so we could have daily breakfast and happy hour. Although food and drink are offered on the complimentary basis, the quality is superb just like at those high-end restaurants. We stayed there for 4 nights and we did not want to leave at the end. I really feel great value for my stay and would definitely recommend this prestige property to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 5 times now. This last time was only OK... not up to the Intercontinental's normal standards.”
Reviews.Author: RobandJohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco for a fifth time at the end of June. It had become our hotel of choice in San Francisco following several years of staying primarily at the W Hotel and the Marriott (which is now the Marriott Marquis) while on trips to The City. This was the 5th time in about a 2+ year period that we stayed at this particular Intercontinental and we travel to SF about 3 times a year. A few things this time may change the way we look at the Intercontinental San Francisco. First, we'd booked months in advance and had secured a deluxe room like we always do. The hotel has standard rooms, superior rooms (floors 14 to 24) and then so-called deluxe rooms (floors 25 to 30). What we ended up getting was a room unlike any we'd had before at this hotel... and not in a good way. We still got a high floor, but it was one near the end of the hallway that had a connecting door to another room. It was a much smaller room than we normally receive when we book this same type of room. There wasn't a single thing mentioned from the woman who handled our check-in at the front desk (i.e. "Your room type isn't available so we are putting you in a smaller room" or an apology or anything). When we went to check out, we looked at our bill and the room cost WAS reduced from the price we booked... so at least they did that. But some notification beforehand would have been the right thing for them to do, especially for someone who's stayed at their hotel numerous times recently. Equally bad, it was the first time at the Intercontinental we heard conversations coming from the people in the room next to us. It was obvious there were 2 parents and 2 kids in the room next door to ours. At one point, the adjoining room door was opened on the other side and you could hear LOUD giggling and laughing, plus the door on our side was visibly shaking like a big wind gust went through. It was beyond annoying. I guess as a kid it might seem like a funny thing to do, but it was off-putting at a 5-star hotel. One reason we stopped staying at the W in San Francisco was because of its thin walls, and it looks like we may have to do the same at the Intercontinental and look for another hotel. Some noise in the halls is fine and normal at any hotel, but you shouldn't be able to hear word-for-word conversations from the people in the room next to you. (Again, since it was the first time we'd ever noticed it at this hotel, maybe it was solely because of the adjoining room door.) A few times staying here, they've had town car service available to the airport, which is convenient and only a few bucks more than a cab. It wasn't available this time when we left but we never had problems finding cabs just outside the hotel. And there are many places to walk nearby (world class shopping, restaurants are all in easy walking distance). Avoid going towards Sixth and Seventh streets though because it can be a bit of a dicey crowd, particularly late night. We walked back to the hotel from Union Square after midnight Saturday night and it was fine. It may be a long walk for some, but it was enjoyable to us because we like to walk and explore San Francisco. The hotel does have some very nice employees who are friendly and helpful. Some of the valet guys are cool and talkative. If you're expecting great views of the city from your room, you won't get it by facing south towards the ball park. It's a pretty average view, even for San Francisco. The view towards Market Street is much better and we've had that view 2 times during our stays. One last thing... we're the type who don't really care if our room is made up or not, so we keep the lighted "Do Not Disturb" button turned on in the hallway. We checked in on Saturday at 3 p.m.... and had the "Do Not Disturb" light turned on Sunday afternoon about the same time. We got a note put under our door that said, "We are respecting your wishes." That wasn't too annoying... but then we received a phone call from a man who said, "Hello this is Security calling. We're calling to make sure everything is alright in there." OK, that was weird and a bit scary. It didn't sound authentic at all. We said everything was fine... but then we called downstairs to the front desk to ask if that was a legitimate phone call. The woman at the front desk said she didn't know... but then she checked and called back and said, "Yes, security called to make sure everything was OK." That is just plain weird. If you turn your "Do Not Disturb" light on, should it really warrant a note under your door PLUS a phone call from security? We were trying to take a light nap after hearing all the noise from that family in the room next door to ours, yet we still got disturbed by hotel staff. We have a room booked at this same hotel for September but we're looking at other options now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ukjingai
Reviews.Content: The front could not find my reservation, so it took me an extra 20 min to check in after they double checked with the website I had made the payment through. Apart from this, everything else was alright. It is located in a very good area, close to the Moscone center, making it an unbeatable choice for a conference. The minibar was OK, and since the minibar sensors are almost in every hotel in Japan, I knew that if you pick the product, you may be charged. The only thing I didn't actually like about this hotel was the area at late night. If you go towards the union sq. it is OK, but the other way round is a scary neighborhood. Try a cocktail at the bar too, it is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelAussie Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2011. Hotel is well located, just 2 blocks south of Market street, near the Powell street BART station. The nightly rate is high, as expected for a 5 star establishment. Unfortunately, this hotel seems to charge extra for every little "extra" thing that the guests might want. The internet and Wifi were not free. This is surprising, considering that the "lower rated" hotels within the Priority club range (for example Crowne Plaza, Holiday Inn, Holiday Inn express) usually have free Wifi or internet access. Even the "complimentary" water in the room was not free (costs $8.50 plus tax). There is an electronically wired minibar fridge in the room which will immediately bill you for minibar charges as soon as you touched any item within it. We had bad experiences with this sort of minibar in previous hotels (We had to repeatedly go down to the main desk to report that we had merely "touched" the bottles, not drunk them, to get their charges reversed), so we did not even DARE to open this minibar fridge!!! We had buffet breakfast included in our rate but the breakfast was just average. Breakfast was not typical of a 5 star hotel. There were very little choices. There was not even an omelette and fried/poached eggs station. (Our breakfast experience at other 5 star establishments were better, with better choices, and usually a manned omelette station). To make matters worse, after we got home, we found out that we were only awarded 2000 priority club points for our stay, instead of 10 points per dollar spent. We would have got 10 points per dollar spent if we had stayed at Crowne Plaza or Holiday Inn instead! So, for all the money spent for 2 nights, NOT VALUE FOR MONEY. Look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Touch it and Pay”
Reviews.Author: Koke34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the InterContinental San Francisco thinking it would provide us with the comfort and hospitality we needed after a long and tiresome road trip along the California coast. However, the hotel's unscrupulous and inhospitable policy of charging for absolutely every single amenity in their rooms completely faded away our hopes of a pleasant stay in San Francisco. To begin with, in contrast to other 4 and 5-star hotels we stayed at during our road trip, the InterContinental was the only one who charged for the "complementary" bottle of mineral water, which, believe it or not, cost $8.00 + tax! I decided to drink tap water instead but to my surprise it took over 3 minutes to fill a small glass due to the poor water pressure. In addition, the hotel charged a ludicrous $15.00 + tax for WiFi, when this service is considered a free commodity in almost every small hotel or cafe. Secondly, the valet parking was ridiculously expensive ($50.00 per 24 hours + tax) compared to other near-by 4-star hotels, which charged at least 20% less. Lastly, the minibar, although stacked with a variety of somewhat premium products, had a sensor installed which detected if you took anything out and immediately charged it to your credit card. This totally offended us and made us feel as if the hotel considered us thieves, despite the more than generous premium we payed for our hotel room. Needless to say, I immediately started looking for other surveillance systems within the room. In all, my wife and I think its a shame that such a big and prestigious hotel chain with very deep pockets such as the Intercontinental needs to go to these extremes in order to profit when all they're doing is insulting customers and encouraging them to never come back, which is definitely our case. It's time they re-think their revenue model and factor in the customer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern entry-level luxury hotel, everything you need in great location”
Reviews.Author: NCHKCA
Reviews.Content: First stayed here on company business as we were doing an event as Moscone West convention center next door. Was impressed and came back with family for a weekend stay - was able to get two connecting rooms. Relatively new property with modern but comfortable rooms. Short walk to union square, and walkable to many places. Lap pool and small but nice fitness center with modern equipment with TV's. Brunch was not extensive but good quality. Good rates many weekends - but they fluctuate widely. Go for the upper floors for extra amenities, and ensure you get a room on north side facing city (lots of noise coming from Howard street on south side). If you have car, go for package with valet parking and breakfast - definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Family fun in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Travel_diA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip and we really liked it. The rooms were modern and fresh, the beds comfortable with nice linens. The bar and restaurant were very nice. We had the buffet breakfast which was pricey but in line with what you typically find at a hotel of this type. Parking was $60 dollars a night ( welcome to San Francisco!). We were within walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning View from the Upper Floors”
Reviews.Author: Travels4workand4fun
Reviews.Content: Sleek and modern rooms, well-appointed, fast wireless...great location for business. Great meeting space here. Very spacious health club and nice lap pool, as well as open spaces (terraces) on a couple of levels. Luce, the restaurant, serves very good modern Mediterranean cuisine. A solid bet for business travel or just a nice place to stay in the city. Overnight parking at >$50 was a bit of a shock, but comparable to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel that nickel and dimes you to death”
Reviews.Author: hamstir
Reviews.Content: This is a standard luxury hotel, very nice and clean. Saw no bed bugs. But as I travel more I start to realize the difference between a luxury hotel that makes it easy and one that aggravates you to death. This place falls into the latter. Charge for wifi, (alot) charge for minibar, coffee maker a hassle, no fridge or microwave. You have to be constantly worried about touching something and getting charged. No thanks. I'd rather just be charged more and relax.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Bernicez10
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews citing bed bugs, I was reluctant to stay at the Intercontinental. I attempted to check in early and was offered the room adjacent to the location in which another reviewer had experienced problems with bed bugs. Needless to say, I passed on that opportunity! The room I checked into was very clean and did not have any bed bugs. Overall, the hotel was very modern, clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: DanielSE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights attending the WWDC at Moscone West. I am quite picky with hotels and after reading some of the negative reviews here I was afraid I would not be pleased with my booking. I was positively surprised! My room was a junior suite on the 20th floor, corner room with an excellent view, with floor to celling windows throughout the room even in the bathroom. I did not have much to do with the staff, but on the few occasions they were all helpful and friendly. A very nice gesture was that I received fruit not once but twice during the week, happened to me in other hotels only if I had complaints about something. The location is the very best for attending a conference at Moscone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great concierge & other service, OK location”
Reviews.Author: Peacelovevacation
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, loved the scent they use use in the lobby! We loved the help from the concierge service who helped us get Alcatraz tickets that were quickly selling out - thanks Bill! The hotel practically has everything you need. We forgot a razor and a toothbrush and they were able to bring both to our room. But, the only negative to the hotel is the location. This was our first trip to San Francisco so we weren't sure where to stay - but always heard Union Square is the place. The hotel is walking distance to the square, by there is not a whole lot of choices for dinner. We were disappointed by bad meals near the hotel and that the XXX area is just a few blocks away - with some pretty scary locals hanging around. With that said I would like to say that our favorite area was ghirardelli square & (all time fave) Chesnut Street - it has fabulous dining options and wonderful one-of-a-kind boutique shopping. Also, San Fran hasn't figured out a solution for their homeless population. We didn't have any issues but it would be hard with small children I think. And really sad to see :( Seemed like more here than in NYC. Recommendations: Alcatraz tour really is all it's cracked up to be... Great, nicely run tour. Top notch! Muir Woods, and absolute must is to walk the Golden Gate Bridge... It's absolutely breath taking!

Reviews.Title: “"Great place to stay if you're busy at Moscone”
Reviews.Author: NWbySE
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here five times now. It's a very nice hotel. And it's right next door to Moscone West. I would recommend it, if you have the budget for it. It's not the most expensive, but there are decent, less expensive hotels not much further from Moscone. Like other high-end hotels, I wish they would stop charging a ridiculous amount extra for bottled water and internet access. It is a nuisance. It is against my nature to pay $8 for a $2 bottle of water. I always grab a bottle or two from the market on Mission St. or do a little shopping at Whole Foods on 4th. It is also a bad practice to have an electronically-guarded mini-bar. You can't move anything in the fridge without being charged for it! It would be a lot nicer to have use of the fridge, but you would pay $30 for them to clear it out. It's just the wrong way to treat guests. Bean counters make poor customer service decisions in every hotel company, but I would love it if Intercontinental took the lead on abolishing these "nickel-and-diming" practices. Despite these annoyances, I am still a fan of the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “May be a bit pricey but as good as its reputation.”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone64
Reviews.Content: Rooms above 10th floor are good. Club lounge access and city view up there are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay made even better by the concierge.”
Reviews.Author: daniel85l
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Intercontinental for the past 4 nights and had a fabulous stay. To be honest I have stayed in more luxurious and extravagant Intercontinental's yet what made up for the area's where this hotel lacks was the service. One person in particular was William from the concierge team. His knowledge, manner and anticipation of our needs was unsurpassable. His restaurant recommendations each night were perfect and showed us San Francisco's culinary delights in all it's glory. So when you stay at this hotel and if you want a true, local and enriching experience, please ask for William at the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: tobandals
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay here for a conference. It is a lovely hotel and the rooms are very confortable. The first night I arrived rather late, so figured to I would try room service. I ordered a chicken dish that was delicious and arrived quickly and hot. Each room has a Keurig coffee maker, and each day I was there I found more coffee/teas added as they noticed I was using it. The beds are very comfortable, with plenty of pillows. I had an early flight leaving and I checked with the concierge the night before and he got me booked on a shuttle that worked out perfectly. The hotel provided lunch for the conference and the food was fantastic! Very nice hotel overall and I look forward to visiting again at next years conference.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and up to the usual IC standards”
Reviews.Author: PaulYorath
Reviews.Content: $176 per night direct. Very well located hotel close to Union Square and Powell Street cable car stop etc. Typically polished Intercontinental, immaculately clean, good room size, modern bathroom and comfortable bed. We paid an extra $19 for an upper floor room on level 26 which gave us excellent views over the city, well worth the extra buck. Only downsides, a number of street beggars in the vicinity and valet parking was $52 per night. We paid $20 less in a parking lot just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Club lounge and we will return”
Reviews.Author: SHOMUR
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 6-10th May 2011. On arrival and without asking we were offered the appropriate Ambassador member''s upgrade to a junior suite and found ourselves on the same floor as the Club Lounge. the limited view from the room was made up for by the easy access to the lounge which has interesting views over the local suburb. There we had great service from Luis and Bridget throughout our stay. The extra cost to have Club lounge access was well worth it..Two free computers are available in the lounge for guests. There was a very good range of breakfast options, the afternoon tea was lovely and the evening drinks selections and canapes were superb. Very helpful advice from Bridget lead us to a very good restaurant near the hotel for one of our meals out. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good stay”
Reviews.Author: marr
Reviews.Content: Do not undrstand comments like location not good etc. Hotel is exactly 5 min walk from Market street and 3 minuets from biggest shopping center in SF. For downtown area it is really good location. Personally didnt see any police outside and was feeling pretty safe in the area. On our arrival it was strong rain and Obama was staying in the hotel so we couldnt get with the taxi to the entrance but we had to take longer walk. Also security was strong but very nice, they allowed photos with them if asked. Room was standard Intercontinental, large and well equiped. Yes you pay for internet but it is maybe as I come from Europe my feeling is that more expensive hotels charge for connection and budget once dont, everywhere I go I pay for internet. One annoying thing was very poor water preassure on 23rd floor though nothing I would die from. Concierge was very nice with few good advices and help wit restaurant reservations. Price per room was very good via internet, around 145 USD per nite, something you can dream in Europe for this level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Giants' game”
Reviews.Content: Went down for a Giants game and wanted a place to stay within walking distance of AT@T Park. I have back problems so I was looking for a short and safe walk. The last time we went down for a game we stayed the Hyatt Regency on the Embarcadero . Just as a side note, we had a fine stay there and the walk to the park along the water is a nice one. However, the Hyatt was booked. The Intercontinental has a package deal which includes parking and breakfast at a very reasonable rate . Rates and room location I suspect depend upon what the convention activity is like at the nearby Moscone Center. I thing we booked on a slow week. We were given a corner room which provided a really nice open feel to the room . The bathroom is huge with it's own floor to ceiling window . I looked in one of the regular rooms and it was the same as the corner room with the exception of the extra window space. Nice gym . Indoor lap pool. Oh yes, great beds. The walk to the Giants' game was less than a mile . Believe me , the cab hassle after a game is so overwhelming you'll appreciate being able to walk to your hotel. Can't get over how much the neighborhood has changed. We went to a day game , but would have no problem making the walk at night. Not only has the area really become very pleasant there are plenty of people leaving the park after a game so there's a real safe feeling. Hotel staff was great. Only one real complaint--- we had guests join us for breakfast once during our three day stay. Since our deal included free breakfast I had no idea what the cost of the buffet style meal was. My friends ordered two espressos with their brunch and the tab was roughly 95 bucks. The buffet was fine ( okay there was a fruit fly problem on the pastry, but that didn't bother me as much as it did my wife) , but certainly not worth that kind of money.My fault for not asking . Overall I really enjoyed the place. FYI for baseball fans there is a ''W'' hotel a tad closer to the park and the Saint Regis is also nearby . Don't know about the ''W'' but for what you pay for a room at the Saint Regis, tickets and a car should be provided for the game

Reviews.Title: “Nice but with limitations”
Reviews.Author: HelgLon
Reviews.Content: selected hotel because it is new and tall buidling/hoping for some nice views. Room nice but bathroom without bidet or towel rail. Main nuisance the price of breakfast and even worse that there was no option to take it in a designated restaurant area. All you got if not in room was a lot of (overpriced) options - maybe the management should visit Europe or Asia to learn how to offer breakfast - esp as it is an international chain.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gioac
Reviews.Content: I've been there during "web 2.0 expo" with my collegues. The hotel is close to the Moscone center and it's very close to the center town. The rooms are great. Great lcd tv. The breakfast it's simply fantastic. Thera are a swimming pool. The wi-fi conncection it's not free in the rooms and you have to pay (more or less 49 dollars per week)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Janbinto
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and had a very positive experience. I am an Ambassador member and was upgraded to a corner suite with a beautiful view and spacious, clean room. The staff were helpful and the location was located just next to the Moscone Convention Center. It's a short walk to Market street and Union square. When taxis were scarce there were always town cars available. I also ate at the hotel and the food was always great. My only negative experience (which was really bad) was at the hair salon recommended by the hotel. It was called the Soma salon just around the corner from the hotel. The owner does not know how to style women's hair - it took over an hour and he had body odor. It was the worst experience! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Fuzby
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but there are many other hotels nearby. I and a business colleague booked our room many months in advance, and were assured that our request for a quiet location would be honored. But when we arrived, we were told in a cold and haughty way that "we are sold out", and were placed in a room directly across from the elevators and next to a family with a constantly crying baby. Although I belong to the hotel's rewards program, there was no benefit to this at this hotel. The room was fine, but nothing luxurious (cheesy little hot water maker with no tea), although the rooms are high-priced. Most frustrating was the fact that they totally messed up our bills, and although some time has passed, they still haven't straightened it out (it was just a simple matter of splitting the room charge), so we can't file for travel reimbursement. Given all the other choices in this location, next time we will try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: RMJMW
Reviews.Content: We attended a meeting held at the Intercontionental and the service and room was great. However it is in an bad location with a scarcity of cabs, restaurants and a walk of several blocks on lonely streets to Market street where you can catch buses or trolly cars. This hotel is next to the Moscone Center and is in an area that will probably improve greatly in future years but I would only recommend it only if you are attending a meeting being held there or the Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and elegant Hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: luru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental San Francisco for 6 nights in April 2011. If you decide to take an airport shuttle from SFO the InterContinental is certainly one of the first hotels the shuttle will stop due to its location close to the highway from the airport. My first impressions were ok. The entrance is not very impressive, simple but elegant. Check-In was swift, but I got downgraded. I had originally booked an Executive Room on one of the top floors. They were not very apologetic about it and it was a little bit like: "as a matter of fact we downgraded you" To give them credit, they did agree to refund about $25 per night and I still had all the privileges of an Executive room such as Club InterContinental access and free Wi-Fi. BTW, the Club was great, the staff there were super friendly and even greeted me by first name. The breakfast is great and the afternoon tea there was also very good. After a long flight from Europe I was not in the mood to argue about the downgrade so I just accepted their offer. I went to my room and after about 10 minutes a cleaning lady entered the room. She did knock on the door but only for about 2 seconds before she opened the door. Good thing she didn't enter the room 2 minutes later since I was planning to take a shower! I do think that they should pay more attention to those little details. She obviously wasn't aware of the fact that someone was already in the room and wanted to bring a bathrobe which was missing. Apart from that, housekeeping was great, the room was 100% clean and the HDTV was just stunning, as stunning as my view. Unfortunately I did not see the Golden Gate bridge but AT&T park at night was nice enough. With the exception of the staff at the InterContinental Club I did not have much interaction with the staff, but everyone seemed nice enough. The location is good, not great though. It is a 15 minutes walk to Union Square and about 10 minutes to Market Street. The Embarcadero/Ferry Bulding is about 30 minutes away. One last thing I have to add: Upon check-out I had to explain (again) that I do not have to pay for the Internet fees ($60 for 4 days are OUTRAGEOUS) and I don't like to "beg" for things which were already agreed upon. Those minor flaws are the reason why this hotel only gets 4 Stars, it just wasn't perfect. Don't misunderstand me, I would recommend this hotel to my best friends and I would definitely come back but it just was not a flawless experience.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy fire trucks, bachelor party next door and poor service”
Reviews.Author: hellosunshine97
Reviews.Content: We traveled to SF for a business mtg and stayed at the Intercontinental next to the conference center. I called ahead to book at car service with a child car seat to pick us up from the airport and it was handled by the concierge. The towncar arrived without the car seat for my 18 MO daughter. The intercontinental refunded us the $85 at my request. I also called ahead for a crib in our room, which was not ready as we checked in. We were on the 11th floor facing Howard st. The sirens from the firestation nearby were constant and woke us up several times. The bachelor party next door to our room was unbearable as they turned the TV on with the volume at the maximum level and proceeded to party through the night. The restaurant in the hotel was nice and very expensive. Next time, I will stay in a union square hotel and see if I have better luck!

Reviews.Title: “The best location for the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Drmcferry
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, good service. However, the rooms were a little small. Breakfast is very good but quite expensive for the price. I recommend to go to Mel's drive in with very good breakfast much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with impressive restaurants”
Reviews.Author: OchreSilence
Reviews.Content: The room was very stylishly presented. The views were amazing (from the 29th floor). The staff were helpful although perhaps overworked. The in room dining experience was the best I've had anywhere including in many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Tuscanydreamz
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arrival, the staff makes you feel so welcome. The room was beautiful and immaculate. The amenities are upscale and plentiful. The location was convenient and within walking distance to many desired areas. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Bland business hotel but great evening restaurant experience”
Reviews.Author: Graysgirl
Reviews.Content: From the sublime to the ridiculous -I had had a tiny room in a hotel in NYC and flew to San Francisco where, at the Intercontinental, I had a barn of a room and a great shower room - but it really was something of a waste of space for one person. Clean with comfortable bed and nice linen and towels, but rather sterile as a room. Staff were efficient but impersonal on welcome, and clearly used to dealing with a churn of convention guests at the nearby centres. Wifi was OK - but it looked like I might have to pay to hook up my phone as well as the laptop so stuck to the laptop only. A shame - most hotels I have stayed in recently in US it has been free wifi for anything, anywhere in the hotel, and could cost a lot if staying for a while. The mini bar was OK with pretty standard contents and fairly hefty pricing. One of those autocharge ones - so don't touch anything unless you really want to use it. The breakfast buffet was pretty spectacular and my only disappointment was a industrially baked muffin on the Saturday morning (think it was eggs benedict sitting too long in the heater which was a shame) - but lovely fruit, cereals, bread and smoked salmon so cannot complain. The exciting find was the evening meal - in the evening the restaurant turns into the Michelin starred 'Luce' - absolutely AMAZING and not ridiculously expensive if you choose carefully - I had an astounding starter, delicious entree and lovely glass of wine beautifully presented for about $50 - with the added amusement of sitting listening to a rather aggressive headhunter positively bully her clearly exceptionally well qualified client over dinner at the adjacent table - worth every penny - so perhaps not the best place for a discreet dinner. But if you love good European style modern food do try it - it is a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Intercon”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel and very modern. The rooms are a little on the smallish side but that is what you expect in San Fran. The bed was quite comfortable and easy to fall asleep. The location is a few blocks from the BART and there isn't a ton right around there but within a few blocks you have Yerba Buena and Mission and Market Streets so not too far out of the way. The workout room was big but a lot of the cardio machines had issues with their TV monitors. The equipment seemed pretty new so that was quite unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, Racism of the Highest Order, Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Dharma2artha
Reviews.Content: My brother got married on Easter day (April 23, 2011). My two children and I arrived on April 22, at 2:00 am; however, my mother in-law and her sister arrived on April 21. Upon arrival, I obtained 2 keys from the front desk as I didn't want to wake up my mother in-law. There was no one to help us with our luggage. We arrived to find some stale nuts and dried fruit on nice plates in the room. The room was a deluxe something room... it looked less better than a Hampton inn or Sheraton room. The towels had no good smell to them... they were as hard as billow pads. THE ROOM WAS HOT!!!!!!! We were cooking like chicken even after lowering the thermostat to 68 degrees. At breakfast we were seated and served ok.... just that all the non-African Americans (whites) did not want to sit near us. Wow!!! They didn't even wait 2 seconds and mind you we are educated non-ghetto acting people and look normal. We left our fried chicken and cocoa butter at home. We had several functions to attend that day and the next. My kids went swimming and as soon as they got to the pool..... the stares started. Then people (white) started to get out of the pool. Ugh!!!! I wanted to cry. I wanted to pull my kids out of the pool but I stayed strong. The Asian man stayed and enjoyed his swim and even said bye on his way out. I felt okay after that. By 4:00 pm we went to grab a bite. This lady with short blonde hair was so rude. She said that the restaurant wasnâ€™t open until 5:00 pm... it wasn't what she said, it was how she said it... she didn't talk to the white people like that... We ate, paid and left. The next day.... Forgot to mention, the concierges were always nice to us. ... The next day we came down... left for the wedding around noon... the stares...... came back.... the concierges were still nice... the valets were nice.... came down at 6:30... Called for our car.. I think this valet was confused... kept asking if we were staying at the hotel... kept asking if we were really coming back and if we were going to sleep at the hotel at night, â€˜tipped him a $20 so he'd be quiet and get off our backs. Come back at 9 something. My mother in-law wasn't happy about something that had happened... The blonde had disrespected her. She went to get dinner around 7 pm and had her sister and 2 friends. She was going to eat and the others just wanted drinks. The blonde said she could eat at the bar. This is 60 something year old lady. My mother in-law repeated that she would like to have her meal at a table. The blonde said those tables were for people that were going to eat. My mother in-law said she was going to eat and the others would have drinks. The blonde repeated... You need to go to the bar because this place was about to get real busy and other people would need the tables!!!!!!!! My mother in-law then said she was not going to do that and called for the manager. Of course the manager was apologetic and offered complementary meals which my mother in-law refused. She had been disrespected and a complementary meal would not sweep away how she had been treated. Yes, I am pulling the black card..... I saw how she treated us compared to the others.. More to come. That night, I went to order food to take to my room. We were not going to eat downstairs but once we stepped down... Oh Oh!!! The stares were fierce..... I almost went to this lady to ask why was she starring so hard... we waited to be seated but the host kept passing us by... we went and sat down but no one came... I got up and stopped the host and said we just wanted to place an order and come back for it. He said we should go to the bar. So we went there. The kids sat and so did I. We waited on the bartender who looked at us and kept doing his stuff. Later he came.. We ordered.. he was reluctant.... he didn't even finish and the manager showed his face and said, "California law prohibits kids at the bar. Well!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We wanted to resume... he was busy...I then went to the manager and said we would leave when he had finished our order... The waiter gives us open glasses..... !!! I look at him and ask about the bottled drinks ... reiterating that we were taking these with us... ????? He said if we preferred bottled he'd get us those....... I am just through.... I can't even finish â€˜cause the more I remember, the more upset I get.... $550 3 nights when embassy suites was less than half that for better service..... I was so glad to get out of this placeâ€¦.. NEVER returning to this hotel. The dishes from Friday morning were still there on Sundayâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience - will repeat”
Reviews.Author: UKandYO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying here for the last few days - let me reassure you that this is a great hotel. We were taken care of at the reception desk by Zuzana who gave us a great room with 180 degree view of city and the bay. The club lounge staff are equally wonderful - especially Regina and Luis who have been accommodating our vegetarian diet with a smile. Lounge food is good too - from breakfast to dessert. The hotel and the room are very clean and comfortable. We will stay here again. ps> No bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: quinngeoffrey
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the InterContinental San Francisco, thanks largely to their fabulous concierge, Bill Sutton, who was incredibly helpful and welcoming. The hotel is brilliantly located , the bed linens are lovely, the bathroom large and beautiful and everything was clean, sparkling and modern. We will definitely stay there again and much preferred it to the Mark Hopkins InterContinental, although that hotel too is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: LizzieWax
Reviews.Content: We travel often on business to San Francisco and tried this new hotel. While we did have a great stay, afterward I found erroneous charges for additional rooms on my credit card. I book about fifteen hotel stays each year, and this is the first time in eight years I have ever had a hotel try to pull this. While they say they will reverse the charges, thus far they have enot. They have been incredibly difficult to deal with, their finance department is uncaring and unhelpful, and when I've asked to speak to someone higher up to get this addressed, they tell me that anyone else at the hotel including management is unable to help and will simply transfer me to the same finance person. That I have wasted so much time after my stay trying to get this situation fixed has been infuriating. Because they posted these charges for additional rooms to my business card and will not correct them, they have caused me problems at work. I consider myself lucky that I haven't had this happen before. I think in these difficult economic times, hotels like this are fighting to fill rooms, and they are banking that a certain percentage of business travelers either won't notice or because the company pays, won't be upset by, relatively small excess charges for random rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: LPomford
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very attractive, our room was spacious, comfortable and elegant, and it was well placed to explore the shopping district around Union Square, and we managed to walk to the Embracardo in about 25 minutes. The staff were extremely friendly, such as our waiter from the previous day who came over to say hello, and the chef we happened to meet in the lift who asked us about our stay. There were a couple of problems - we arrived at about 9.30pm following a shocking flight with United and were told our room was not ready, as they had had a lot of late check-outs that day. I notice someone else mentioned this in a review, so they obviously need to improve somewhere. However, the receptionist was very apologetic, and when we said we would eat while the room was being prepared, she went to let the restaurant manager know to expect us, and they bought us a round of drinks. Another thing to be aware of is that the San Francisco Fire Department appear to be based close to the hotel (either that or there are an inordinate number of fires in SF!). We heard a handful of fire engines each day which sometimes woke us up - obviously this isn' t the hotel's fault as I don't think the thickest glazing could obliterate the noise entirely, but it is something to be aware of. Overall we found the hotel to be comfortable, with great staff and well placed to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay !”
Reviews.Author: EricGu
Reviews.Content: I was there for a couple of nights for business. Very nice hotel. My room was clean, spacious and comfortable. In the room I had, I liked the large window with a view in the bathroom. Internet was working well. Great breakfast. The fitness center is fine, although there is no changing room. I will go back

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS and poor customer service at the Intercontinental Moscone”
Reviews.Author: ple_2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental San Francisco Moscone Center 4/10/11-4/13/11 for the AdTech conference and discovered bed bugs on my last night there. My score reflects 1) definitely the bed bugs, but also 2) the poor customer service I received after telling them that I found the bugs. I was completely shocked and distraught when I found the bugs and felt like they didn't do much to accommodate me. When I reported the bugs and requested a room change, they gave me an apology and literally swept it under the rug. I really wanted to be respectful and not make a big deal out of it but now that I reflect on my actions, I should have thrown a fit so that they would have given me more respect. To be honest, all I really wanted was a nice human gesture by the hotel to make me feel better. I mean I was so terrified, I couldn't sleep at all and sat up the entire night in my new room. I wish they would have told me that they were doing everything in their power to address the issue because it's so prevalent today. Instead, they moved me into a new room (downgraded me by the way, I mean they could have ran out of rooms but also didn't tell me), didn't help me check if there were bed bugs in the new room or even ask if I was okay or comfortable, and sent a security guard to question me on the "incident," as if it was some kind of accident report. The one thing the concierge did ask me was, and I quote, "Do you want your laundry done as well because when this usually happens, we offer this service but since you're leaving tomorrow, I don't think we can get it to you in time." I do understand that it was my last night, but I had asked them to return my laundry by 4pm which was not particularly early but they were unwillingly to budge on the time that they could deliver the clothes (6pm). I mean really, 2 hrs? I bet they could have pulled some strings to help me feel better about not taking home any critters with me!!! On top of that, when she said "usually," it made me really wonder if they've implemented any kind of protocol to remove these critters from the rooms. I really expected more from a 4 star hotel. Thankfully, I didn't get bitten the first two nights I was there. After that experience, I don't think I want to stay at any hotel again but even more so stay at any Intercontinental hotels. FYI, I stayed in 2302. P. Le

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready at 8:45 pm! Seriously? Yes! And thats for a Gold Ambbassador.”
Reviews.Author: RobMacKenzie
Reviews.Content: Tonight is my first stay at the Intercontinental San Fran as a Gold Ambassador. Arrived at 8:45pm and my room was not ready. The Desk agent asked if she could buy me a drink at the bar while I waited for my room. Seriously? What a shocking reception.
