I informed her that with my body clock on East coast time that I was quite tired. So she gave me a room directly adjacent to the elevators despite my profile indicating quiet room. Back down to the lobby and I finally got into a quiet room. Its a very nice quiet corner room, but it shouldn't be this difficult. I want to go to bed but after 40 minutes in the room my fedex package hasn't been delivered and I'm not certain whether or not someone will deliver a welcome amenity. Intercontinental Los Angeles was a MUCH smoother and customer friendly experience 2 days ago. Room ready on arrival. Upgraded to a corner suite with balcony overlooking Fox studios. Nice welcome amenity, prompt package delivery. Free movie + more. Top notch in every aspect. Fantastic stay. So far, a study in contrasts. Robert MacKenzie

Reviews.Title: “great stay with no problems”
Reviews.Author: blackmidnight
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from 7 nights in SF and had a great stay in this hotel. Arrived about 1 1/2 hour before check in time and we were upgraded to a king room on 23rd floor and able to check in immediately. The front desk staff were all very friendly and I have no complaints about them. The room was large and bright, the bed was comfortable although soft so if you like a hard mattress it may not be ideal! Bathroom was small but nice. I'm a light sleeper and did find that the room doors were loud when opening/closing but other than that there were no real problems with noise. Requested a few extra coffees/milk during the week and these were bought up to the room quickly by very pleasant members of staff. Internet was $14.95 for 24 hours. Breakfast $28 per person unless included in room rate but there were plenty of nice places to grab something for breakfast around the area so we didn't bother with the hotel one. At first I wasn't sure about the location but by the end of the week i was convinced that the location was great. All the public transport we tookleft from Market Street which is only a couple of blocks away and we would have had to walk just as far if we had stayed in Union Square. Like others after reading some of the reviews on here I was a bit worried but had absolutely no problems once we were there and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I am a fan”
Reviews.Author: Nicholask71
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel even after reviewing a couple of average reviews. Clearly the negative reviewers have either had a one off bad experience or are hard to please (or maybe I am just easy to please). As a global trotting business person I feel that this hotel tickets all the boxes and I was very impressed with the overall experience delivered and will certainly be staying here again when in San Fransisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay...surprised to see other reviews not very postitive”
Reviews.Author: Bacs5
Reviews.Content: I travel on business quite often and have for 23 years and in San Francisco I have not stayed at another hotel that was, on this stay, as pleasant, clean and well maintained as this was. The front desk clerk was very helpful, even telling me that I had two reservations for the same night and cancelling one without any question. The room was big, clean, well appointed and quiet. I don't know how old the hotel is, but it certainly was not at all dated and and run down as you get from many of the hotels in San Francisco that offer the big names/historic "aura". Big bathroom, nice bed (very comfortabe - I wonder if my room was updated based on others' comments about the beds!!!??). Had dinner in the hotel bar/restaraunt. My first "hostess" or server was either new or tired or generally disinterested. Howver, i asked for the sommelier and once I did I was immediately apporached by a professional young man that was very knowledgeable. My server then changed to a waiter that was very good as we discussed food/wine pairings. I sat in the bar area and it was a little loud but not crazy, just people gathering and having cocktails (it was later in the evening). The Pinot choice, sweetbreads and cahr were all outstanding. They need to re-train the young lady however. I did NOT use the Concierge that so many other reviewers complained about so it must be said that my stay may have been negatively affected had I encountered the issues that others did. Same with the manager. All in all, one of the best stays (elegant, roomy, clean and "newer") I have had on business travel in the past 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location. Well run!”
Reviews.Author: Alanstump
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work, and could find nothing lacking. The rooms and the bathrooms were perfect, the beds comfortable, the amenities great, and the staff was very friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....will stay again”
Reviews.Author: AustinSd
Reviews.Content: Great stay.the rooms are very nice and the service is top notch. Very close to union square and a great irish pub across the street with live music...service is poor...but who cares its a bar. The only complaints are that they are stingy with their internet connections and its about two blocks from the square..but close enough. a few blocks to the east it gets a bit shady, but if youre near the hotel its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: My partner and I previously stayed here in Sept 2008 and didn't hesitate booking in again for our recent return to San Fransisco. The staff are absolutely brilliant and always smiling and helpful. The rooms are spacious, modern, offer fantastic views and boast amazingly comfortable beds with top class linens. Location is perfect only a few blocks from the main CBD and shopping precinct. We will definitely be returning to this hotel when we next return to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Very inconsistent - varies between awesome and horrible”
Reviews.Author: Dibjo
Reviews.Content: The hotel's great, but the service is extremely inconsistent, it varies wildly from being very good and prompt to being downright rude and horrible, depending on who you are dealing with. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: cbwinter
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at The Intercontinental SF in Howard Street this time around, having stayed at the Mark Hopkins last time. Check in was efficient and I was afforded a room on the 10th floor ahead of normal check in time - nice. The room was clean and airy. Tidy and spacious bathroom too with good space in cupboards for hanging suits etc. I appreciated the big workspace to sort out the afterhours stuff that often crops up on a business trip. I used the gym and jacuzzi/swim pool once - all very clean and user friendly. Really great after a busy day and on the 6th floor so not too far away as they can sometimes be. Fresh fruit and water available as well - nice touch. I had dinner in the restaurant on one of the evenings. Wine expensive as was the small dinner portion but that said it was expertly served and of excellent callibre. Richard was an excellent waitron and is to be commended on his great service and advice. On my final day I had to avail of the concierge on two occasions - one with William to arrange a place to eat - excellent suggestions offered - and to get a cab to the airport on time: Both were well arranged. The other issue dealt with an undelivered package that Bill Sutton said he would sort out for me immediately even though I wasa leaving that evening. And he kept his word - very very nice. All in all I was impressed with the staff and their attitude to me at all times. They were attentive and very helpful on all occasions. The only slightly negative aspects of my stay were: 1. having to pay $14 per day for mobile broadband - which I object to when the HI Express gives it free of charge 2. The area. It's not bad but it's better to head up the hill to Union for meals and shopping - fortunately not much of a walk anyway. All in all I'd definitely stay here again. Thanks for a pleasant time.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay for business”
Reviews.Author: LItravelers_8
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the concierge floor and that was a great thing. It was like staying in a small hotel. The room was spacious but the stain on the comforter was gross. The staff were excellent. My only other complaint is that the towels in the room were thin, not what you would expect in a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barney78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and holiday. Hotel was great, bar food excellent, service exemplary, cocktails great, very helpful staff and concierge re, booking restaurants and giving advice on where to go etc. maps for everything! Rooms decent size and view of part of city. Fond Memories

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised! New in San Fran - who would have known”
Reviews.Author: CC2DotO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a conference (approx 20K people in attendance). I would stay here again for either leisure or business travel. The staff is fabulous... from the doorfront to concierge to front desk. Everyone was friendly, professional, and attentive. You don't find that combination very often...and certainly not during a busy conference week where people are usually stressed and time compressed. I had a junior suite which had wonderful floor to ceiling windows on two sides! Very comfortable beds which rivaled the 'heavenly bed' from Westin. Great location! Easy walk to Moscone Center, food, trolley, shopping, union square. Short cab ride to Fisherman's Wharf. I give low marks for value only because the rates are very high - although to be fair - no higher than any other hotel in town during a busy conference. The HVAC was a little louder than expected, but tolerable. The only other thing I would probably change is the spa. Spa was just ok. The thing that stood out is the waiting area wasn't as relaxing as I have experienced at other places. The constant opening/closing of the door made it hard to relax. Suggest they change the doors to something less noisy. Also, there was a bit of upselling of the spa products. After 5 days of walking/talking during the conference, I very much needed to relax! Buying products was the last thing I had on my mind. They offer car service which is comparable to cab fare to the airport (about $40) I believe thiis hotel is fairly new (about 3years old). And enjoyed the newness! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but really great”
Reviews.Author: secondwife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business rate -- normally the usual rate would be too high for me. The room was great because the view of the city was stunning. The restaurant in the lobby was a splurge and well worth it. Wow. Great food. If I can get a good rate, I'll stay here again. Only downside was none of my e-mails (I paid the $15/night internet rate) got delivered -- the internet system appeared to deliver them timely, only four days later I got rejections that none of the e-mails went through. Uh oh. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: rhoughta
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one evening and enjoyed the accomodations. If you are an early riser, ask for a higher floor with a bay view and enjoy an incrediable sunrise. I didn't have time to check out any of the hotel's ammenities this time, but I'm sure everything is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: twinklestar2307
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental on business attending a large conferene at the Moscone Centre, I got a small corner room, unfortunately no view to speak off, good sized bathroom, walk in shower and nice toiletries. Breakfast included in my rate, so a lovely buffett breakfast set off the day (had to hand over vouchers daily which was a bit embarrassing!). Only 1 bar which was outside the restaurant so could be busy. Very nice italian restaurant across the road,. Very helpful concierge - shame about the fog, but would go back

Reviews.Title: “Short Visit to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: aesc
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last month as part of a homefinding relocation trip. It is a lovely hotel - very new and sleek. We had a view facing the city, not the water, but were on the 23rd floor so it was gorgeous. I can only imagine what the water views are like. The conceierge was very helpful in giving me very good public transport directions with about 4 different stops (and I highly recommend using public transport in SF - it's very easy and efficient). The parking was ridiculously expensive, but having said that, every time we called for the car (and we were in and out a lot), it was always waiting and the guys were super nice. If you do have a car, it's very close to the freeway which is handy. The rooms were well appointed and big - there were three of us and we had 3 large suitcases and 10 days worth of clothing and managed to fit it all in without making a huge mess. The bathroom was roomy and pretty with good towels (always a sign of a better hotel). The beds and pillows were very comfy too. Two complaints that other customers had noted were the excessive wireless internet charge - 15 bucks a night??!! We had just come from a Staybridge Suites (same company) in Sunnyvale where it was free. And the computerized mini bar is ridiculous. My daughter was checking everything out in there and of course lifting the things up so I had to call and make sure we weren't charged 100 bucks because she had looked at the gummy bears! The irish pub across the street is a good place for a cheap drink and pub meal. If you want to splurge, the hotel bar was very nice. We did eat at the restaurant and while the service was great, the food, in my opinion, was much a do about nothing. The hotel is centrally located, albeit about a block off the beaten path. As another reviewer wrote, walk on 4th street, not 5th street - there are a lot of creepers on 4th (we saw a drug deal on a Friday afternoon!). And be aware at night.

Reviews.Title: “Seamless stay, what a business traveler dreams for”
Reviews.Author: tsphilli
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in February. Internet worked great (I did not use Wi-fi, just the wired connection) so I could actually get work done. Hotel is exceptionally clean, quiet, and rooms are large with a great view. It is modernly appointed so you actually feel like you're coming home at the end of a long day. And, there's a nice hot tub for achy feet. :) The little gift shop even had normally-priced toenail clippers when I needed them. My only complaint is that when I was waiting for my airport shuttle on my last day in the lobby, I overheard an older male concierge loudly scolding a younger male concierge. It was both embarrassing for the younger concierge, uncomfortable for people in the lobby, and truly unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and beautiful Hotel. No complaints except the fog!!!”
Reviews.Author: Valery29
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice. Everything is brand new. We got the corner room with two glass walls. But we couldn't enjoy the view that much because of the fog!!!It was almost every day. But no complaints about the hotel. Will definitely go there again! Itâ€™s not in the tourist center, but its walking distance to shops and restaurants. Bloomingdales just in front of the hotel if you decide to make some shopping) would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: aussieguy69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago, on a quick trip to San Francisco. It was only for one night. We normally stayed at the Westin, but decided to give the Intercontinental a go instead. Its more expensive, but a nicer hotel. The room was spacious and the bed very very comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed. Everything you would expect from an ICH hotel. I would definately stay here again. My only complaint was the noise of a function downstairs (and we were on 15th floor). We went to bed at 11pm, but the function (conference event) was blasting music so loud that we couldnt sleep. I rang reception, and they promised that the noise would cease by midnight and apologised. To their credit, the noise did stop at midnight and I eventually got a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing out of the Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: maisoncote
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very impressive from outside and the in the lobby - lounge the Concierge is fantastic the check in is a breeze, the room are very basic nothing out of the ordinary clean except for the towel with well (brown stain !!!) I try to call the reception for a wake up call but the phone was not working. Outside of those two minor problem it was OK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way, worth the cost.”
Reviews.Author: bktours
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two days, using the special free valet parking, breakfast, and cable car tickets with the room. Wifi was included too for Intercontinental members, which is a free membership. Room rates quite high but considering the package was good value. Rooms very clean, roomy, 5-star, including the bathrooms with glass shower and separate tub. Breakfast was excellent and service good.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel, but if you have a car, boy look out!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: onlydelta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the end of the first week of February, 2011 for 2 nights. We wanted to visit wine country north of San Francisco and since I am a Gold Ambassador member with Intercontinental hotels, I figured this location would be a good one to use as our home base. I actually got a very good rate of $209.00 per night and using the one free night I had, I thought my total would be $209.00 + tax for the 2 nights. Well that would be the case if only I did not have a rental car to park. Worst yet, I had rented an SUV. Self parking is not available or at least it was not offered to me, so I went with valet parking. To make the long story short, check out time came on Sunday morning and I was looking at the bill handed to me and to my surprise the total was $371.00. I said â€œwowâ€� what happened? Well, I was told that the parking for my rented SUV was $57.00 per night, plus tax. So parking was $114.00 for the 2 nights + $209.00 for the room + tax. I know there are a lot of hotels all around the US in big cities who charge similar parking rates per day, but I thought you all would like to know about this one if you are thinking about staying at this hotel in the San Francisco area. The hotel is in a good location, close to Hwy101 and I-80, either one is good to take wine country. The rooms are nice, clean and bright. I would love to have a separate shower in addition to the tub, but that we did not have. All in all, the hotel and the service was good, but if you have to park your car with these guys, get ready to pay the money. I think $57.00 per day for parking is a ridicules price. Just to give you all an idea how bad $57.00 is, I stay at the Intercontinental Buckhead in Atlanta, Georgia a few times each year and the valet parking is $30.00 and self parking is $20.00 per day, not to mention the fact that this Atlanta location is absolutely incredible.

Reviews.Title: “International travellers may not want to hear live music at 11pm”
Reviews.Author: manb0t
Reviews.Content: This hotel styles itself as "InterContinental", perhaps recognising that many of their visitors are arriving after long flights. What one chiefly needs after such a trip is a shower, perhaps some food and then a quiet restful room to crash in. The InterContinental provides all of these things except the last. On my most recent trip, I arrived at the hotel around 9.30pm. As I checked in at the front desk, I could hear a band playing loudly. I asked the receptionist if I could be put in a room that was as quiet as possible. She obliged, putting me on the 28th floor but added that "some guests still find it a bit noisy even up there". I didn't think much of this since I figured not much noise could make it up 28 floors. Unfortunately, I figured wrong. Even 28 floors up, it was like being back in a college dormitory with a party going on next door. To make things worse, the band was playing terrible covers. This went on until sometime well after 11pm. Now that may not sound very late, but when you're coming from another time zone, all you want to do is relax and sleep, not sit up listening to muffled covers of old pop songs. By the way, I arrived on a Thursday night, so you can't even avoid this issue by arriving during the week. I won't be staying here again. This hotel needs to decide if it is a music venue or a place for weary travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!!!”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl_in_UK
Reviews.Content: OMG!!!! I honestly dont know where to begin!! This hotel EXCEEDED all my expectations! Firstly I must admit I'm a hotel snob and only the best would do, and boy did the hotel deliver! My experience was the best I've ever had and I travel very often, practically live out of hotels. I will not bore you with all the details but only salient points. Checking....10/10 very friendly, knowledgeable lady sorry I forgot her name because she deserves to be mention..thank you! I Room I had a junior suite on the 30th floor splendid! views incredible, very spacious, huge bathroom very clean and immaculate Service....excellent, bellman Lester was brilliant, room service excellent, house keeping excellent honestly it was incredible Location...10/10 close to everything, 5 minute walk to Union Square where u have Macy's brilliant Westfield shopping Mall. Close to BART which is very easy to use POWELL & MARKET stop I can go on and on about my experience but I wont...I personally recommend visiting San Francisco the people are lovely, friendly, and you feel safe, there are homeless people around but I never felt threaten. I love the city and I love love InterContinental San Francisco highly recommend. My only niggle was the mini bar stuff is stupidly expensive and it's all automatic so DONT MOVE ANYTHING!!! Also internet is not free and telephone calls are mad expensive! I think for a modern hotel there should be free WiFi...lesser hotels offer it! The niggles did not affect my stay but I needed to highlight them to offer a balance view, I would return to San Fran and this hotel in a heartbeat!!!! Love it and thanks to all the staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Srg_Brazil
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Clean, organized, good rooms and good location. I would stay there again and reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean borning hotel on the edge of downtown”
Reviews.Author: sueBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I landed at this hotel through a Priceline deal. Price was about $200 and it was clean, but very boring hotel. Even the work-out area was fine, but nothing special. Rooms were large (had to pay for wi-fi). Bar had a scene during certain hours of the day but we didn't eat or drink in the hotel and lobby wasn't conducive to hanging out. The hotel was on the edge of a rough area and it was often deserted walking back at night. Wish we'd stay in a boutique hotel that added more San Fran charm to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “5 star concierge service makes this hotel better than the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: jannab1016
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at some amazing hotels, from the Four Seasons to the Mandarin Oriental , and no matter how beautiful and luxurious a hotel is, it's all about the service. I am staying at the Intercontinental San Francisco on Howard Street. I arrived yesterday with a terrible cold and sinus infection. I woke up this morning 10x worse, and without a voice. My husband called Bill Sutton, the concierge, and Bill went way beyond the call of duty. He picked up my prescription himself and delivered it to my room. In all my travel experience, I've never seen such amazing service, especially from a big hotel! He even offered me chicken broth or anything else that would make me feel better during my stay. I read in other reviews that Bill has a great understanding of the city and makes great recommendations. I can see that he's not one of those concierges who cater to his 'favorites' who give him 'favors.' (Have you ever followed a concierge's recommendations for a 'great restaurant' to find they directed you to a mediocre place you could easily find anywhere? That's when you figure the conciege is probably getting a kick back for his suggestion) Bill is the best! I shold also mention -- the hotel is very modern. Nice rooms and bathrooms. The room service is delicious. The location is not ideal, but it is close to fun areas. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed service, bad beds and in a strange location”
Reviews.Author: kinezos
Reviews.Content: Was recommended to stay by a friend who travels on business regularly to SF but I was not impressed. First impression of the hotel was poor. We were offered no help at all by the Porter with our bags when we arrived by taxi. The guy seemed to mutter something to his friend and appeared quite cocky. Not what I expected and in stark contrast to my last stay at an Intercon in Dusseldorf. Service checking in however was good, lady was very polite and helpful. To sum up: Pros: - New hotel - Nice gym, pool and jacuzzi Cons - Located one block too far south of Market. Much is made of Tenderloin and upon checking in we were told that it's best to avoid venturing west of 5th Street. Even though nothing happened the walk back at night past Mission was not particularly pleasant. Better to walk down 4th than 5th from our experience. - I know that American hotels have soft beds but these were a joke. As a result my wife and I did not sleep well and had back ache (we are in our early 30's!) - Fit and finish of the room was a little low quality. The rooms in my opinion will age very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, typical Intercontinental and would happily stay again.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Intercontinental Hotel - modern, polished and a bit pricey. The location is only 5 minutes from Union Square, so that's not an issue. Go a few blocks from the hotel and it starts looking a bit depressed. Somehow, it still feels safe. Not a fan of the "touch the food/drinks products and you will be charged" policy in relation to the bar fridge. Many have mentioned the valet parking is expensive: solution just park on the streets. There are plenty of free parking spots available between 9pm and 7 am. After that it is only $3 per hour. Go one street further down and it is 2 hours parking and only starts at 9am. Just watch out which night the street cleaners come. Also some overnight parking stations available in the area for $10/$20. Back to our experience. The room is fine and we faced the bay. Not much of a view but no complaints. It's a nice place to stay. The only minor issue is the staff don't really seem to know much about street parking rules, so it was frustrating to ask a number of people on a simple question. Overall, I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel close to the Mascone Center”
Reviews.Author: beechmi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent a long weekend in San Francisco and decided to try the IC San Francisco. I'm a Platinum Ambassador with ICHG and was promptly upgraded to a beautiful one bedroom suite on the 30th floor. Floor to ceiling 10 ft. high windows looking out over the city were breathtaking, and well worth booking a higher level room (with the hope, and subsequent success in getting the suite upgrade). We also paid the extra charge for access to the 'Executive Club'. The hotel is located directly next door to the Mascone Center, and is a bit on the 'edge' of the cultural/shopping area of SF. I always felt safe, I just wouldn't suggest walking very far to the east of the property alone. However, President Obama has stayed here twice as president, so the area must be okay if he stays here! This is a fairly new property and it looks it. Beautiful lobby, modern furniture, and all of the polish and class one expects from Intercontinental. The view from the room was beautiful, and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was nice as well, but nothing to get too excited about. Also, for some bizarre reason, there wasn't a lot of storage space for clothes. Maybe I was expecting too much with a 'suite', but no more closet or drawer space than a normal size room (and this room was 700 square feet). The products supplied in the bathroom were also nice, but I cannot remember the brand. The 'Executive Club' lounge was okay, but became very crowded over the weekend. I've been to many 'EC's' at IC around the world, but never seen one this small and crowded. The food was great, and staff very helpful, but nothing special. The same breakfast food every morning, and the staff did not accommodate for 'special requests'. The gym was very nice, and there was a 'lap' pool that was extremely clean. There was a jacuzzi, but the sauna and steam room was only for 'guests of the spa'. Overall this is nice hotel and had all of the 'bells and whistles' one has come to expect from a 5 star business hotel. The one thing that stuck in my mind about this property compared to other IC hotels is that there seemed to be a lot of children. There were so many and they were so loud in the 'Executive Lounge' that we began to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2011NA
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning without making prior arrangements for a early check-in. We were immediately issued a room. This was very helpful for us and certainly not expected. The hotel staff were friendly and the concierge was knowledgable regarding activities in and around the city. The bar staff recommended two excellent restaurants that were within walking distance of the hotel. The rooms and hotel common areas were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quality Room; Decent Gym; Professional service; Good Location”
Reviews.Author: toga1k
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 on a 2 night staycation during holiday season. Overall we are quite satisfied with the facilities and service. The 2 queen bedroom is not large but functional, and the bathroom has both a large shower stall, as well as a full bathtub. The gym is on the 6h floor and is decent enough with 5 treadmills, a few bikes and cross-trainers, as well as various weight machines, free weights, etc. and they also provide headsets to connect to the machine so you can watch TV properly. Also at the gym they provide apples for a healthy snack which is a nice touch and a first I've ever seen. It is also open 24/7 which is great. The pool is next to the gym and only big enough for doing laps. Mr. Bill S. the chief concierge is a consummate professional in providing the level of service and guidance for the guests. I think all other hotel concierge should take a class from him. Valet parking cost is quite high, so I parked on the lot across the street instead. Location is excellent in the SOMA area which has quite a few nice trendy restaurants/bars nearby. Also nearby is the Blue Bottle Coffee house which is hidden off an alley off Mission Street. There is nothing better to start off a day with a cup of strong java with wonderful aroma. Overall, it was a pleasant and relaxing stay for us locals at the IC San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - but relentless nickle & diming”
Reviews.Author: Binghamton
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in lower-end hotels like Holiday Inn Express, etc., and I guess I'm unaccustomed to fancy digs like this. On one hand, the service and people here are terrific. Bill the concierge knows his city inside and out and was a real help. On the other hand, the hotel's incessant nickle and diming is annoying. Their business center charges $10 for 20 minutes of internet time, plus $1.50 per b/w page to print. (!!) Wifi is $15 a day. Per device. And except for a tiny 5 x 5 x 5 inch section in the fridge that's yours to use, it's filled with overpriced beverages that you're charged for if you move them. There's a super Irish pub right across the street. And it is super close to BART and the cable car line. So if you have the cash, by all means, splurge away.

Reviews.Title: “Charging $15 a day for wifi -- per device. Really?”
Reviews.Author: cplumb2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and new and the employees are very friendly. There are a few strange quirks, though. Very nice spacious room with big flat screen tv, but no bathtub? That seems kind of lame. The other thing about this hotel is that they charge for EVERYTHING. The biggest absurdity is that not only do they charge for wifi access -- and big time $14.95 a day. But they charge PER DEVICE. So if it's you and someone else in the family with an Ipad or laptop, you're suddenly paying $30 a day for a service which is free in many other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: Werckmeister
Reviews.Content: I'm used to the top-notch level of service and quality from 5-star hotels in Asia, but the Intercontinental San Francisco really exceeded my expectations. From the fantastic staff to the incredible room with a stunning 180-degree view of the city, this has to be one of my favourite Intercontinental stays ever. The hotel is new and classy but never feels pretentious or overbearing. And the location couldn't be any better - just 2 blocks away from Market street and busy Union Square... The Front Desk Manager Juan was especially wonderful to deal with. The only slight blemish was with the night porter, who was rather surly and abrupt. But otherwise what a great stay! Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: DougM123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The hotel is clean, in good shape, and everything works. Also very quiet. While each and every staff person I interacted with (from the front desk to the housekeeping staff) was professional and polite, two individuals stood out. Eric in the bar was good natured and makes a mean drink - was like seeing a friend each time we stopped by the bar. I also ran into Bill Sutton in the elevator and asked for some recommendations on where to eat. His style (naming three places, then going over them once more, and finally throwing in a fourth place) was refreshing, professional, and spot on. I later found out that he is the Chef Concierge (and rightly so!). I stayed at this hotel because it was close to the convention center and had a good rating here on TripAdvisor - but I will return because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: SagVentures
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed in this hotel one night and from the moment we arrived we were impressed. Every employee from the valet parking attendant to housekeeping went out of their way to make our stay exceptional. When you walk into the hotel you are greeted by the doorman, greeter and front desk person and I don't just mean when you check in, you are greeted this way every time you walk through the front door. It seems to me that the hotel management is making sure that every guest feels special and welcome. The same is true for the bar and restaurant. This is a fairly new hotel and rises above Howard street like an emerald palace. We were in a corner room with a beautiful 180 degree view of the city. They have a full fitness center/spa and indoor pool. This is a non smoking hotel but they do provide two outdoor terraces for your smoking friends. We will definitely stay here again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Marriot Marquis a lot better!”
Reviews.Author: StaceyMalibu
Reviews.Content: I payed $100 less at the Marquis and liked it 100 times more than Intercontinental. My friend from Barcelona was visiting SF for his first time. We stayed at the Marquis his first 2 nights and then as a "finale end" to his stay, I thought the Intercontinental would be great for his last 2 nights before departing. I was sold on the floor-to-ceiling panoramic windows. But, I really wished that we had returned to the Marquis instead. Yes, the room was smaller at the Marquis, but the location, the view, the service, the lobby, everything was so much better. The rooms at Intercontinental are nice, don't get me wrong, but overall, it just wasn't great, for what I was looking for, and for the price that I paid. At the Marquis I was given a room on the 34th floor, but at Intercontinental they wouldnt get us past the 17th floor. First, we were put in a corner room with floor-to-ceiling windows, which I had asked for, but the view was obstructed. I asked if we could move to another room but they only moved us up by 3 floors. I was also a little dissapointed with the customer service at the front desk. The receptionist seemed impersonal and impatient. But, the hotel was very busy and seemed understaffed, so they must have been stressed out. The bellmen; however, were nice. Intercontinental has a lot of elevators. Also, the breakfast buffet was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate business hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpaditya
Reviews.Content: the hotel and staff were no-frills, efficient and adequate; the location is quite good for those willing to walk a bit -- equidistant to BART on Market St and the temporary Transbay terminal. The room was standard issue, but Internet access at $15/24 hours was expensive and should have been included in the room price. Didn't try the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great views. Unfortunately no sky bar”
Reviews.Author: cosmokramer74
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at reasonable rates. it is in walking distance to market street/cable car (for tourists) and bang on the motorway for all business travelleres heading for silicon valley. It is safe to walk from the hotel towards market street (for shopping and dinner) also when its dark, but i wouldnt recommend walking in the other direction. I had a spacious room on the 23rd floor with spectacular views. The only downsides are: - there is no starbucks etc at or near the hotel so you rely on the hotel breakfast which is rather pricey - hotel (valet) parking is pretty expensive at ca. 50 USD/day. However there is parking available at the nearby shopping centre at lower cost (havent tried it myself though) - it strikes me that a hotel with 26 (?) floors overlooking the SF skyline has no sky bar. The only restaurants and bars are on the lower level floors and dont offer anything spectacular

Reviews.Title: “A large hotel with a boutique feeling”
Reviews.Author: binti
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel. The service is outstanding on every level, from check in to house keeping. The room was clean and contemporary with a great view of the city. The bed was warm and inviting. A nice sized bathroon with separate tub and a large comfortable shower. I enjoyed the complementary aromatherapy products and fluffy oversized towels. I had drinks at the bar, unfortunately I was not able to eat at the restaurant, but the smells wafting from that way were intoxicating! Only negative, lots of ambient noise from outside, sirens, etc, and people coming and going at all hours, noise from the hallways. But it's a big, international city, what can you say? Overall a wonderful experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: weluv2travel7408
Reviews.Content: We travel to San Francisco quite often and usually stay at a Wharf hotel. This trip was leisure and business. We stayed downtown because of the location. Next time, we will stay at the Intercontinental again. It is a new hotel. We chose the concierge level room and it was well worth the extra charge. We calculated the cost of what was offered in the Club lounge to room service. It was $70 per person for the offerings. The extra room cost for that level was not even close to that cost per day. Upon arrival to the room, a cheese and fruit platter was waiting for us along with a bottle of water. There was water and candy sitting on the dresser. This was for sale. Reading other reviews I new not to touch it. The items sit on a motion detector and you are charged even if all you do is left the item. The only complaint I had was a mixup that occurred at departure with transportation services arranged by the hotel. But, after returning home and contacting the hotel, the matter was addressed in a satisfactory manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for leisure and business”
Reviews.Author: BLUjaguar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst on vacation in San Francisco. It is slightly away from the tourist trail but only a short 5-10 min walk to Market Street and on to Union Square. Staff were very friendly and service was excellent. The guys running the bar were really good. Eating breakfast in the hotel is a bit expensive but you could try the diner just around the block as an alternative. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chistery
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights. The only complaint I had was my room wasn't ready when I arrived at 16:30. This was due to a late checkout of a previous occupant and it was currently being cleaned. I'd been upgraded to a suite from a club room, so went and sat in the lounge for a bit until it was ready. Very impressed with the room when I got into it about 30 mins later. The hotel is a short walk from Powell St BART station, so if coming in from SFO, it's very easy to get to, and no hills to pull your luggage up. Every member of staff I met was friendly and seemed happy to be there. The club lounge was perfect for breakfast, and snacks throughout the day. There is also a nice outside terrace. Great view from the room of San Francisco and a lovely comfy bed. When I return to San Fran I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent but too expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AGall0
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel and services, all fantastic except the breakfast which is TOO EXPENSIVE. It is no less than 25USD.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Fintraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Intercontinental SF regularly (one or twice a month) for the last year. Every single time I return, they get even better. By now, this is definitely my home away from home and actually my favorite hotel in the country (and that is saying a lot, considering I rack up 100+ hotel nights per year.) The staff is incredible (especially Shehani from Guest Relations) and I feel genuinely welcome when I return. I refuse to stay anywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfectly Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: edyrp
Reviews.Content: Within 15 minutes of arriving in our large, clean room, the phone rang. It was hotel management inquiring as to whether we found everything to our satisfaction. That set the tone for our stay. We didn't have a "view" from our particular room but it didn't matter. The hotel amenities, location, the comfort of the bed, fluffy towels, robes in the closet, etc., made our hotel a great place to come home to after a long day in the city. This hotel is a short walk to Union Square and the Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “My new fave SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMichael
Reviews.Content: Living in LA, I always take weekend trips to SF for a change of pace & to meet up w/ friends. I always hotel hop and try out different hotels. I lucked out with a TravelZoo promo ($109/night), and luckily there was no blackout dates during Pride 2010, so I quickly booked it & stayed here for the first time. I immediately was home & this InterContinental became my new SF default hotel due to its cleanliness, professionalism & modernity. I arrived at 10 pm on a Friday, and requested a high-floor, king-room, and it was fulfilled! Top floor with great views of Bloomingdales & the Castro. My room had a comfortable cushy bed, window seats (long lengthy cushioned sitting area), flat screen TV, a separate shower & bathtub, 2 bathrobes, and a great bathroom mirror. Check-out took 5 seconds on the TV. We also lucked out with street metered parking during the day, so leaving the hotel to go back to SFO was a breeze. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: ziggy1214
Reviews.Content: I love staying here. If there is a convention the elevators and bar area can get a little overwhelmed. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you have what you need. Tipping your staff is beneficial and you should take care of the people that are making your stay delightful! The Club Continental is worth the fee. The service and amenties you recieive far outway the price. This will continue to be the place I stay in the city. I sleep really well here and the noise level is extemely low, with the exception of sirens and normal city noise.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else but here”
Reviews.Author: bucktownjetsetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night in SF and I regret not staying here for the remainder of our trip. Service is unparalleled and the location is perfect. Although they say it's in SOMA, it's just a 2 minute walk from Union Square's BART transportation and the Westfield Mall. The lobby, bar, and hotel restaurant are upscale chic. The 6th floor has a club concierge lounge that I highly recommend upgrading to. The lounge provides complimentary drinks, mighty leaf tea, cappuccinos, and appetizers. Not your typical mozzarella sticks, but items such as beef wellington and spanakopita. Look for Luis in the lounge. He's the friendliest person ever and really makes you feel at home. Also for such a nice hotel, the price is more than affordable. I would definitely stay here the next time I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “consistent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: hp1212
Reviews.Content: This newer hotel is my preferred ICHG hotel in San Francisco, as it reliably offers the expected clean, modern room, with great views from the upper floors. Its pricing varies widely, as usual with large hotels attached to convention centers; on a quiet weekend, it can be a very good deal indeed! Its location is great for convention attendees, acceptable for tourists, San Francisco being a relatively compact city with decent public transportation, with a number of pleasant areas to walk through.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer666
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times for business over the last 2 years, and I have always had a great stay. The location is not be best for nightlife or experiencing the rest of the city, although you can still walk to places like Union Sq. The rooms have been spacious, clean, and quiet. The bathroom is spacious and nice too, although the decor is a bit dark. When I stay there, we usually have meetings in the hotel, and food and service are great. We usually don't eat in the restaurant, so I can't comment about that, but the bar is fine. It's also relatively easy to get to the hotel from SFO. The gym is great too. I'm not sure I would stay here with my family; probably would look for something nearer Fisherman's Wharf or Embarcadero [I know, touristy, but what do you expect?]. But I wouldn't rule this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelsfor2
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The room was exactly what I thought it would be. We were offered an upgrade to a corner room on the 17th floor at check in. The room was clean and spacious, the views were amazing. We met great people at the hotel bar. Noticed some famous people. Staff was friendly and accomodating. There is not much to do around the hotel at night. We found ourselves constantly catching a cab- so the location wasn't great, but the hotel is still awesome.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing suite for price, reservation managers misleading”
Reviews.Author: wiz330robbins
Reviews.Content: This two bedroom suite is very unimpressive for the price. Worked with hotel reservation manager and assistant directly several times prior to stay and this suite is not what was promised. The view is great but the bedrooms and baths are completely inadequate for this price point. No outlets, walls damaged, drapery closures broken. Ambassador status not recognized at this Intercontinental -- not revealed during reservation process. Very disappointing for an Intercontinental. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying in this hotel. It is pretty pricey but well worth the money. Rooms are very nice and comfortable. The secret to staying here is to ask for a corner room. Very close to the moscone center (walking distance). Only downfall for me was that it's a little far from union square. But it is close to the metreon which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: hotel1809
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 27th floor and although the hotel was fully booked it was very quiet. Convention center right next door. Westfield shopping mall 2 blocks away and Saks and Nieman Marcus are also close by. Staff we helpful and pleasant. Lively bar at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, spa facilities, and location”
Reviews.Author: crisalmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are locals, but decided to stay at this new hotel that offered pre-natal massages. Starting with the massage: It was great! They don't use the table with the hole in it (which does not afford any support for your belly at all), but use foam blocks on top of a standard table, which allow you to make adjustments and was very comfortable. All spa staff was great and accomodating and I even endulged in a paraben-free, vegan manicure/pedicure. I got french tips and it's been over 3 weeks and my toes still look perfect! The hotel room was very clean and spacious. Everything you'd expect with an Intercontinental. If you have a room on the side facing the street, I could see it could a get a little noisy because the fire dept is only 2 blocks away so fire trucks go by every couple of hours, but this didn't bother us too much since we were on a higher floor. The location is great! It's only 2 blocks from the Metreon and 4 blocks to Union Square. For the price that we paid, it was great hotel experience which allowed us to easily walk to the Westfield and Union Square for some shopping and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant room, close to transportation and malls”
Reviews.Author: Vella
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Four Seasons or the St Regis, but since the Oracle conference was in town, i could only find a roon at the Intercontinental. I found my stay very pleasant. The rooms were clean with a large screen TV. The bed was nice. the bathroom was relatively large. My only complaint was that around dinner time it was very hard to get a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “clean, staff are helpful”
Reviews.Author: janetravel11
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights, the room was clean. The outdoor jacuzzi and pool were nice. The only complain was the parking was expensive. If I knew how much it cost ahead of time, I might have consider other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant visit, pleasant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flipsoft
Reviews.Content: This trip was wonderful. The rooms were clean, service was excellent, and the beds were very comfortable. They upgraded my room for free. The only downside was that the overnight parking was steep. Around the corner though, I was able to park for $25 a night.

Reviews.Title: “not so inter--ior”
Reviews.Author: deah1
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, spacious rooms, very gracious staff. Way overpriced breakfast buffet. Close to and a part of large conference center. Do not take a right when leaving the hotel--not the side of San Fran you came to see, unless you want to do research on the homeless. Much walking to get to city center and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Teresa H
Reviews.Content: Nice, newer hotel. Staff was very nice, with several good recommendations for things to see and places for dinner. Transit stops are within walking distance, as are shopping and restaurants. Forget about getting a cab, but that's the same anywhere in SF. Our room was on the 28th floor and was the size I'd expect of a hotel in a large city...not really big, not too small. It was clean and the bed was very comfy. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: pondguyOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for a business conference. Hotel was very clean with a modern feel. Staff was very nice and helpful. It was rather pricey, but most high-end hotels are in major cities. You would think that they would include free internet service, something that most moderate-priced hotels provide their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skoog
Reviews.Content: Great location - easy access to public transportation. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Moscone Center & shopping”
Reviews.Author: RiaRy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for a week whilst my husband attended a conference at the Moscone Center just down the road. The hotel's also excellently placed for local bars/microbreweries, restaurants and shopping - just around the corner from the Westfield centre. We were in a club room on the 33rd floor; the room was spacious and had fantastic views over the bay. The bathroom had an excellent shower and Aromatherapy Associates toiletries - luxurious, but the lavender and ylang-ylang shower gel was a tad over powering for day-time use! The room gave us access to the club lounge with free wifi, a couple of PCs and a printer and a steady supply of food and drink on tap; we subsequently discovered from some of my husband's colleagues our room actually worked out a lot cheaper than booking at the regular rate and then paying for internet access and getting breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. I was advised on booking that continental breakfast would be available in the club lounge and was expecting a few manky looking croissants and some coffee (obviously too used to British/European continental breakfast) but the food was amazing: a selection of cold meats and fish (including Gravadlax), fruit, loads of different breads and pastries, preserves, bacon and scrambled eggs. We missed afternoon tea every day but took advantage of the cocktails, wine, champagne,beer and (delicious) hors d'oeuvre that were available from about 5 o'clock. There was also cake, cookies and digestifs laid out after dinner. I only had 2 criticisms of our stay; firstly, the staff could have been slightly more attentive - we basically had to work everything out for ourselves; and secondly the tomato based tasting menu at Luce, whilst delicious, was miserly to the point we had to go to the club room and fill up on cookies and was probably the only disappointing meal we ate whilst in San Francisco. I would definitely recommend staying here if you need to be in central San Francisco, and make sure you visit Le Charm French restaurant around the corner: absolutely the best French food (especially the onion soup) I've eaten outside of France.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here for business if you don't have to”
Reviews.Author: JFKforinternational
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a conference and can't wait to leave the hotel. It's one of those mass-market places with no personal touch and virtually no service. I didn't even get a new shampoo or conditioner day two...and it's not like it's anything fancy--and i couldn't take a shower without it. Don't even try to get a cab between 8-9:30. And don't look for help. Anybody who even looks over at the cab line acts like they are doing a favor. And if the limo-driver they have has to take you where you HAVE to be because you have been waiting over 30 minutes, be prepared for them to tell you, "sorry, he's a bit surly today". I feel surly after two nights here and am thinking of taking a red-eye back to NYC to simply avoid another night here. The only entertaining thing was watching the desk clerk flinch as i asked him what hotels they are in a points program with when he had to say "holiday inn". I personally have had better experiences, work ones even, at a Holiday Inn. Basically, i recommend staying someplace else unless you get a sweet deal. There are just too many other options here.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: carolinaboss
Reviews.Content: Company had to do business in SF. Had some extra time for pleasure. Top notch hotel-everything was first rate! Very proffessional-my clients were very impressed-would stay here again in a NY minute

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Ambassador Perks”
Reviews.Author: mparel
Reviews.Content: We are here at the hotel tonight. IC Platinum Ambassador perks have been reduced or ignored. We had to request an upgrade at check in, even though we reserved a club room. Previously the upgrade was completed prior to arrival. The fruit amenity was absurd compared to our last stay. There is no longer a daily fruit amenity and the bottle of water is a full 11 oz bottle of warn Evian for 2 people, although it is delivered nightly. When I asked tonight if I could have a second bottle because there are 2 of us, I was told that I should order one. There is no water besides club soda available in the club. The IC club lounge no longer serves throughout the day. At 2 pm we went to the club for a snack and requested a beer. The attendant said she'd try to find us one.The only snack offered was a cream of broccoli soup. No chips, nuts, etc.I am disappointed in this hotel or perhaps this is just a blip in service. We have 4 more nights here, so we'll see how it all turns out.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CountyDownStar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights as part of a 3 week vacation in CA, Was the best hotel of the trip by far, stayed on the 29th floor with amazing views over the city, the executive lounge was one of the best I have visited in many years. Staff were excellent, attention to detail superb, all in all well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: materialboi
Reviews.Content: I really don't do too many chain hotels... as I prefer smaller boutique style hotels, but we had a day to fill in SF and didn't know where to stay... the SF Intercon was clean, efficient and had excellent staff! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: doe1976
Reviews.Content: 4 nights stay in september 2010, location is really nice, pretty close to market street and all shops), room on 9 floor nothing specials, bathroom was big and clean and bed was really comfortable. Moscone center is very close, rate was high due to Oracle convention during my stay (booked with PL). WIFI not included (should be in an hotel like this), paid 35$ for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but parking charges excessive”
Reviews.Author: cchri1p
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel... it is new, very modern and close to the Moscone Center and Union Square. The bed linens were very high quality, the TV was a nice size flat screen, and the bathroom was beautiful. Our room was on the 23rd floor, with floor to ceiling windows and a great view to the west and south of the city. We got this hotel on Hotwire for $119/night over the Labor Day weekend... truly a great deal ! We didn't use the spa or pool (both looked nice) but we did you the fitness center and it was very nice. There was a weight machine, and several treadmills with built in TVs. The fitness center and pool are free for hotel guests. I would have given the hotel 5 stars except that the parking charges are truly outrageous ($61/night for valet parking). This is more than the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton charge for parking, yet the Intercontinental is in SoMa, a "transitional" area. If you go to the parking lot at the corner of 4th and Townsend (catty corner from the hotel) it is only $20/night with in and out privileges! Another thing I didn't like about the hotel is the "automatic" mini bar. What that means is that if you move an item, the computer monitoring the mini bar assumes that you have consumed it,and you are automatically charged. There is some space for personal items in the mini bar. In conclusion, a great hotel if you get a deal on Hotwire, avoid parking at the hotel, and don't touch the mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “Super Service and comfortable rooms with great views”
Reviews.Author: sonnet4
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental for almost 20 years, and decided to try the other Intercontinental. Although the area around the Moscone Center is definitely not Nob Hill, it has its charms. Great restaurants and shops nearby and no high hills to climb. The service at the desk was extremely accomodating and friendly. We did not like the room assigned to us, and preferred to pay extra for an update. The room we got ( on the 26th floor) was a corner room with floor to ceilig windows and a spectacular view of the city and the Bay Bridge. However, the interior design was not up to the standard of the Mark Hopkins. The colors here are sickly pale green and boring beige &the curtains did not match. But the view out of the windows made up for the lack of taste in the overal decor! The bathroom was fine, but the amenities were made in China and did not compare to those at other Intercontinentals we stayed in. The maid did not replenish the shampoos and lotions for the second day of our stay, which I thought was rather stingy. The service in the restaurant was fine, and the hostess was extremely kind and friendly. The buffet breakfast was good, but I missed the eggs benedict which the Mark Hopkins always serves on Sundays. Overall, I would stay here again because of the courteous management and staff; the proximity to great shopping and restaurants--and the English Pub right around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: lawg8r
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights and loved every minute of our trip Several months before the trip, and before we made the reservations we joined the Ambassador Club, which is partly the reason the stay was so wonderful. Although joining the club costs $200, it was completely worth it, as we were given a free weekend night ($260), a free room upgrade (to a "Junior Suite"), access to the Club Level Lounge, free internet access and late checkout (4 pm). The upgraded room was huge - there were two entire walls of floor to ceiling glass, giving us amazing views. The decor is modern and clean without being cold. The king-sized bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever encountered. The housekeeping staff was attentive and almost invisible (in a good way). The Club Lounge was a perfect place to unwind and relax after a long day of walking around the city. We'd enjoy a cocktail and rally to go out for dinner. There was always coffee and soft drinks available, and usually some delicious food to snack on. Above all, the staff in the lounge were the most helpful people. Shehani and Regina made us feel so welcome and comfortable - they were the most delightful women! The hotel bar specializes in grappa and served some interesting drinks made with it. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but I have heard it is very nice. The spa was very posh, although I recommend making reservations there well in advance. We took the red eye back to Florida, so we had several hours to kill after we checked out. While our suite was not available to stay in past the 4 pm late check out, Shehani found a room for us to stow our luggage and freshen up before we left, which was most appreciated. We did have some trouble upon checking out, since someone had charged $300 to our room in the hotel restaurant, but it was eventually cleared up within a week (which is probably too long, but given how attentive the staff was during our stay I'm not taking off a star for the delay). Overall, this was the most pleasant hotel stay I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Starzee78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Labor Day weekend for 3 nights. It's the fanciest hotel that I have ever stayed in. Although I booked a room at a great price I was disappointed at the fact that parking is $60 per night, even though it's unlimited in & out priviledges. When I checked in the front desk clerk gave me a free upgrade to the junior suite which made up for the parking. Your luggage is brought up to your room for you. My room was immaculate. Two out of the four walls had floor to ceiling windows. Not a great view of the city but the best view I have ever had. The bed was very comfortable. Word of advice, don't touch any of the items in the fridge or the waters and chocolate bar on the dresser unless you want to pay for them. Don't even move them. They are monitored electronically and if moved or picked up it will charge to your room. I loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Pat46655
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. The concierge was wonderful. She was very patient and accomodating. The hotel was clean, neat and the location was convenient. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Moscone Center location”
Reviews.Author: longhorn_mike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night with my wife who was in San Francisco for a convention at the Moscone Center. The Center is easily accessible on foot from the InterContinental. Restaurants and shopping were also within walking distance. Everywhere else we went required just a short cab ride. Service was fantastic. The concierge was helpful with dinner suggestions. The business office was staffed, which was helpful when I had an issue sending a fax. Room service was prompt. Room size was decent. Bed was very comfortable. Wired internet is available in the room for a fee. Apparently the fee is waived for Priority Club members, but we weren't informed of this until we checked out. Would recommend staying at InterContinental if attending a Moscone Center event.

Reviews.Title: “Itchy”
Reviews.Author: yyzcupcakes
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel has decent reviews, and it's a nice hotel -- modern, pretty, well-located. However, I can't give it more than one star because things were biting me. In our room, we found not bedbugs, but FLEAS. I didn't even know what they were, but apparently fleas jump. And they weren't on top of the bed, they were in the sheets. The hotel was accomodating and moved us to another room, but by the time we left the next day, I had seven or eight bites on my body. Whether they were from the fleas, or something else, I have no idea... but I'd never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: amymichelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on the last leg of our California trip. The hotel is beautiful and the hotel bar had great pork sliders (had them for dinner twice in three days). I usually don't eat at hotel restaurants, but made an exception on this trip because we had good food at the Sheraton we stayed in before we came to San Francisco. I'm glad we tried the hotel bar-as I was too tired at night to go exploring to see what other food options were near by. There was a Bucca De Peppi (sp?) across the street, but I'm not big on food chains--I'd rather eat local. The room condition was good--but at night we could definitely hear the calls for the taxi to pick up other guests--especially the last night when there was a whistle. While the location was good, a block closer to Union Square would have been perfect. I liked Union Square a lot as a base and the hotel was close to the Cable Cars and bus (recommend the 3-day bus pass). The concierge were great! They recommended good places in China Town, Italian area, and I'm glad we were able to walk everywhere and take the bus/cable cars. The hotel was very clean but had some quirks--with the double bed, the person nearest to the shower can't sleep when someone else is in the shower because of the light reflection--but the rooms were overall very nice. I'd recommend to others traveling in the area--as long as they walked towards Union Square and not away. All in all, I'm happy I booked this hotel especially for the hotwire rate I got and I'm so glad we didn't stay in Fisherman's Warf. My only real San Francisco complaint was that it was so fogged in we didn't get to see the Golden Gate Bridge--which would have been cool to see. Had a great time other than that and the hotel can't be faulted for the weather--especially when we read that San Francisco is often pretty foggy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: bajanboy66
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on our recent ten day trip down the CA coast. It is an excellent hotel in a good location. Near to restaurants and the railcar stop at Market Street. Service was good, very clean and helpful staff. We soaked our weary bodies in the Jacuzzi. Only downside is parking is $60 per night. Otherwise I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location, & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smarmydave
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Intercontinental San Francisco near the end of August 2010 and I really enjoyed my stay. I canâ€™t come up with any negative feedback based on my time there. I stayed in a room on the 16th floor facing Howard Street. The room was clean, very quiet, and comfortable. I didnâ€™t use any in-room services such as the internet service, wet bar, etc., so I canâ€™t comment on any of that. The receptionist that checked me in, Xaviera, was very nice; check-in was a breeze. I thought that the location of the hotel was fantastic: near the Powell St. BART station, close to many restaurants, Union Square, etc. I visit San Francisco often and this was one of the best values Iâ€™ve experienced considering the rate I booked. I wonâ€™t plan another SF trip without checking on this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and concierge service but”
Reviews.Author: KathyC82
Reviews.Content: The location and comfort level were great, but the lack of complimentary in room or lobby coffee was a negative. Internet service is not free either. Their own restaurant was pricey. We had good,decent food at the corner Irish pub "Chieftain" and also across the street at the Italian restaurant "Bucca." The room was very quiet, we were on the 23rd floor. Convenient transportation.The F line bus to go to Fisherrman's Wharf was 2 blocks away. Took the Bart from the airport to Howell and Market and the hotel was a short walk from there. The SF Visitor's Center is in that location also. If you're thinking of going, purchase a Go Francisco Card on line. It's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Veronica
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room on a high floor which allowed for great views. The room was well sized, very clean, modern, and bathroom was great as well. Location was very good, maybe not the best since you have to walk 5-10 minutes to get to Powell & Market and Union Square, where you can find the cable cars and lots of mainstream shopping, but still good enough. Ordered room service once and was very good. Front desk receptionist was very friendly. Only two complaints: 1. The price of $15 per night for WiFi is quite steep for a hotel of this caliber, especially since it's a business hotel. 2. One doorman/bellman was rather unhelpful and unfriendly, not to say rude, but in general staff was quite nice. Overall, a very nice hotel, with a great value for money ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Almost too comfy”
Reviews.Author: fasaxc
Reviews.Content: Due to a slight mix-up at check-in (they didn't realise I had a reservation and so checked me in without taking it on board) we ended up staying in a King Deluxe. The bed was so comfy and the curtains so dark (a good thing IMO) that we almost slept in a missed breakfast! View was excellent from the 23rd floor and the room was quiet and swish. When they realised the mix-up in the morning (we should have had a cheaper room but with breakfast included) they gave us the breakfast for free. Breakfast was very good. I indulged in a cooked breakfast but it wasn't greasy at all and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Coba5
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to Moscone Convention Center. Walking distance to Union Square. Rooms are nice and very comfortable. However, you often hear the sirens of fire trucks even though we were on the 27th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and everything you need”
Reviews.Author: yvrgirlToronto
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate by mentioning Travelzoo $129 (check them out too if looking to use the spa for a way discounted price). The room was nice with floor to ceiling windows but small compared to the Hyatt Regency Embarcadero (very outdated but much larger room). The bathroom was contemporary and superb. We enjoyed the large glass shower that can fit 2+ people (just letting you know how big it is!). The toiletries smell fantastic from EcoBoutique and included shower gel which most hotels do not. We asked for a high floor but this still doesn't protect you from sirens at night. Also ,the elevators take a million years and will stop at many floors so if this bugs you, don't ask for a high floor. The swimming pool and hot tub were great as San Fran is super windy - bring a jacket and get in the shower or hot tub after escaping back to your hotel. BART from the airport and get off at Powell. Walk 5 mins to get to this hotel. Walk on 4th. That is also where the Metreon cinemas are if you want to catch a movie or something on IMAX (we saw Inception! - awesome). Location is great, turn left out the door then left again and within minutes you are shopping or hopping on a cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey gem, but excellent service and exquisite dining”
Reviews.Author: jujubean45
Reviews.Content: Work paid for my 4-day trip here at a nearby conference, and service was so good here that I didn't mind staying here a few days extra for some leisure sightseeing with my husband. Well, almost. I'm not normally one to pay $166/night, but I figured, work paid for my flight and meals, so I can splurge a little. The room was sleek and comfy, with sliding bathroom doors, a floor to ceiling window looking onto the city, and an iPod port. The concierge and bellhops were excellent on every occasion - offering detailed directions to conference and tourist sites and laying out all the options to get us to the airport on time. The hotel's modern gym was adequate for my daily runs and I easily scheduled a massage at the spa next door. But the thing that blew my mind away was the restaurant, which nobody would guess was any good. Who goes to a hotel to try out the restaurant? We took a chance on Luce because the hotel had touted everywhere that it not only boasted a Michelin star but a chef who'd recently won on Iron Chef America. I wouldn't come to the hotel for the restaurant, but it certainly doesn't hurt that you have a critically acclaimed restaurant just downstairs. The only negatives? It's straddled between a high and low income neighborhood, but I was born in NYC so I'm used to seeing homeless peddlers. Tourist sites require a lot of walking, but we didn't mind and local transit was easy to use and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDTraveler
Reviews.Content: My stay here was great, although I was only here for one night on a business trip. I had a room on the 22nd floor, so I did not hear any city noises. Surprisingly even though my room was right next to the elevator, I never heard it. The lobby was nice and had high ceilings---it reminded me of a Hong Kong type of hotel. The room itself was spacious and roomy. The only complaints that I have was that the shower was a standing only shower. The internet worked fine for me. There was also a problem with an iron which was a bit sticky...it was a pretty cheap iron. Aside from that it is a nice hotel and I would stay there again for business. It is very close to Union Station/Powell Street and the Cable Car. $15 a night for internet is a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: thumper2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a really great stay! Room, linens, price, customer service, location are important considerations in selecting a hotel in SF. Room: This was a very comfortable room overall. The size was generous especially for a room in SF. We stayed in a regular double room...not a suite etc... If you are like me and appreciated a modern "feel" in a hotel w/ clean lines and bright airiness, you will be satisfied. The views were amazing from our floor to ceiling windows on our 25th level room. The bathroom was very "spa" like and the pictures on the website are pretty true. Linens: very comfortable. I am one who travels with my own pillow and didn't this time. I will the next as the pillows were slightly lacking. If you aren't particular w/ your pillow you will likely find their's to be great. Down comforter and sheets were nice. Price: We got a deal on hotwire for ~165.00/night. It was listed as "union Sq 4.5 stars". Customer Service: the front desk staff and concierge were all very helpful and eager to help you plan your days. The complimentary car service to anywhere within about a mile raius was a nice perk. Be aware it is first come first serve from 6-8. get there a few minutes before 6 and you will have no problem. Location: Okay, so this is where i was slightly disappointed. It is about 2.5 blocks to Market street, 2.5 blocks to BART/Cable Car station. Doesn't sound far at all but this hotel is honestly not in the "union sq" area. although, 2.5 blocks is pretty short, if you are walking that far w/ questionable individuals around it seems much farther and stressful. Walking either direction from the hotel was questionable people. So much that after 6 pm or so we (being only 2 women) stayed in our room or took cabs. we didn't feel comfortable walking late. Daytime walking was better. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but quite a generic hotel”
Reviews.Author: acy_london
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and it was a pretty good base from which to explore SF. However, the hotel has been built within quite a peculiar area. On paper it is near to Union Square, MOMA etc. If you turn left out of the hotel all is fine - turn right and you are entering into a slightly scary neighbourhood. The hotel itself is modern, quite generic and quite corporate. Great rooms and breakfast, and lovely (but overcrowded) pool - can't really fault the place - but if you are looking for individuality you won't find it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGators
Reviews.Content: The San Francisco Intercontinental provided a great stay for 4 nights. The room on the 25th floor provided panoramic views of downtown and the bay. The hotel is located about 2-3 blocks from Union Square and about a 15 minute walk to AT&T Park. Some on here have mentioned the area may be a little sketchy, but we did not find this to be the case at all when walked around the area.
