The rooms are of decent size, and the bathrooms may be a bit small, but it is a high rise hotel and that is the norm. I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: SolusIreland
Reviews.Content: I do not rate this hotel highly and will never stay there again. Â First the positive aspects - good location, clean and modern hotel. Â  Negatives - Poor customer serviceÂ - Â When we were checking in, the lady on reception confirmed that we had booked a standard room but immediately crinkled her nose and told us that this was quite a small room but if we gave her 200 dollars to join the hotels club , she would give us a better room and the advantage of a late check out. Â We declined the offer but this immediate sales pitch made me feel awful and a also anxious about seeing our room. Â As it turned out the room size was ok but because it was shaped like a tetris block, it felt smaller than it actually was. Â Another thing about the hotel is that it lacks any character or atmosphere and there is no warmth from the staff. The bar - just one and it's tiny. Â Food - the restaurant is at the end of the bar again lacking character, the menu choice is quite limited and very pricey. Â No free wi fi, although I think that this may be common in hotels in San Francisco. Â  I would recommend the hotel for business but not for pleasure, far too cold.Â  Â

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_Like_Gooood_Hotels
Reviews.Content: This really is a beautiful hotel. Very modern. Great Rooms. Nice swimming pool, only the changing room is missing at the pool, you will have to travel through the hotel in your swimsuit :-) The staff at the reception is very good.The woman said, you have booked a queensize bed, but you need a king because you are tall, so she gave me a bigger room with a kingsize bed. So that was ok! The Staff at the door in the lobby should be better trained. I arrived with 2 suitcases, but they did not bother to open the door, they just looked at me and saw me fighting with the doors. The hotel is clean, no worry, but someone got sick on our floor on the carped in front of the elevators. 2 days later, the vomit was still on the floor... Very good hotel, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: awo1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice are. Its actually walking distance to the Moscone center, as well as to some highlights like cablecar etc. So you might not need a car in SF. Although pricy, its worth the money. The higher level room do overview the bay or SF.... on top its relative quiet there so sleeping has not been a problem. The personal is very friendly and always helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan
Reviews.Content: We booked what I thought was a great rate via TravelZoo.com ($129 a night) for this hotel. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was very helpful in wanting to make our stay enjoyable. This hotel is new, decorated in a very contemporary fashion. Our room was large and the bathroom was one of the the nicest hotel bathrooms I've ever seen. The beds were great and comfortable. Large lcd tv in the room. The rooms were super quiet except for the occasional siren from emergency vehicles on Howard street (must be a fire department nearby). I guess the only thing I didn't really like is they charge for internet. (Parking also would have been expensive but we just used the BART and didn't have a car). To get to the hotel from BART, walk 2 blocks south on 5th street from Market and turn left on Howard. Hotel is on corner between 4th and 5th Streets. You can also walk through the mall, exiting through Bloomingdales, cut across the parking lot, and then cross a one-way street to the back side of the driveway entrance to the hotel (although it's not marked). It's a great short cut to and from the hotel to the mall. We did it multiple times each day. BTW, there is free wireless in the food court at the mall if you don't want to pay for the hotel's internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Classy”
Reviews.Author: mjstrid69
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research in trying to find a hotel that was going to be safe and clean, I found this hotel after reading other reviews and how some found this on Hotwire. I also was able to get this hotel off Hotwire for an extremely reasonable price. The rooms were clean, great views of the city, and the service was outstanding. Everything was within walking distance, restaurants, shopping etc. We stayed here 3 nights before heading down to Monterey/Carmel for a few nights. I should thank other TripAdvisor members for pointing out the parking garage behind the hotel. Valet was almost $60 per night, but the garage was $32 per 24 hours, but it does not really have in and out privleges like valet would. We just planned on keeping it parked there and not moving it for 3 nights while we walked and took short cab rides wherever we went. Although we did not eat or have drinks here, we spent the days touring the city of San Francisco, the Intercontinental was great to come back to enjoy with a bottle of wine at the hottub. Although the ISF may not have the ambiance of some of the boutique hotels that you can find in San Fran, we liked knowing what we were getting and wanted plenty of room which can sometimes be hard to find in some of those other smaller hotels. We would definitely recommend this hotel and come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't change a thing...”
Reviews.Author: Lassitgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered all that we wanted for our 6-night stay. From the welcoming and helpful front desk staff, the concierge staff (thank you Bill) and doorman (Ernest was great), to the convenient location and proximity for all of the attractions, this is an ideal hotel for leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST COMFORTABLE STAY I HAD IN SAN FRANCISCO!”
Reviews.Author: stars1983
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the best hotels I'd stayed in SF so far. It's modern and clean. The location is perfect. close enough to union square to walk there and yet far enough not to get the noise at night. The staff are so helpful, the management is great and the rooms are very nice.simple but nice.We got the junior suite. If you are staying there you have to get at least the junior suites. They have windows all around, even the bathroom! you have the view of the city and the bay. We went there for our anniversary so the management gave us a very nice room with great service. The bed was perfect and just waking up to that view was amazing. I'd stay there again if I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “More like a university frat house on our stay”
Reviews.Author: HarbourView32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental for a few days in June. After a long drive and exhausting to San Francisco we were very disappointed to find a number of rooms on our floor were partying until 3 am in the morning. Despite repeated calls to guest services and a visit by the hotel security, the party continued. Also disappointing was the cost of parking at the hotel ($60US). On the positive side the rooms were large. There are definitely better located hotels if you are visiting San Francisco as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel but in a tough neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: umass123
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights recently. Very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff although the hotel is not in a very good neighborhood. It is a long walk to fisherman's wharf and generally a few blocks away from most things you would be looking to do from a tourists perspective. The hotel itself has an upscale restaurant and bar located off the lobby, the bar menu is reasonable priced but the choices are lacking. We also felt paying for the Club level was well worth it as the Club offers a free breakfast, free appetizers and drinks in the afternoon and free internet access (you have to pay a $15 daily fee to use the internet in your room). The gym is adequate with a few treadmills, machines and an indoor pool. No locker room or health club type amenities. If you want to be right on top of fisherman's wharf or other trendy areas of San Francisco, I would not recommend this hotel. If you are looking for some exercise and really an easy way to see all the city has to offer by walking through the city, I would recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern, sleek hotel in a perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: CSquaredC2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Friday night while we were in town to watch a couple of baseball games and chill. Upon arrival at about 10am, our room was ready and we were allowed to check in early. The hotel is located just south of Market and Union Square. This is my kind of hotel - sleek, modern, clean lines. The bathroom was roomy and the beds were comfortable. We were on the 25th floor where we could see out towards the bay. I don't know if it was because we were so high up, but we didn't hear any traffic noise from Howard Street below. We also took advantage of the pool area and fitness center. Overall, I thought this was a great hotel and a new SF favorite. I've tried many hotels in the city and I'm likely to stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Property, Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: IntlSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights during a weekend getaway. I booked a standard room on the Club floor and was given an upgrade to a one bedroom suite. (Platinum Ambassador benefit) We arrived in the evening and check-in was pretty quick and efficient. It did not seem very busy at all. We were hoping to use the club lounge for a quick snack, but when we arrived they were closing up and the staff looked annoyed when we walked in. A simple "sorry, you just missed it" would have sufficed instead of a dirty look. Room - The one bedroom suite we were upgraded to was a handicap accessible room located on the 31st floor. The suite consists of a living room with a half bathroom, a separate bedroom, and a huge bathroom with a separate shower and tub. Each room had a huge LCD television and nice furniture. The bed was very comfortable. There were floor to ceiling windows which afforded a view of eastern San Francisco and part of the bay. The view on the other side of the hotel would have been much better (facing north towards the Golden Gate Bridge). One annoying feature of this suite was that it had a connecting door to the 2 story penthouse suite, so during the 2nd night, we were subjected to a loud party going on with people shouting and music playing. It was too much and we ended up moving to a regular room on the 32nd floor just to get some sleep. The walls were somewhat thin, as we could hear the other neighbor on the 1st night watching TV. You would think for a nice hotel like this, they would have invested in better soundproofing. Food - We ate breakfast at the Club Lounge, which was oddly located on the 6th floor. Good selection of various foods, including some hot choices (eggs and bacon) along with the usual bakery items and fruits. There was some smoked salmon which was nice. We also tried room service, which was a bit awkward. This was the first hotel in my life where I called for room service and was immediately placed on hold for several minutes before someone answered. Finally, we were able to place an order, which arrived in about 30 minutes. Fortunately, the sandwich we ordered was very delicious. Location - Finding the hotel was pretty easy, as we used the BART system from SFO. It's about a 5-10 minute walk from the Powell Street station. The hotel is located in the middle of random office buildings a bit off the beaten path, but still not too far from the tourist areas. You can easily walk to some popular areas such as Union Square and the cable car stop. Since it was a short getaway, we did not try out the other facilities at the hotel. Service in general was questionable. Every time we entered or left the hotel, none of the staff would greet us. The doorman would ignore us and we would have to open the door ourselves (no big deal, but a bit odd for a hotel of this caliber). As a Platinum Ambassador member, I have traveled to many InterContinental properties around the world. I would have to say this property ranks at the bottom of the list in terms of service. Overall, this is an OK property, but I would recommend finding a hotel closer to the tourist areas. There was nothing that really stood out that would entice me to come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but horrible reception staff”
Reviews.Author: feffery
Reviews.Content: The rooms are modern, clean and quite spacious, big enough to comfortably have a few suitcases lying around. The location of this place is close enough to the main action union square and downtown SF but far enough for a bit of peaceful breathing space (around 5 mins walk). Being that close the city centre means that you basically can use the Muni transport system to get to wherever you want such as Fisherman's wharf, Castro, China town, Golden gate park, and bridge. Facilities wise the hotel gym is well equipped for a hotel, a combination of free weights and fixed weight machines, plus multiple treadmills, cycles and cross trainers. In addition to the usual supply of towers and filtered water, the gym even offers complimentary apples, which I thought was a thoughtful touch. The only problem I had with this hotel is the the hostile reception staff, which I thought was sub-standard customer service especially from Intercontinental. The person who served me was rude and unnecessarily hasty and spoke to me like I"m checking into a prison rather than a hotel. What annoyed me the most was that the moment this person finished serving me, she immediately proceeded to chat with the bell hop about personal matters. The concierge service on the other hand was awesome, they were courteous and very wiling to point you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental for family trip”
Reviews.Author: avalonandl
Reviews.Content: We had 10 of us at the hotel. First it is newer and very nice. The rooms were very well furnished with great beds, big bathrooms and clean. Location in SOMA is good. SOMA has some issues as all of SF has. Many homeless roaming the streets in this area. This hotel is really set up for business and convention travellers with expense accounts. Breakfast is $ 27 per person. You can hike 2 blocks to get a croissant and coffee for $ 5 which I did often. We just didn't feel like spending 50 bucks for breakfast. Rather put it to dinner and wine. Good points- excellent staff, excellent pool and exercise rooms, excellent serrvice. We booked this hotel because we wanted a hotel with a pool for the youngsters. The food is very good for breakfast. Did not eat at Luce for dinner. My sister and her family was given adjoining rooms on 11th floor and she did not like the view. We were on 22 and had a corner room with a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, almost downtown”
Reviews.Author: mucben
Reviews.Content: I like the Intercontinental San Francisco very much as it is very modern. Try to get a high floor room facing the city. Room was very spacious and had modern equipment (HD plasma tv). Club Lounge is rather small, but had one of the nices Intercontinental staff in the whole IC world. Try to get a window seat at breakfast and you'll see the fog coming over the hills. Pool was closed, but pictures looked nice. Gym has modern equipment and is very clean. Front desk staff as well as Concierge are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel that ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: ald59
Reviews.Content: Good location two blocks from Westfield Shopping Centre and Union Square.Booked a suite which was large ,clean with two bathrooms and had one of the best sleeps in a hotel room and as a frequent traveller with top status in both spg and Hilton hotels this Hotel ranks high.Was up graded to club and the lounge is excellent for breakfast and snacks and drinks throughout the day. I was surprised by the previous reviews about the internet.As a platinum ambassador received complimentary internet which was fast and reliable. Staff were friendly and helpful and the Hotel has a good gym and pool. This will be my Hotel of choice now in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: foureyes18
Reviews.Content: I knew there was a problem when I checked in and was told Internet was spotty and problematic and that if I wanted a connection I should go to one of the conference floors to get a connection. As I rode up to my room, someone casually mentioned to the person they were with that they couldn't believe there had been no internet for almost three days. Three days. In a hotel that is relatively brand new and serves mostly business and convention attendees? Absolutely unacceptable that I was not able to work in my room at the end of the day. Room was not all that clean -- there were stains by the toilet and not all dirty towels were replaced the next day. Went to iron my shirt only to realize it had rusty water in it that stained my shirt. In a budget hotel, this would not bother me, but for a worldclass hotel this is unacceptable. To cap it all off, I ordered room service my last night. First call was put on hold for 5 minutes. I hung up. Next call, I got my order in and was told it would take 45-50 minutes. 1 hour and 10 minutes later I got a call from in-room dining asking if I had gotten my order yet. Clearly no one had put in my order. Only saving grace was that I was given my meal for free. Too bad I got it almost two hours after I ordered it. Hotel is nicely appointed and rooms are smartly designed but considering the selection in San Francisco, I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - What a hotel, LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!”
Reviews.Author: foxyboo
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and what a great hotel. Location was amazing!!! Just a few quick minutes walk to shopping heaven and the cable cars! Upon check in you felt like a valued guest. We were staying in a Club suite which allowed us access to the Club Intercon. If you want a great experience, make sure you book the 'Club level' option it takes your stay to another level. The Club Intercon is located on Level 6 and the accompanying suites are high up, however due to a fear of heights they relocated us to level 10, which still had lovely views over SF. Club Intercon gives you: > Breakfast - don't expect a full buffet, but you will find scrambled eggs and bacon/toast ; fruit and cheeses; cereal and juices; pastries; tea and coffee. More than enough. >Complimentary drinks bar 5:30pm to say 7:30pm - Fabulous, before dinner you can enjoy a drink and some great canapes, watch some TV, read a magazine or chat with the staff, special mention to Luis who is just fabulous and very friendly. >Supper nightcap - Call in after dinner for a Baileys on the rocks - great touch. >Best part - Business centre - free internet access, to check your emails, print off documents and plan other parts of your holiday/business trip. The staff of the Intercon SF are helpful, friendly and very professional. Concierge recommended some great restaurants which were fantastic. The rooms were incredibly clean and housekeeping were courteous and happy. The ONLY downside was the valet parking cost US $60 was outrageous. If you are not a guest of the hotel , fine, but 3 days of valet parking hurt. US $25-30 is appropriate. You can park at a big carpark around the corner, but it didn't look safe and as we had a rental car we felt it was safer with the hotel. So in summary: Plus+ *Very luxurious, modern and clean *Great staff, efficient, courteous and professional *Great location, close to Shops and walking distance to Union Square *Rooms great size and comfy beds and pillows, the topper was like sleeping on a cloud. *Club Intercontinental - Amazing can't rave enough, takes your stay to another level. Minuses - *Valet parking - very expensive *Noise - be warned SF is a big city and this hotel is located in the heart of it, you will hear sirens often, 1 night in particular must have been busy as the sirens woke us on a number of occasions, nothing to do with the hotel though, but it did impact on our sleep a little. Perhaps the higher you are the less noise you hear. In Summary a really great hotel, it was a pleasure to return to this hotel everyday after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. And if I didn't stress it enough, the beds are incredibly comfortable, I never wanted to get out of bed!

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocky2319
Reviews.Content: my husband daughter and I always choose this hotel to stay in San Francisco : 1. super clean 2. best beds to sleep in we always sleep well 3. love the view 4. staff are friendly 5. close to shoppng 6. delicious buffet breakfast worth every penny My only two negatives 1. I went to order room service I asked the man on the phone if the hamburger could have a vegie patty substitute, and he thought I was from another planet, and when I asked what vegetarian options they had he gave me the choice of two, a sandwich and a tomato pasta. sad but, true for an international hotel. 2. like others I think the internet fee is not right, but, I feel that way about all hotels that charge internet fees in our times when we have wireless. It is 2010. Feel this could change and would make the experience even more great. Include it in the hotel fee upfront as this should be part and parcel with a stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent View”
Reviews.Author: Cool-son
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during a quick vacation. Hotel was great, clean, and modern. The amenities were quite expensive though. Internet in the room was $15 a day, parking was $50 per day, and drinks at the bar were also quite pricey. This hotel seems more geared to business travellers than vacationers. We stayed on the 25th floor and the view of the city was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience.”
Reviews.Author: PaulinATL
Reviews.Content: LIKED: Hotel entrance is about 4 blocks south of Market St., so it is close to Union Square shopping. Rooms are very nicely decorated and modern. DISLIKED: Outrageously expensive internet access ($14.95 per day). This is absolutely unforgiveable when less-expensive chain hotels are now offering free WiFi in your room, and the room rates are already well over $150 per night. Also, the location is just far enough away from Market that it feels a little dicey at night; not really dangerous, but I wouldn't want my mother walking alone around there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and really pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Philip519
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 colleagues were delayed in San Francisco as a result of the ash cloud and picked up a great deal on Hotwire at the last minute. We were delighted with the hotel - great accomodation, great spa and really friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: csjohns7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the rooms were FANTASTIC!! I was here with eight guys for a bachelor party. We got a great deal on the rooms. Huge, great bathrooms, nice beds. The check in area was very modern, not my scene but I could appreciate it. The bell hops / check in staff were both helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to Union Square and AT&T Park”
Reviews.Author: Leshaface
Reviews.Content: Came with my in-laws and sis-in law for a short over night stay to watch a Giants game and pricelined for the SOMA/Moscone Center area, seeing as we needed to be close enough to walk to both Union Square and At&t park.. Was able to snag this hotel for about $100 a night! Fine with us! Booked two rooms one for the hubby and me, and the other for my in-laws and sis. Upon check in, they noticed that we requested one of the rooms to have a king bed and if at all possible for the rooms to be close to each other (at least on the same floor). There wasn't a standard room available on the same floor as the two queen sized room, so they said we'll just upgrade you and handed us the keys... Yup, they definitely upgraded us! From a King Standard to a King Junior Suite! It was a beautiful rooms!! In-laws were definitely JEALOUS!! Two full walls of top to bottom windows, a HUGE bathroom, and a humongous over-sized living space!! I could not believe that they hooked us up like this! Even my hubby was amazed at the beauty of this room! Bed was so amazingly comfortable; didn't want to wake up the next morning! The shower was so lovely...I took two during our one night stay! Walking to Union Square is only 2-3 blocks away..not far at all! And for AT&T park, it only took us about 15 minutes to walk...I love walking so this was nothing to us! If you ever need to come to this area for leisure or business, check the Intercontinental first! You'll be so happy with this place, I wouldn't be surprised if you wanted to find me to give me a huge hug for the tip on the awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not boutique”
Reviews.Author: robinchristenson
Reviews.Content: Loved the 180 degree room on the 24th floor- great restaurant and fabulous service...Just felt a corporate-- good design but more contemporary than modern I normally prefer something just as upscale but with more of a boutique feel- Still prefer Hotel Vitale but would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A cool luxury hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: GrayGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the start of May on the first leg of our honeymoon. Travelling from the airport we found the hotel pretty easy to navigate to using public transport as we used the BART to get to Powell and then a 5 minute walk to hotel. Once checked in we we given a floor on the 30th floor which had great views towards at&t park and bay. We had been left a lovely touch in the room of a complimentary bottle of prosecco complete with a card as we were on honeymoon which was very much appreciated and went down extremely well after our 16hr travels. This level of service and thoughfullness should not have been a surprise as it had already been displayed when i was trying to source a hire car before i travelled and got excellent advice and service from Bill Sutton through e-mails and on our 2nd day we were helped so kindly again by William Hall as i had forgot to print my Alcatraz tickets and realised we would need loads if ID to pick up tickets at pier so William allowed us to e-mail him conformation which he could then print. Staff on arrival and departure each evening were also very welcoming. The room was lovely, fresh and spacious and really liked the wall to ceiling windows and the i-pod docking station. One of the main reasons i chose the hotel was due to its newness as i dont like old and tired hotels. We used the pool every morning and was pleasantly surprised how quiet it was, on the first 2 mornings we had the place to ourselves which was a bonus and the gym looked good too although never used There were a few negative things about our stay though which were the intimidating walk to the hotel in the evenings, the overall average room rate, the lack of a bath tub, the expensive wi-fi and not being able to have any fridge space in mini bar. I had read reviews before going saying that the area is a bit shady at night, we made the mistake of stopping off one evening when returning at a liquor store on 5th street for a bottle of wine and i felt quite intimidated by people inside and outside so we did a bit of powerwalking back to hotel, maybe a tourist mistake but you dont want to be looking over your shoulder on holiday. Since we were moving around the States on our honeymoon (8 different hotels/motels) the room rate was the 2nd highest we paid and didnt even include a breakfast and only 4th/5th nicest out of 8, maybe a san francisco thing, we found santa monica the same in terms of value for money. The lack of bath didnt bother me but my new wife was looking fwd to a good soak after our travels and so was disappointed. The wi-fi charge is expensive and again whilst comparing to other hotels (2 motels didnt have) we stayed at this was the only hotel that didnt offer free wi-fi (albeit others lose charge in resort fee) which was disapointing as for 2 travellers with i-phones the wi-fi is a great way to research places to go and restaraunts during your stay. The mini bar was all tagged electronically so couldnt remove items and replace with bottled water / wine etc which was also disappointing although there were ice buckets. Overall though we really liked the hotel and would recommend due to its overall newness and luxury feel together with great service.

Reviews.Title: “i left my heart in (intercontinental) san francisco”
Reviews.Author: slyeee
Reviews.Content: this is really a long over due review of this hotel. (since i stayed there almost a year ago) 1. yes, the parking fee is ridiculous (60 + tax). I hate to sound like a witch, but don't rent a car, problem solved. get rides (if you have family or friends), or BART from OAK or SFO airports. The stations are 2 blocks away from the hotel. 2. i don't really get the internet charges either $15 per day. Most hotels now offer this as a free service. Staying at intercontinental means you are willing to drain 200-300 bucks per night, so 15 bucks is nothing. NO... as someone who travels often, I think internet should be free. You're really going to lose numerous potential 200-300 a pop clients over to oh I don't know, maybe the four seasons for 15 bucks? 3. service was great. i didn't need much. easy check in, clean room, friendly faces. which during my stay, i got all and then some. my entire stay was for 3 nights, but every time i left the building or came back, the receptionists smiled, the housekeepers asked me how i was doing, and the doorman got the door. what more could you ask for? 4. during my stay, the pool was unavailable due to construction, but i look forward to using the pool when i am back in town in august. i've looked at other ihg hotels (such as mark hopkins, and holiday inn on van ness), and to tell you the truth, i rather stay at intercontinental. maybe the only exceptions would be the W hotel or the 4 seasons. 5. i seriously wonder about the negative experience one may have at this particular hotel. may i ask if it may have been your attitude? Treat others like how you would like to be treated. Kindness is a two way street folks. Yes, it is the hotel staff's job to be accomodating and provide a positive service but they too are human. Come up to them kicking and screaming, you really think that's going to get you far? Really?! 6. The hotel is close to SFMOMA, 2 blocks away from downtown shopping centre (technically 1 block away from bloomingdales). A block away from the convention center, bus ride to the giants at&t ball park. See you in August!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a demanding business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Fintraveller
Reviews.Content: My 4th stay at the Intercontinental. I spend 60-100 nights in hotels annually and this one gets better each time. They still have some kins to iron, but thanks to their outstanding head of guest relations (Shehani), I ended up having a wonderful stay and will return. The only major disappointment was their restaurant Luce (which I have truly enjoyed in the past). I dined there on May 3 and the service was rushed and unattentive (if ones wine glass is empty by the end of appetizer, one would think that in a Michalin restaurant, someone would come to offer a refill at some point during dinner. Also, my appetizer was salty that I had to return it and the response was 'chef agrees the pancetta is a little bit too much tonight'. The lobster was ok, nothing spectacular and the dessert was mediocre at best . Every chef can have an off night but what was really troubling was that I wrote a lenghtly comment card reg. my disappointing dining experience and although I was staying at the hotel the whole week, no one from the restaurant bothered even to contact me. It will be very interesting to see, whether Luce gets to keep their star this year. But all in all, hotel with great potential, and some gems in the staff. Worth considering on your next business trip. And do stay on the club level - the lounge is very convenient for informal meetings and the waiting staff there is outstanding as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Food-Critique
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 3 nights. This place is superb. Very nice new hotel and with a great comfortable bed with large rooms. Central to everything and the area is fine! There is a fee to use the steam room and sauna (spa area) although the indoor was free. A big thanks to Jadey Chin who was very helpful and went out of her way to make sure I enjoyed my stay. Thanks and I look forward to future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy comfort”
Reviews.Author: rrpowell
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay here. The staff was most accomadating, my room was extra clean and stylish. As always love the robes and the slippers felt like I was home. The resturant and bar are awsome food was great presentation just as wonderful! Beds kept me snug as love.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city hotel”
Reviews.Author: fussylady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here originally for four nights and we were then returning for one night and then the volcano happened. In the end we stayed for an extra three nights added on to the one night and then we went off for two days and came back for another three nights. For the extra three nights we kept extending the trip day by day. We are a member of their priority club which is fantastic as among other things you get an upgraded room. We had a beautiful room on the 30th floor over looking the town and a bit of the bay. The second visit we had an even better room on the 30th floor which was a corner room with views across from the Golden Gate Bridge to the Bay Bridge and beyond as we had two full floor to ceiling windows. It was truly magical. When we returned we had the same type of room but on the 21st floor so not quite such a good view but they sorted out an excellent rate for us so no complaints. By the time we left we felt as though it was a second home as everyone was so friendly and knew our name as well as helpful. The concierge desk was fabulous especially Bill who put together our trip to Yosemite and organised our hire car. The front desk staff were also exceptionally helpful especially Janet and her colleague who I am afraid I have forgotten her name. The hotel is in a great location about two blocks from the shops. We did not eat in their restaurant as we were seeing so many people we did not have time but it looked fantastic and apparently has a Michelin star. It has a very good gym and also an indoor pool which is very long so good for doing lengths. There is also a very good hot tub. They also have a spa which I did not have time to use. It really was one of the best city hotels I have stayed in and even being a large hotel it did not feel like it as the staff were all so friendly and helpful and kept welcoming us back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Stay - My Go-To San Francisco Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: little_miss_pink
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Intercontinental for a total of 5 nights whilst on holiday in San Francisco, and it was a really enjoyable stay. We began our trip by staying for 3 nights before visiting Santa Barbara for a couple of days and then returning to San Francisco and The Intercontinental for 2 more nights. For the first part of our stay we were on the 16th floor which had amazing views and was really very quiet. On the second part of our stay we were on the 7th floor, which was nosier but more due to other guests than the hotel itself. Both times we asked for quiet rooms and got them - we didn't have any other rooms on either side of us (instead we had store rooms). The rooms and bathrooms were also incredibly clean. The Intercontinental is in a really great location, around 5 minutes walk from the Westfield shopping centre and about 10 minutes walk from Union Square and the various cable car stops. One of the best things about The Intercontinental were the excellent staff, specifically Ray, one of the concierges (I feel he deserves specific mention)! He helped us book tickets to Alcatraz and to see Wicked at the Orpheum theatre, helped us book our seats for the flight home, gave us information on how to use the Muni and painstakingly highlighted maps to direct us to places we wanted to see. A complete star. The hotel gym was really very good - light and airy with plenty of equipment to go around, and the swimming pool was also a really good size and rarely busy. In fact I would say the only downside to The Intercontinental was the fact that we had to pay for Wi-Fi, but we only needed to use it on one occasion, and the rooms were such a good price that I don't really feel that this is enough of a negative to lose a star from the rating! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would turn to The Intercontinental whenever I visited San Francisco again, which I hope will be soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to conference center, cable cars and shopping!”
Reviews.Author: stargazer59
Reviews.Content: The only thing we didn't like was the restaurant. Expensive and not to our taste.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: talkinghawaiian
Reviews.Content: I only have good things to say about my stay here Saturday night April 17th. Arrived about 9:30 am Saturday morning and was able to check into my room right away. It took about 7 minutes to wait in line and get the room card. Walking distance to the convention center and Market street. I was able to walk (it's a long walk) to Chinatown to have dim sum on a sunny Saturday morning. Two blocks away from the Powell street BART station. The location was quiet and away from the crowds yet close enough to activities. I got a good rate from the hotel's website which made it a excellent value in the city. My standard 8th floor room was modern, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. My visit was just a snapshot so maybe I would have found flaws if I had stayed longer. Keep this hotel on your radar especially if you can get a good rate the next time you are in San Francisco. I know I will be staying here on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “They just don't care”
Reviews.Author: JL_02143
Reviews.Content: Two minor, but important things were wrong with my room: Non-functioning safe, and unreliable third-party internet service provider. Staff bungled every attempt to fix the problems, requiring that I be in the room to get the (empty) safe fixed and forcing me to call the ISP myself and work out the internet problem on my own. I was then double-billed for internet service ($35 for 3 days), then credited one week later. Staff just doesn't care. There is no continuity between shifts, and it is very difficult to understand many of the front desk personnel's heavy accents.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MODERN HOTEL IN SF”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and stay here, if possible, when visiting San Francisco. It is so refreshingly new and bright for the typical San Francisco hotel. It is spotlessly clean and the service is excellent. My only disappointment this time was no complimentary house car service anymore (they now charge $20.00 per in-town trip, plus tip). The bellhops had challenges getting cabs for guests at the dinner hour, since it is the only hotel in the area and usually we got a cab that was dropping hotel guests off.. Aside from this we had a great stay and were very pleased with our accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Newest Hotel in downtown has a LOT going for it!”
Reviews.Author: markmywordz
Reviews.Content: This hotel opened a little under two years ago and is still seems like it opened just yesterday. It is exceptionally clean, well appointed and comfortable. My wife and I stayed here for two days in two different rooms. We were on floor 25 on one day and on floor 28 on another. The upper rooms are an 'upgrade' and you should try to get these rooms if at all possible. The only real differences we saw were a free bottle of water and a chocolate bar on the desk and a much more confortable bed. The hotel is pretty high tech and eco friendly (this being San Francisco eco friendly is important). Neat eco friendly items: energy efficient light bulbs in all outlets (but not the dim slow to warm up kind...these you couldn't even tell were any different), a special eco setting on the heat/AC that allows you to engage a sensor and if it knows there's no movement in the room it will cycle down the energy use of the heater/AC unit, and what was really cool, an electronic system to notify housekeeping of whether you want to make up the room or not be disturbed....no more of those silly door cards that drop....you just punch the button in your room and it illuminates a light outside). There are some neat amenities like iPod docking station, comfy soft robes and even a bathroom scale. The bath towels are very large and soft....bigger than any hotel towels I've seen in the last decade or so. The room has a huge, excellent flat screen HDTV with plenty of free and PPV options. There is an in room fridge stocks with the typically overpriced drinks and snacks. There's a free coffee maker (Keurig) that brews one cup at a time in a very mess free system. It is located just two blocks from 5th and Market Street which offers a large number of public transit options, including four different rail lines from that location (BART, Muni, Streetcar and Cablecars). You can easily get here from the Airport on BART and only have to walk about two blocks. (The BART fare is only $8.10....a bargain compared to a taxi). It's also easy at that intersection to jump a cable car to Fisherman's Whart ($5 one way) or hop on the street cars ($2) which can take you down Market and down the Embarcadero to eventually end up at the Wharf. But if you want to drive, there is valet options and two self parking lots just one block away ($35/day). It has a good restaurant with an award winning chef and a nice lobby bar. Now some drawbacks.....there's no free internet. It's $14 a day. And, the busienss center charges for everything except printing boarding passes (which are free). The pool is the narrowist I've ever seen. But it is long and ideal for lap swimmers. There are two lanes and if you swin for fitness, you'll love it. If you have kids who want to have fun....it's not that great. The hot tub is nice, though. Public gathering spaces are not abundant immediately inside the lobby. The hotel does have two larger gathering spaces, but they are upstairs and you have to take the elevator. Not a big deal but you can't just loiter easily in the front of the hotel unless you want to sit over the concierges (who are all very, very friendly.....they were great in helping us figure out places to go). The other issue is that the location is just a bit outside of the really active area of SF. If you want to be right in the middle of the action, this might be a few blocks past your confort level, but if you want to be close by without the ruckus....this spot is ideal. But I was most impressed with the overall cleanliness. The hotel still felt brand spanking new. And, this hotel is just a little bit outside

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: snorton1
Reviews.Content: Most stuff about this hotel was fantastic. I liked the rooms, the bed, the shower and amenities, the breakfast, and I think the bar was good too (though expensive, if I remember). We only experienced two problems. First, when we arrived to check in, we were asked if we could wait until 7 pm as they had a large group to check in. In return, they offered us breakfast coupons for each day we stayed there. When we returned to check in that evening, the person checking us in knew nothing about it. So we had to argue for a bit, and wait until that person could contact the person who had checked us in. My wife was more annoyed than I, as she would not have agreed to check in later without getting a substantial return for it, being tired from the trip. It did get sorted out later, and we received what they had promised. The pool was also closed while we stayed, though they had made arrangements with another hotel for us to use their pool. Without those two experiences, which I assume most travellers wouldn't have, I would definitely give this a full 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TMichael2
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is a teriffic hotel. We just spent four nights there and could not have been happier. The rooms are large, spotless, and well-furnished. The location is very convenient to sights, shops, and restaurants. The service was outstanding. Altogether a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Personal service throughout"”
Reviews.Author: MCBDurham
Reviews.Content: Having read a previous review from "thejcar" on the 20/03/10, I was unclear what to expect from this hotel, but had nothing to be concerned about. Having previously arranged with the concierge (Bill) for a transfer from SFO, we were whisked to the hotel in a little over 20mins. Upon arrival, our rooms were pre-allocated, and being an Ambassador member, we were given a Club King and an upgraded 1 bedroom Suite on the 32nd and 29th floors respectively. Many thanks to Shehani for her professionalism. The rooms were large with excellent views of the Bay and Cityscape from floor to ceiling windows. The corner suite afforded spectacular views with windows covering almost all of the 45â€™ of the outside wall area. Amenities were plentiful, and housekeeping discreet but thorough. A big plus for this hotel is the club lounge, which offers no less than 5 daily treats, staggered at circa 4hr intervals during the course of the day. Breakfast buffet, lunchtime soup, afternoon snacks, evening canapÃ©s and supper cookies all with accompanying drinks. The evening night cap was particularly appreciated, and was served in style by Louis, to who special thanks must be extended. The hotel is a short walk from Union Square, however slipping along the hotel driveway and through the municipal parking lot at the rear cuts the hike down to circa 500m from the hotel to Bloomingdales, where the Westfield Mall and major outlets emerge. The area of Soma is a little run down, but head towards Union Square and everything is within a stoneâ€™s throw. Top notch city, top notch hotel and more important, first class personal service throughout. Big thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great beds”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during a business trip and really enjoyed it. The conference i was attending was at a busier hotel about two block away so I liked being able to leave the chaos and return to a calm oasis. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were spacious. I didn't like the scale in the room. Made me feel compelled to weigh myself after overindulging at some of San Francisco's best restaurants :-). Overall this was a fantastic hotel that is pricey and parking is NOT cheap. I opted to self-park in the garage at 5th & Mission and walk to the hotel. Saved myself $30 a day instead of using valet at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great looking hotel, shame about the service at times.”
Reviews.Author: Cloughy1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in March, and to be honest I was slightly disappointed with the level of customer service I received. I think this hotel is very much geared towards business travellers and also the more mature holiday maker; I felt as if they looked down at you if you did not fall into these categories! My initial thoughts were that for this level of hotel there were very few people to meet you and open doors for you when you arrived at the hotel, although this is a small detail it does make you feel welcome. The parking is very expensive per night at the hotel (around $60 for 24hrs) that being said there is a public multi story car park next to the hotel where we parked for $32 per day. San Fran is expensive to park and this was a competitive rate. Another slight gripe I had of the hotel was that they would have charged me $30 for the privilege of empting the mini bar in the room! The positives of this hotel were that it was modern and close to the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, cool hotel perhaps more suited to business”
Reviews.Author: thejcar
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of this hotel, and would have given it the highest rating, except for fear of misleading tourists! As a local staying for a night in the hotel because my job schedule was KILLING ME (it is very close to the financial district), this hotel was seriously everything I could have asked for and more. The staff was incredibly friendly, for such a large hotel it felt very private and my room was perfectly quiet, and the overall comfort of the room was just wonderful. However, I recognize that the way I feel about the location as a local is very different from how a tourist might feel. For me, and for business travelers, I see a great, newish, comfortable hotel with cool views that is close to BART, convention center, and the financial district. If, though, I were a family traveling for tourist purposes, I might feel disappointed by the location. It's kind of right on the border between modern/sleek SOMA and sketchy SOMA. As a local, I don't feel uncomfortable in the location, but it perhaps looks a bit sketchier than it is? If I had kids, I would probably feel unnecessarily unsettled. I am probably being way too detailed and nuts in this review, but it's only because I really loved this hotel and would recommend it in an instant to business travelers, but would hate for any leisure travelers to feel disappointed by an overly glowing review! If you want to be close to the FiDi and the convention center and/or your conception of SF won't be totally wrecked by seeing the non-Full House style vistas, I really recommend this hotel as a great value!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed several times”
Reviews.Author: LeTerrible
Reviews.Content: I come to SF often as I have some business and most of my family is here. Thaat being said, since I like to stay in my own place and not with family, I've stayed at all the 4/5 star hotels in SF over the years. I am now currently at the 'Intercontinental SF' on a short visit and as always, I find it to be an exemplary hotel. Up until 2007, I had been a fan of the Mark Hopkins for several years but it is getting a little worn around the edges. This cutting edge Intercontiental within walking distance of downtown and the Bart, is simply the 'Cats Pajamas'. I am always remembered or it is noted in the computer that I am a repeat guest and I instantly am upgraded to a fine room with a stunning view that should cost twice of what I wind up paying. The breakfast is the average 4/5 star price but...it is a wonderful selection and it is worth the price to sit in your room and look out at the view while enjoying top quality ingredients (which are listed..including organic and heart healthy) in your room. It is also fab in the restaurant. The Spa is simply the best in SF. I have had a massage to a half day of treatments and it is a TOP spa. for a spa alone...not a hotel spa. The rooms are all fresh, very clean and tastful as are the bathrooms. I was surprised to see a review that said front desk was rude ..perhaps the reviewer was not in a good mood? I find the staff in general to be the friendliest and most client geared in SF. That is why I take these reviews that don't make sense with a grain of salt. I can validate that this staff is most friendly and looking to please...I know nothing about the reviewer who wrote that they were rude...but in several years that has bnot been the case for me. San Fransisco is a spread out city and you must walk. Wherever I stay, unless I want to just be in one neighborhood, I walk. This is why you come to the city on the bay. To say the Hotel is out of the way is ridiculous as then it would apply to all hotels in SF. Walk...or if you are going to the other end of town...ask the concierge who is terrific for a suggestion. This is a review that has experience from a well heeled traveler...take my advice. PS The ftiness center is also high end!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but not so location at night”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: We knew it is not at the great area at night so we mostly used taxi. We were upgard to Excutive suite with free fruit plate, cholocate, and a bottle of champian. clean, Large suite and two big bathroom so thre was no need to fight for it. Althought there are 2 safes in the room but both are too small for laptop. loughe is great with no other guests there. we had the whole lought ourselves in the morning and afternoon tea. would come back again for sure. The louge is hidden at one of the floor and so difficult to find at the 1st time

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best balance south of Market”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: One night only here but I have stayed before. It is close to the Moscone center and also middle sized conferences at the Marriott. Rooms and service are generally much better than the Marriott. Couple issues: 1. Internet is expensive and room log in does not extend to bar areas - I am happy to pay $15 but if i do i want tthe run of the place on my laptop. 2. they closed their restaurant at 9pm on Wednesday night - I had siddled up looking for a meal and half bottle of wine from their excellent selection only to told I was out of luck- room service or bar menu. No reason given when asked, actually somewhat rude. The bar menu was Ok and the wine at the bar by the glass interesting but expensive compared to other hotels in the area that have dropped their prices. The breakfast buffet the next morning ($28) was expensive but worth it - very well done indeed. So step out from dinner and drinks but eat in for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “don't pay them to be rude to you”
Reviews.Author: rud01
Reviews.Content: front desk staff was very rude nice hotel but not worth the attitude don't pay them to be rude to you plus $15/day for internet room doors slam very loudly stay elswhere

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels I have...”
Reviews.Author: Todders728
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I was on business travel for a conference and my company's travel page screwed up the booking. The hotel staff found me a room for 5nights even though they were completely booked. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - ridiculous cost to park”
Reviews.Author: brysal
Reviews.Content: Nice new property, clean and comfortable rooms. The one major drawback is the $58 per night charge to park your car at the hotel. They were indifferent when I mentioned the exorbitant charge at the front desk and were quick to deflect blame to the outside company managing parking. The parking charge is a major negative for the Intercontinental and will impact where I choose to stay for my next stay in San Francisco. So word to the wise, take a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “modern and refreshing”
Reviews.Author: stephenday50
Reviews.Content: close to shopping ... have to try the vietnamese pulled pork sandwiches at the bar ... rooms are clean, modern, sleek ... location is great as its a block away from shopping, four blocks from the theatre and about a ten minute walk to union square as well as a being close to the cable car 'station'.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, clean and a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: We found a steal for this hotel on travelzoo and booked it not totally knowing what to expect. Boy am I glad that we booked this place. It is a great hotel in a great location as it is close to lots of great shopping, close to the bart station , walking distance from AT&T park (home of the San Francisco Giants and a short ride away from Fishermans wharf. The room was clean with a nice view of the city. Bed was comfortable. A nice sized flatscreen tv. bathroom was nice. The service was great as whenever we needed any info as to how to get somewhere in the city, they were very, very helpful. I absolutely highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco. And if you find a really good deal like we did, it is icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly bad service for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil087
Reviews.Content: The treatment I received at checkin during a recent stay was probably the worst I've encountered in my last 50-100 hotel stays. When I arrived, the front desk clerk said their computers were down, and asked me to come back in 15 minutes. He offered a complimentary upgrade, and suggested I wait in the bar. I requested a free drink coupon, which he provided. When I returned 20 minutes later; their computers were still down, and they checked me in manually. Itâ€™s totally unacceptable for a 4 star hotel to ask a customer to wait to check in instead of checking me in upon arrival . (There was no line at the check-in desk, so as far as I could tell the hotel had no justification for making me wait. I asked another employee how often their computers are down, and she said â€œfar too oftenâ€�.) During the rest of my stay I encountered several more minor service glitches. The wireless Internet didnâ€™t work from my room (when I tried to accept the $14.95 daily charge by entering my name and room number, the system rejected my login attempt. I received unhelpful suggestions and disinformation from a guest relations staffer until I escalated to a manager, who was able to temporarily resolve the problem. But the problem recurred 6 hours later. Again I lost more productive time). Then, when I went to check out, I found my drink had been charged to my room, even though I had given the bar attendant the free drink coupon. Overall a very unsatisfactory service experience, even though the facilities are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: mike-lcf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting in late January. The hotel is new and very clean. Location is good to the Yerba Buena center, convention center and Metreon. But its a walk to the financial district north of Market. My room was well decorated and spacious; good sized work desk and flat panel LCD television. The wireless internet worked well. Bed and furniture were comfortable. The staff down at the bar (near the lobby) is friendly, as is the doorman and concierge. On the other hand, the check-in staff at the front desk was less friendly. I had a document package which was delievered to my attention at the front desk and they couldn't find it when I checked in. They assured me they would continue looking and would let me know. I never heard from anyone at the front desk again. The conference room space is functional and works fine. Nothing spectactular but fine. The buffet food served at conference events in the hotel was less than average for hotel food. Salmon was dry. Chicken dishes were similarly dried out. The TV checkout did not work in the morning and there was no final statement left at my door, which was a bit annoying as I had to go down and wait in the lobby to get my closing statement. I would stay here again on business if I need to be south of Market in San Francisco. My first choice would be the St. Regis which is nearby but about one or two levels higher in overall quality and service. However, if the St. Regis were full, I would not be unhappy staying here as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VeeP3
Reviews.Content: Very clean , beautiful view....first arrived everybody we were in contact with from the hotel very nice , professional , welcoming. I enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: Petsetter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We were upgraded to a room on a higher floor with a better view. Room was really nice. Staff was very friendly and we got a very good introductory price on the room. Hotel is very clean and very modern. Hotel was also a short walk from Bloomingdales. Got a massage at the spa--it was good, not wonderful. All in all, highly recommended especially if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: SwedishMagnus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, quiet and has great service. The staff was was helpful and friendly. I must say the best thing was the bed which was super comfortable. The location is also very good, only a few blocks away from the main shopping ares. But 15 USD for using the wireless network for 24 hours? Come on! 8 USD for a bottle of Evian? Give me a break! I know this is standard practice for business hotels but it is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel next to convention center”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel next to the convention center. I got a corner king room on 24th floor with view facing west and north. Staff is generally very helpful although there were some rough edges due to high volume of guests - it took three tries to get feather products removed from my bed, and when they did finally come it took them 30 minutes to remove the feathers because of all the products and it required two people but they did not charge for this service. Ate breakfast in the lobby and had trouble getting decent service, again due to high volume of customers. I complained to a manager that this was not Denny's and given the prices we should have better service - I got an apology and some of my breakfast comped. Hotel wifi is excellent although the regular wifi service is spotty in the lobby. But the service in my room is great and it makes sense because there is an access point in the closet. Bathroom is very up to date with a decent tub for soaking, although it is not separate from the shower. Plenty of large plush towels and robes that I can actually wear. Climate control is also excellent and bed is comfortable even without the feather top mattress which I asked them to remove. Foam pillows are very tall and a bit uncomfortable to sleep on - they did not loft down like a feather pillow, but also I was not sneezing either. Extra blankets are wool which is very nice because I had the feather comforter taken away. The wool blankets were plenty warm. Front desk and business office serve are also excellent - I had help sending a fax and scanning a document as well as printing a document, although they do charge a significant rate for this. Parking is expensive (all over the area actually) so I did not keep a car at the hotel but instead took BART to other areas in the Bay area. BART station is a 5 minute walk from hotel which is fine if it is not raining. Hotel is also near the theaters so I went to see a Broadway show one night. This was an unexpected added convenience. Hotel is right next to the convention center and very convenient for conferences. Minibar is very well stocked although not cheap it is very convenient. Coffee maker is keurig with those individual cups but they only had one decaf (along with two reg coffee and one green tea). I would have liked another decaf. real 1/2-1/2 creamer served with the coffee, also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “sharp contrast between pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: smth_snail
Reviews.Content: Great location! It's in the very heart of SF, and on the other hand Howard Street of on which the hotel is located is much less crowded than other streets in that area, 4th for example. Room is indeed spacious. I didn't like the fact that my room doesn't have a openable window, and the room had a bit of carpet smell. They told me none of the rooms has an openable window. They put me on the top floor which is the 33rd. Despite of the good view I tried not to think about the possibility of earthquake. Frontdesk told me, of course, that the hotel is earthquake proof, but really nothing is earthquake proof confront a 8M one. Some other good hotels in that area have only 8-10 floors. Avoid rooms that are by the elevators. I guess this applies to all hotels and it's not fair to pick on this, although I was bothered by the noise a bit. Internet and dining are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay! Great location, hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Rojoeve
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a weekend and had a great experience. The hotel was clean, modern and in a great location (near SFMOMA, the Metreon, Union Square, etc). When I asked if we could have a room with a view, they said they already had and sure enough we had a room on the 23rd floor with a wonderful view of the bay. The design of the hotel was great in that even at the end of the hall there was a large window that provided a view of the city as you walked to your room. The conceirge staff was outstanding and so friendly! Hilga was great and even knew of restaurants I had researched, bus stops, and where to take children near by (for our next visit later this year). She also asked us how our previous day was and was ready to help with the next day's activities. We also tried out the pool and jacuzzi, both of which were great. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, definitely one of the best hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Gemela01
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental San Francisco is one of the best hotels I've stayed at. I traveled and stayed in hotels over 100 nights in 2009. The location could not have been better, centrally located near shopping, dinning and entertainment. The rooms are large, with high ceilings. We were on the 20th floor. Our room overlooked the entire city. The walls were windows from celing to floor, even in the bathroom. You can see all of San Francisco! Very comfortable and plush rooms. Great bath amenities. The food was amazing! A great experience! Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LondonKatya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Had a room on one of the higher floors overlooking the city and Bloomingdales. Not a great view but no traffic noise or other disturbances. Room was a good size and very clean. Very comfortable beds and perfect temperature. Service was excellent. The staff couldn't do enough to help you. Particularly the concierge with great local knowledge and travel info. Excellent buffet breakfast with plenty of choice (although might want to give the scrambled eggs a miss). Shame about the area around the hotel - best to stick to Powell Street direction if walking in the evening. Location not bad for getting to sights though. And there's a huge Burlington Coat Factory opposite. Great for bargains. Overall a great hotel, would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: user6100
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. A few blocks from Market so you are close to BART/Muni, but away from the craziness. Stayed here for four nights, then the following weekend for a night. Definitely would recommend to others! = )

Reviews.Title: “Melting in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, stayed here because part of the time was attending a conference at this hotel. Location: Not too far from Union Square and less than a block from Bloomingdales and the Moscone convention center Room: Had a room at 31st floor (hotel has 34) which includes access to the Club room. Room is on the small side AND IS ALWAYS HOT, twice had to call front desk to complain. they told me the temperature is remotely controlled from front desk, so even though your thermostst may say 65F in reality it may be blowing 80F air. CALL THE FRONT DESK AND TELL THEM TO ADJUST YOUR TEMPERATURE, INSIST ON IT. Only on the last night we were able to get a nice temperature in the room. The bathroom is big, has a separate tub and shower, why do you need such a big bathroom and such a small room is beyond me. Club room: nice, had a good breakfast there every day and the appetizers at dinner and open bar was also a nice touch. Would I stay there again: NO, between the room always hot, the parking fees of over $50 per DAY, $15/day for internet in the room, small room and over $300/night it's simply not worth it for a leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conventioneers, but leisure travelers are overlooked.”
Reviews.Author: KelsoKM
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Francisco to get married and chose the Intercontinental based on it's star rating, reviews from other travelers and location. The rooms were spacious, room service food was delicious and the location of the hotel is very convenient for getting to/from SFO and various points of interest in the city. There were some aspects of our stay that I think will be useful to other travelers considering this hotel: 1. The hotel places a $200 HOLD on funds from your credit card or debit card for EACH DAY of stay. Those funds are not available to you during this period of time. At the end of your stay, your actual expenses are then totaled and any remaining balance from the frozen funds are released back to your card. This is not spelled out on the hotel's website or third-party reservation websites and posed a problem for us, as we were not prepared to lose $200 of spending money each day. This information should be made available to guests prior to their arrival. The hotel desk clerk informed us that this information was not relayed to us by Expedia (whom we used to book our stay), but I checked Intercontinental's website and could not find this information there, either. If it is there, it should be more prominent. They also could have mentioned this when I called to confirm our reservation the day before our arrival. Let me be clear: I don't have a problem with the policy of holding funds, but there is no reason why guests should be surprised at check-in, when they can be informed beforehand, which would allow guests to plan their travel budget/spending accordingly. 2. The front desk service is mediocre. Not very friendly (although not rude) and I was surprised that no one ever even asked us why we were in SF. Given that this is a convention hotel, perhaps they just assumed we were business travelers. Not the case. It would have been nice to be asked. Also, we were not wished an enjoyable stay, nor were we asked if we were satisfied at the end of our stay..minor points, but when it comes to service, the little things count. 3. The bar and restaurant are woefully inadequate to handle all of the conventioneers and other guests (i.e. US). After getting married and having our photos taken in and around the city, we returned for some celebratory champagne..We found seats in the very-crowded lounge area, but the waitress that was taking orders ignored us. We fought our way up to the bar and eventually got some attention. 4. And perhaps the most annoying part of our stay..the comfort of our room. Our room faced east and when the sun rose each morning, the room became hot. Not just warm. HOT. We had the thermostat adjusted to the lowest possible setting and the fan turned on "high," yet we still roasted the morning of our wedding as we showered and dressed. We were told the hotel was booked to capacity, so no other rooms were available. Some things cannot be controlled or fixed, but this was still disappointing. It didn't ruin our day, but a pickier bride and groom-to-be might throw a fit. Finally, the parking is quite expensive. We were told that we would be charged $43 per day for parking at the hotel. It was $53 on check-out. Luckily, we found a garage DIRECTLY behind the hotel (and probably the one they use for guests' cars) that charged $32/day. While this may all sound very negative, we were not UNhappy with the hotel. But we won't choose it again. Overall, I would say it's great for conventioneers, and mediocre for people traveling for leisure/special events. NOTE: We did not tell the hotel we were getting married. We did not expect or want preferential treatment. The criticisms noted above have to do with basic service and are not based on an expectation of special treatment. Every guest is entitled to comfort, care and a clear understanding of the cost of their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shiny and bright hotel, let down by bad service”
Reviews.Author: Monterone
Reviews.Content: I agree with those recent reviewers who have identified service problems at this hotel. At best, I would say that it is inconsistent. The bell desk, valet parking, housekeeping, and restaurant staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The front desk staff, however, were largely unhelpful, slow, and in at least one instance, unprofessional. Check in took longer than usual, as the person checking us in had to consult with her supervisor on multiple occasions to ask what seemed to be fairly routine questions. We were using a "buy one, get one weekend night free" certificate (from IC's Ambassador program), and the supervisor actually complained out loud about how customers with these certificates never give the hotel any advance notice about using them. She actually voiced this complaint to our faces. I thought that was highly unprofessional, especially since that is how the "buy one, get one" program is supposed to work: customers are not asked to provide advance notice about using the certificates. In the end, even though we had originally booked a room rate that was supposed to include breakfast, the supervisor informed us that we would not be getting breakfast on the second day because we were using the free certificate. Although I can understand the logic behind this policy, the information was conveyed to us in a rather unpleasant and haughty manner by the supervisor, which left a bad taste in my mouth. Check out also took longer than usual. Even though there were only three people in line, it ended up taking nearly 15 minutes for the front desk staff (two different people from the check-in pair) to get to us. Without making eye contact, the front-desk agent mumbled an apology about the wait. Not a big deal, but another illustration of the amateurish level of service -- and probable lack of adequate training -- in some of the front-desk staff. The hotel itself is quite shiny and bright. The rooms, as others have mentioned, were spotless and relatively spacious, with nice views over the city. The bathrooms are large, with a separate shower and tub. The location is very convenient to Union Square and the Moscone Convention Center, although the tradeoff is that you are farther away from the more classically "San Franciscan" neighborhoods such as Nob Hill, North Beach, and Russian Hill. (For a first-time visitor to the city, I would recommend one of the Fisherman's Wharf or Nob Hill hotels over this location, but for a repeat visitor, this location is just fine.) The breakfast buffet in the main restaurant is excellent, with a well-prepared array of dishes. The gym is also well-equipped and spacious. Notwithstanding the solid "hard product," the bad service from the front-desk staff left me with less than warm feelings for the hotel as a whole, and it will make think twice about booking another stay here.

Reviews.Title: “look out for their package deals”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Dave74
Reviews.Content: Was originally going to try and book this hotel using hotwire a couple of months from out planned stay as I was certain this was the hotel that hotwire was going to allocate. Decided to wait closer to our arrival date and see what special were available. Glad we did wait as they had a deal - Escape to San Francisco Package Includes accomodations for two, breakfast for two, complimentary parking, and two cable car tickets Based Upon Availability for maybe an extra $40 a night (not too sure on this) The package deal made the stay great value, we were looking at anywhere from $30+ a day for carparking for our hire car so this closed the deal. Not going to rave too much about the hotel room, except to say that we had an excellent stay. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts every morning, they were great full buffet and filling up on their breakfast meant we could often skip lunch as we would rather be sight seeing than eating out somewhere. The staff at breakfast were very polite and they really great to talk to for advice (ask a local). One night on returning late to the hotel (10pm) we had skipped dinner due to our Alcatraz tour and were starving for food. Unfortunately the restaurant was about to close so we couldn't dine there but they did let us order the full restaurant menu and eat it in the bar area. This suited us perfectly as we weren't really suitably dressed for the restaurant and really wanted something to eat as quick as possible so we could return to our room. The food we were served was fantastic and was washed down with a couple of local beers from the bar. We were looking to stay at the Westin St Francis but was very happy with the deal we got here, the WSF had no specials on at the time of our stay and was over twice the price we paid here. Good spot for shopping, which was one of primary reasons to visit SF. a couple of blocks away from Union Square. We even took the dodgy way back to the hotel one night through the streets north of the hotel after dining out late on night but was all good, just a little seedy with a few drunks out on the streets. Couldn't fault this place, but I will mention that I think it is designed more for business stays than the casual overseas tourists that we were. We were quite often the only people not wearing a suite in the lift elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean Hotel, let down by location and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: UKTINKER72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for 3 nights in San Francisco prior to a business trip. Chose the hotel from Hotwire based on rating, price and location. The hotel is 1 block south of Bloomingdales and 3 blocks south of Market Street. This location is about 2 blocks south of anything happening in that area and is quiet. I did felt intimidated and didn't like walking in the area at night. There is a large lobby which leads onto a cramped bar with a restaurant (which I did not use), it is very nice and modern. From the lobby is a Spa, of which I used the pool (long, narrow and very cold), Jacuzzi (nice and warm) and Gym. I did get the impression the pool was an after thought to the hotel and was designed into a space. Not somewhere I wanted to spend longer than 20 minutes :( The room was very nice and very clean. The view was nothing special, unless you like looking at houses. Try and get a view north east. The toilet was cracked was probably the only fault. However what really lets the hotel down is the service, most of the staff are either unhelpful or extremely arrogant. One night I asked the concierge for tickets for Wicked, they replied where I could buy tickets, which was a long walk to the theatre, but they refused to call the theatre to check if tickets are available, he was more interested in polishing the lamp on his desk than talk to us.
