I asked reception for some more milk to make coffee in my room, they said they could not help, I can ring house keeping from my room! I had to tell reception to call house keeping and send the milk up. Prices in the hotel are extremely high, medium size bottle of still water in the room is $8! This is a hotel that is only good for business travellers using the Moscone center, otherwise there are considerably better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gm10
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Hotwire, so we didn't know before we booked. It was a very pleasant surprise at a decent rate. We got a free upgrade to a king room, which was definitely the nicest hotel room I've ever had. The location is pretty ideal, about 5 mins walk from Market. There is a nice gym, pool and jacuzi.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay if you are going to SF!!”
Reviews.Author: jennmaybe
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell.....this hotel was just fabulous! We had a minor miscommunication at check-in; however, the problem was solved the very next morning. We were on the 30th floor with wonderful views of the city and bay. If you like clean, this is the hotel for you! It was spotless....and I am very picky about cleanliness at hotels. It is a short walk (2 blocks) to the MUNI/cable car or BART; however, it does take forever for a cable car to come by. There were 2 things we did not like about the city: 1) the homeless people-they are everywhere and they will ask you for money. We felt very sorry for them, but also could not believe the city just allows this to happen, especially to their tourists. It really does take their reputation down a bit. 2) the locals in the city (excluding the staff at this hotel) were very rude. It seemed like no one wanted to help us with any of our questions. They didn't care we were from out of town. They were much ruder there han in NYC even. (I've been to NYC also and they were no where even close to being as rude as the locals in SF) Other than that, we had a fabulous time and just loved this hotel! We will definitely stay here again for any future trips to SF!

Reviews.Title: “This Is Our One And Only San Francisco Hotel. LOVE This Place”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCircus22
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Intercontinental San Francisco on two occasions in the last year and we will be staying there a third over Thanksgiving. Last year we discovered this place on a whim when we decided to drive up to San Francisco from Los Angeles for Thanksgiving. We took advantage of the California Staycation package they were offering and got the room, breakfast for two, free valet parking and a $25 gas certificate for under $200 a night. Not only that but on seeing that we were Intercontinental Ambassador Gold members they upgraded us to an executive room. WOW!!! What a room. Floor to ceiling windows and views of the Bay and/or the city. The people at the front desk and all around the hotel were some of the best people I've ever encountered. Friendly, complimentary, accommodating, patient and helpful. Man, I'm starting to sound like I work for the hotel or something. Haha. On check in they valeted our car which thankfully we didn't have to pay for because $60 a day is a bit *um* out of control. They then let us basically choose our room since we were entitled to an upgrade as a Gold Ambassador, the place was a bit empty due to Thanksgiving, and we picked the Executive. It was one of the best if not the best hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. Topped by possibly only the $1200 a night bungaloes we stayed in at the Intercontinental Thalasso Bora Bora. But for the money, this was insane nice. The grappa bar is intriguing and while I'm part Italian that may be the first and only time I ever try grappa. Hello, turpentine. Long story short we decided to return for a special occasion in March when we had tickets to the SF Ballet at the gorgeous War Memorial Opera House. Fantastic show and highly recommended. Yes, the ballet. No, I'm not Billy Elliot. We returned to the ISF and it was just as good as the time before. We weren't able to upgrade to an Executive :( but we did get a room pretty high up with amazing view of the Bay. Seriously, could they have built this hotel ANY BETTER???? No. It's almost perfect. We had a great weekend stay and once again the service was impeccable. So after such great success last Thanksgiving the parents are flying in from North Carolina and we're going to have a family Thanksgiving in San Francisco for 2009. I'm hoping that all of us have as great an experience as we did the first two times as I've really talked up this hotel to the fam. I will be back with another review if it lives up to the billing I have given it. But in sum, I will say that the rooms with the views and the nicely appointed bathrooms are fantastic. I really like the quaint little lap pool and the googles they give you and the workout room. It's not too big, not too small. The bar and restaurant are both very good and like I said the service is excellent. Here's to hoping 3rd time's the charm. Again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: renbabe
Reviews.Content: Cannot and will not fault this property in the city. Beautifully appointed, high quality facilities, beautifully comfortable bed and a breathtaking view of the sunrise. All staff were more than courteous and the hotel is within walking distance of a number of great things to do. Would go back again tomorrow...

Reviews.Title: “When it mattered, they helped at every step”
Reviews.Author: MDjes67
Reviews.Content: Its hard to expalain how fast things can go wrong. My conference-attending husband was fine in at 5pm and needed an emergency room at 5am the next morning. The hotel not only have a concierge on duty at 5am -- but the guy conjured up a taxi and sent us to an excellent hospital. For those familiar with big city hospitals, thats not trival. My husband was in the hospital for 10 days, including surgery. Every nerve-racking day, the concierges and staff helped extend our room and expressed concern. Its amazing how much that helps when things go really wrong.

Reviews.Title: “My Intercontinental review”
Reviews.Author: Jassenia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, absoulutly great. The people were awesome and it was very very high class.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay But Beware of Priority Club Promotional Bonuses”
Reviews.Author: sushigod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a trip within the specified promotion period on the Intercontinental Hotel's website back in June. We had an enjoyable stay in downtown San Francisco on Howard St, June 22 - 27, 2009 to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The staff was very helpful in sharing their knowledge of the city's attractions and restaurant recommendations. Our suite was clean with a great view of the city and the buffet breakfast was pleasantly better than expected. Unfortunately we don't have the same to say about the online booking. The ICH site was running an online promotion at the time: 1 free night for each 2 nights qualifying stay booked within the promotional period (our booking dates and stay was within the specified period). We immediately booked our 5 night stay as there was no indication our booking did not otherwise qualify. We paid $199 per night + taxes for a King Suite that included a complimentary breakfast. We thought it was a good deal considering we would get 1 free night for each 2 nights stay. This was our deciding factor for not booking elsewhere for at least $50 less per night at a comparable hotel like the Hilton. Upon our return we logged into our Priority Club rewards account and it noted our stay during the free night stay promotional period had "expired". To our surprise, we were informed the rack rate for our stay was already heavily discounted and did not qualify for the free nights bonus. We were also referred to the small print in one paragraphs of the terms and conditions. What really irked us was finding out the original invoice and record of our stay had been modified/deleted from our online account. The online record now only shows the dates we stayed and comment "Non-qualifying nights stay". Our invoice with extra charges we paid room service is nowhere to be found. We feel we were mislead by a deceptive marketing tactic that did not make clear that our stay did not qualify upfront. We are very disappointed the ICH and expected far better customer service having enjoyed a previous stay with this chain in Moorea/Tahiti. So beware to other travellers and not assume your online booking via the ICH website qualifies for any promotional bonuses unless you get it confirmed in writing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, expensive, some quirks for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: twokidsonecat
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel ... new, modern, nicely done with good rooms. The furnishings are top notch as are the beds, the bathroom and the flat panel TV. As a regular business traveller though, there were a couple of things that were surprisingly absent or questionable: 1) no coffee maker in the room, 2) chair for the work desk is not adjustable for height, 3) desk top is glass (makes using a laser mouse very difficult ... have to hold down a piece of paper for it if you do not have a mouse pad with you, 4) the internet access is an additional charge of $14.95/day. For a high end hotel with the price that is charged for the rooms, I would expect that items like these would not be an issue (or in the case of the internet would not be an additional charge). Colour me disappointed with the value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-baby vacation”
Reviews.Author: MtnView007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate one of our last free weekends before our first child was born. The hotel was elegant and clean. The room itself had beautiful floor-to-ceiling windows with a view of SOMA and Twin Peaks. I enjoyed the fitness center in the mornings. Overall we had a great time. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great room”
Reviews.Author: jrj0924
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after finding a great deal online. Was easy to get to after figuring out the transportation system, just a quick walk from a major stop. The room was beautiful and quiet. We enjoyed the bar every night we were there, great way to cap off a busy day sight seeing. Concierge was super helpful with directions and calling cabs. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good on a cheap deal”
Reviews.Author: Skiranger
Reviews.Content: A plush, modern hotel well placed for the Moscone Center, albeit a little walk from most of the downtown sites. Very good if you can get it on a cheap deal like we did, otherwise a little pricey. We had a fantastic room with a massive bathroom. Everything was very clean an d bright. The whole place is a bit impersonal, but the staff were generally helpful and very professional. Food and drink were a little pricey - best to make use of the local bars, restaurants or liquor stores. Also ideally placed to get to SFO airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Dowtown SF”
Reviews.Author: Skivt89
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the InterContinental for 2 nights and both my fiancee and I enjoyed our stay. We had booked a basic room on IC's website and then I had called the hotel directly to let them know that it was a special occasion (as we recently got engaged) and I wanted to see if there was a chance they could put us on a higher level floor (to see the views etc). We were able to get onto the 30th floor and the views were very nice (the person who checked us in I belive his name was CJ?--was very nice) I think the hotel is nice and the pool and hot tub were under construction while we were there, but we were able to get a guest pass to use the Marriott on 4th street pool/hot tub (very large hot tub). The location was fairly good--we walked the entire city and it is not far from the hotel to get to Union Square (about 5 to 7 minute walk)--there is only about a block or two that the hotel had let us know at check in that is less than great (and could be considered unsafe), but there is really no reason to go down there, so we did not see it as a problem at all. We did not eat at the restaruant at the hotel as we met friends who live in SF and they took us to a great suishi place in Pacific Heights along with an Italian place.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay and the SF Intercontinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Highwaydude
Reviews.Content: Very nice new hotel. The room was great and great service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Linda015
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary about staying at this hotel because of the bad reviews I had read on this website. I was pleasantly suprized! We stayed at the Intercontinental Sept 12 to the 19th and had a fantastic stay! All the awful things I read about in the reviews never materialized: the service was excellent, the room was spotless, & the staff were really friendly and pleasant. Check-In and Check-Out was fast and efficient, the concierges were helpful & everyone seemed like they truly wanted to make our stay a pleasant one. We booked through hotwire and were given one of the corner rooms with the windows from the ceiling to the floors. It was beautiful! Everthing still had that clean and fresh look to it, especially the bathroom with its tiled shower and floor. The king size bed was very luxurious and extremelly comfortable. I was also glad we booked this hotel for its location. It is far enough away from Fishermans Wharf (which is very touristy) but just a 5 minute walk to Union Square and Market Street, to catch the cable cars or the MUNI. We bought a 7 day MUNI pass and used it every day. You don't need a car, the MUNI was easy to use and goes just about everywhere. All in all we would definately come back here again and would recomend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully plush and welcome after a long day travelling.”
Reviews.Author: JLatzMD
Reviews.Content: Great service in a very clean and modernistic hotel - flat screen HDTVs, plentiful plugs for all the electronics we carry, friendy staff, room was very clean - nicely tiled larger shower with handheld spout option and luxurious absorbant towels. Great bench seat at the window of our 22nd floor room. Pricelined it and were able to upgrade to a better view for a reasonable fee. Great bed/mattress to rival/outdo the "Heavenly Bed" of Westin.

Reviews.Title: “great clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: happybess
Reviews.Content: very comfortable beds. spacious bathroom (very important for women) dont't book it from the website. It's quite expensive to book it from expedia, hotel.com, or the offical website. Book it through hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “What a view if you can afford to park the car..”
Reviews.Author: Platz
Reviews.Content: Looks very â€œdown-townishâ€� when viewed from the outside and you think oh dear, however once inside this is a lovely hotel. I managed to get a room on the 27th floor which with its glass walls on two sides gave a fantastic view over the city. I especially found the fully glassed bathroom surprisingly appealing. Sitting watching the world go past underneath was most calming! Room was spotless, well kitted out, great TV, nice i-Pod connection and a truly great bed. Location may not look great on the map, but trust me it is. Market street, the trams, etc just a few minutes out the back. The Convention Centre is virtually next door. Ate out this visit so cannot comment on food. Worst point was the cost of parking which at nearly $60 per night did take the edge off the stay when paying.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCHeretic
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four comfortable nights at the InterContinental San Francisco. We booked the room via Hotwire and secured an amazing rate. I have stayed at several InterContinental Hotels via Hotwire and always experienced a warm welcome and outstanding service. This stay was no different. Upon check-in, the front desk clerk informed us that we had been upgraded to a deluxe king room. Our spacious room was located on the twenty-seventh floor and featured floor to ceiling windows with a view of the port, freeway, and some lovely hillside neighborhoods. The king bed was sumptuously comfortable, so comfortable in fact that we lay down for a nap and ended up sleeping fifteen hours. The room also featured a sitting area, and flat screen TV. The large bathroom contained high-end toiletries and fine towels. The decor of the room, with its muted earth tones and tile work in the bathroom, was a soothing respite from the busy city below. Service was friendly and efficient from check-in to check-out. We awoke early each morning and left the hotel for breakfast. Our room was always made when we returned an hour or two later. My one complaint about the hotel is that the restaurants and gift shop are terribly overpriced. A twenty ounce Coke at the gift shop cost $4.00. We would have liked to have sampled the bar and restaurant, but could not justify paying the outrageous prices. Overall, the InterContinental provides luxury accommodations and attentive service in a convenient San Francisco location. We would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. New. Clean. Modern. Wonderfully comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: tau_giu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Intercontinental San Francisco and LOVED it! The view from our 32nd floor window was really nice (floor to ceiling windows everywhere!). The bed was WONDERFUL new, clean and comfortable!! The location was almost perfect. It was not as close to downtown as other hotels but it was just a few blocks away so it was no trouble at all. RESTAURANT was very nice with very good food and EXCELLENT service. The Breakfast Buffet was very good with very fresh fruits, pastry , cheeses and well prepared meats. The SPA was FANTASTIC (although expensive). Someone on Trip Adviser said the SPA was dirty. I was expecting the worst. I looked everywhere for dirt... none found. It was very nice, clean, small and professional. The staff was very friendly and well trained. The ONLY complaint we had was we wished the couples room for massage was dimmer... it was too bright... too much sunlight. We wished they had used only dim lights and/or candles. ALSO: Please do NOT rent a car in S.F. It is expensive and unnecessary. Parking, GAS, rental etc is so expensive it's not worth it! Take the MUNI public transportation and get a 1 or 3 day pass it is cheap, easy, fun and very much worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mittyjames
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great and up to Intercon standards. The building seems to be brand new or not more than a few years old at most. Location is good for what we wanted, a bit of of shopping and sight seeing etc. Cabs were cheap in our opinion so we got taxis when needed. Facilities in the room were great, unbelievable bed, and staff that were happy to help. We requested a high floor and they put us on the top floor - nice! THe concierge team are also amazing and really made our stay better with their help and suggestions! If you need a late night snack in the hotel the fries with parmesan salt are yum!

Reviews.Title: “Nice SOMA alternative - modern and comfy”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to tryout as an alternative to the other modern, high end hotels in SOMA and I was pleasantly urprised. The new building had all the modern feel you would expect. The room was huge and had floor to ceiling windows. Nice bath and modern shower. Foam Pillows were too hard and asked for down filled - quickly changed. Service was good. Wifi in the room but a little expensive. Concierge had a little bit of a condescending attitude which is the only thing i really disliked.

Reviews.Title: “solid, but not great”
Reviews.Author: danasbox
Reviews.Content: We went for a reunion and rented the terrace suite with the free Ambassador night. We satyed three nights. Over all the place was nice, but not fantastic. The entrance is a bit in the parking garrage. The lobby was nice but you could feel that it will turn into a convention hotel soon. The view from our room was fantastic. But little things kept breaking down, like the curtins. Also the windows were dirty on the terrace, kinda spoils the view. The house keeping could have been a bit more on it as they were always leaving glasses around. I'm sure that is a management thing not the girls fault. But one day after they fixed the tub drain we both took baths, when we came back later they didn't clean the tub. Still had the bar of soap stuck to the side, not sure if they even did a turndown that night... I guess we thought that a 1,500.00 room would come with 1,500.00 service. The beds were very nice and we had a delicious dinner in the restaurant "Luce". The food in the club was just okay. The club should be on the club floor and could really have been a lot nicer. The pool was broken down. I think that if you get a good rate and you are okay with the location than it is a good choice. If you really want to spoil youself, perhaps you can do better...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonMia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days a couple of weeks ago in a lovely deluxe room on the 29th floor with views out to the sea. Nicely decorated, plenty of space for two adults and a teenager. The pool is still not fixed though which was disappointing. We did not eat at the hotel but after arriving in the evening we went to the Italian just opposite. It does not look terribly appealing but a relative who lives locally recommended it as a cheap and cheerful and it was perfect if you are tired and just want to have some (pretty decent) pasta and drinks without too much effort or cost. We also went to the local Westfield food hall just on the other side of Bloomingdales for lunch and supper a couple of times when we did not want to go somewhere too posh or expensive - great value but rather canteen like atmosphere. The great find there is Out the Door - part of The Slanted Door group but somewhat cheaper. We loved Mel's Diner for Breakfast - they were doing steak and eggs for $8.95. I too can't understand why people say it is a long walk to places. Very easy to get to Union Square and the cable cars. Staff were friendly but I did not find the Concierge particularly helpful. The guys at the door and valet parking were great. Don't forget there is a courtesy car available in the mornings and late afternoon. We took it one morning and it made a pleasant change to travel in a chauffeur driven merc! I would go back to this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: john1951_9
Reviews.Content: We came to San Francisco to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary, and chose this wonderful hotel. Arrived to find our bed covered in rose petals, and a bottle of champagne sitting out, ready to be opened. How nice! We were on the 27th floor in a corner room, and the views were nothing short of spectacular. This was a lovely hotel, and the staff was gracious and very accommodating. The concierge staff was most helpful and kind. We were very impressed, and will definitely stay here again. Absolutely loved this facility; very modern and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great choice! Staff gets 1 star!”
Reviews.Author: dbrunsacchi
Reviews.Content: We arrived and checked into our room. That went well. The room was nice. Left to tour S.F and when my friend returned before I did. She found that her key would not work. The reservation was under my name. Therefore, they refused to let her in stating that they had forgotten to swipe my credit card at check in. My friend had to track me down to call the hotel and assure them that she was my guest....finally she was let in the room.(after quite an ordeal). They had deactivated our keys because THEY forgot to swipe my card. Later that evening at 10:45 pm the front desk called and asked me to bring my I.D and credit card downstairs to be swiped. I refused saying that I was already in bed with my P.Js on. I offered to read the the card # over the phone yet they said "no'. I said they would have to come to my room and get it. They agreed but were not apologetic or polite. Overall, the hotel looks nice however the staff needs some training in providing better customer service. I wouldn't reccommend this hotel. Nor would I stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Saphire Beauty”
Reviews.Author: austinwinters
Reviews.Content: This year, the spotlight on a family vacation was placed on taking the Amtrak Train across the country from Buffalo, New York all the way to Emeryville (San Francisco), California. Over 2,000 miles of riding the rails was an amazing experience, but when the train came to it's final stop in. EMY, we had to organize places to stay; awaiting our impending road trip south along the coastline of California. Please note, these hotels were booked months in advanced, therefore the rates were very reasonable for the hotels which were chosen for this vacation, therefore; can not confirm that these great rates would accompany the walk-in rates. To begin this adventure, we needed to stay in San Francisco, as the train arrived across the bay in Emeryville at about 5:00PM leaving very tired passengers looking to get refreshed after 4 days on the train. Once again, I was put in charge of choosing the accomidations and the room which would be used on this vacation. Among tons of speculation and excitement in my household, I did the quoting for the Intercontinental San Francisco among other hotels. This one, of course, came out on top citing a good location (close to the train station, the in- and out-bound highways), the Intercontinental Brand (being one of luxury and excellence), and the various traveller reviews and photos of the property. The rate was secured, the room was booked. We had some difficulty booking online through the Intercontinental website so a quick call to the provided 1-800 number fixed all that. My sleuthing had discovered that they were offering various rooms at various prices (of course), but one had stuck out from all the rest. The hotel was offering us accomidation for us in a "2 Queen Bedroom Suite". The room was only supposed to be filled by 2 adult patrons, but with that call to the 1-800 number, they pulled some strings and placed us in the room with 2 adults and 1 child. The room promised wall to ceiling windows, two queen beds (with plush beds, pillows and whatnot), large business desk, oversized bathroom, and much more. Everything that anyone would want in a room, for both personal and business travelers. Now, enough about talking about what the room was supposed to look like, let's get into the experience. What it was really like, well folks... it was absolutely fantastic! Would I go so far as to say that it was my favorite hotel, no. That title still holds true to the Hotel Indigo in Amhurst, New York (for reasons which I will go more in-depth later). The hotel itself. A sparkling glimmer of blue upon the horizon of the smog infested city. The location on Howard Street is the perfect place, just off of the major highway connecting the city to Oakland and the Airport, a very convenient spot. The hotel itself, as you have probably noted from the pictures is bright blue with the tinted floor to ceiling windows. The hotel is 33 stories tall, and impossible to miss from anywhere. Upon arrival, we were greeted with very friendly valet staff and the hotel's porter. They offered to take our luggage and park the rental car in the compound downstairs. Now, this is where I will begin to sway from the positive. Before booking the hotel, the agent warned us that there would be a parking charge, and it would be steep as it was in downtown San Francisco. The porter informed us that the total charge for one night's parking under the hotel would be $49.00 before taxes and fees. Yes, is correct: $49.00 PER NIGHT, PER VEHICLE. It's not like you have any choice as per where to park, but watch out. You may be better to take the limousine service to/from wherever you are going, but please be warned. Also notable, California charges you a PARKING tax. So it worked out that parking was about $58.00. Wow, not a good start. The parking issue was quickly accepted, as we trudged into the lobby at around 6:00 PM that night. As we walked upto the check-in counter, we were waiting for service for about 2 minutes while the desk was busy with another customer. Shortly after that 2 minute time, another member of the desk staff arrived to process our arrival. He welcomed us to the hotel, and provided us with the upsell of the Intercontinental Ambassador club. Now, I wasn't paying, and the $150 may be a bit steep, but once I hit the age of majority, I will probably join up the Ambassador plan. If it helps out with my Prioroty Club account, it'll be done for sure. We were given our keys (the jet black 'Intercontinental' card) and we were sent to the 7th floor. I was a little disappointed with the floor, I would have liked to be higher up, to see more out the windows, but the porter (who followed us up with our bags to our room) described that they place the higher floor rooms for those who are staying for longer periods of time. Though on again I wasn't impressed, it was alright, there was nothing really to look at that late at night. We were lead to our room, bags in tow. The key opened the door, and it was like an aura of blinding light subsided to produce our amazing, beautiful, and most of all awesome 2 Queen Suite. The room was deep (see pictures) featuring a long hallway connecting the door to the bathroom and the bedroom. The room was decorated much like the lobby, with modern looking furniture, a 40' or so TV affixed to the wall, the two plush and white beds, the oversized business desk, the sliding door to reveal the bathroom. WOW! It was all so much, this hotel room was absolutely amazing. Upon entering, I was really able to take a look up close at the features of the room. The TV, an LG 40', the beds with a 2 or 3' feather bed add-on and fluffy comforter, the wall to ceiling windows looking out onto Howard St. It was all amazing! To go a little more in depth to the accomidation, I would like to start with the entry hallway and entryway. Entering into the room featured quite an extensive hallway connecting the doorway to the room. The area was a little dull, but what followed the entryway quickly made up for it. Due to the hotel being so new, they are able to add in many different features which would come with newer buildings. What I am leading upto would be the electronic controls featuring "Do Not Disturb" and "Make Up Room" which both do exactly as they say,but in a way which require no effort on the part of the guest. Great innovation! Also included here was the closet featuring automatic lights (turning on when the door opens and off when the door closes), an in-room safe which they say is large enough to hold a laptop (I don't know about that...), and of course extra pillows and blankets. I, of course, opted to take all the pillows which I could find for myself (6 in total which were available throughout the room (without taking the parent's). Moving into the main room, you are introduced to a vast space of all that is Intercontinental. On the left of our room there was the TV and underneath was a table or dresser featuring the mini-bar and storage dresser (complete with coffee machine using Tassimo technology). On it's reverse side were the two Queen beds. We were very lucky to get the ability to secure this room, they were very large (for a Queen), immensely comfortable (feather bed topping made the bed so soft), and came complete with 5 pillows each. The whole package equaled an unparalled sleeping experience later that evening, I haven't slept that well for a very long time (in a hotel, that is). Beside the beds lied the oversized business desk. The desk featured a very new Nortel phone featuring colour screen describing all of the room features and welcoming us to the room (of course with the name of the guests)! Last but not least, the bathroom. Oh the bathroom! Featuring your standard fixings (as required by law xD), they brought the bar up a notch. The shower, spacing the entire width of the room, glassed in with an oversized glass door and specialty shower head was truely a delight to use after using a cramped shower/toilet combination on the Amtrak train over the past 4 days! Settings set to: "Rain", "Massage", and "Pulse" were great to get back to that crisp and clean feeling I had come to miss over the past few days. The bathroom also featured a completely separate bathtub on the opposite side of the room. The ammenities were first class, imported from the Czech Republic by some company. As usual, they were the usual fixings, but were oh so good! Everything was great, the night's sleep was great in the most comfortable bed on earth and made the night pass by very quickly. Unfortunately, the hotel stay had to come to an end, so it was time to check-out and head down to the next stop on our journey this evening. The next morning, and early rise was accompanied by the bill collection. The room was the same great rate as was advertised, the only kicker was the parking. $49.00, plus the California State "Parking Tax", and some other stupid charge which brought it up to the high 50's. Otherwise, there weren't really any other surprises, leaving us happy campers! My final statement, falling behind the Hotel Indigo in Amhurst, New York; the Intercontinental San Francisco takes 2nd place on my list of favorite accomidations. The hotel is stunning, brand new, and is full of everything you would ever want and need. If you get a chance to stay in SF, you MUST stay here, you won't be disappointed! All this raving about the place and it only gets 2nd place, you ask? Well, San Francisco stacks up as the city I will NEVER visit again. The location is near Union Sq. which is also full of people panhandling, bothering you every few seconds, and then occastionally trying to steal your wallet and belongings (lovely experience, really... chasing off some idiot nearly reaching into my pocket.) SF was just not a good place to be, if you don't have to go, don't. If you have small children, stay even farther away. You wouldn't want to scare them away from the Big City atmosphere. Try somewhere else like Chicago, there you will give them a more warm approach to the big city! I hope this review helped you choose your accomidations!

Reviews.Title: “Recommendedâ€¦â€¦we had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: gaz_61
Reviews.Content: Recommendedâ€¦â€¦we had a really great stay at the Intercontinental with no problems, our room/suite was fantastic. Staff were helpful and friendly with the exception of the concierge who looked at us with disdain and brushed us aside when we enquired if he could call a cab, obviously this was beneath his station in the chain of commandâ€¦get a life !! I canâ€™t comment on the Restaurant as we decided to eat out every night and sample what SF had to offer, why bother eating in an overpriced Hotel Restaurant (which was empty throughout our 7 night stay). Bar was very expensive and appeared to be mostly used by people on business and expense accounts..... As for location, again no complaints ..... only a few minutes walk to all the hustle and bustle of Market Street. I find it strange to read comments about poor location and â€˜very longâ€™ walks to Chinatown? Location was perfect for us - only 10 minutes to Chinatown/ 5-10 minutes walk to Union Square and weâ€™re in our late 40â€™s .. ..Not the greatest of surroundings but if your not planning on spending your whole trip walking around Howard/5th St I donâ€™t see the problemâ€¦â€¦ Would I recommend this Hotel to a friend â€“ already have. Would I stay again â€“ definitely without question.

Reviews.Title: “Superb comfort and style”
Reviews.Author: Mishkamitten
Reviews.Content: If you like sleek, modern, minimalist decor combined with excellent comfort, you will love this hotel. We paid a low rate through Hotwire, but our room was huge, as was the flat screen, bathroom and bed. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, huge and pillow-topped mattress and loads of pillows. Immaculately clean and well located. Reception staff were friendly, welcoming and informative. Only downside was the charge for internet access, at $15 a day or $6.95 and hour which seems tight-fisted when cheaper hotels offer this for free. But we would go back, and just use local internet cafes for short browsing sessions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal but slow service and terrible room service”
Reviews.Author: funnylaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night w/ the staycation package deal (includes room, valet parking, and hot breakfast). The room was great and the bar food was good. Service in the restaurant was not good and room service was terrible (took more than an hour and the food was cold) -- the hotel, however, did not end up charging us for the room service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice potential, some annoying details”
Reviews.Author: Rodukas
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the hotel, I chose it because the building was brand new, so I was expecting a pretty reliable room. I admit that I booked using a travel-agent industry special rate that gave me a good rate, but at the end I've found myself in a remoted room in the lowest part of the building, with an incredibly noisy vent right behind the wall. So the experience was not fantastic, since we could hardly sleep. Rest of the building was nice, but a bit cold, so the staff was.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DianeForDinner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This is a lovely hotel that is conveniently located near Fourth and Market (downtown). It is close to public transportation which made it easy to travel around the city. The room was comfortable with its nice linens and a well supplied bathroom. The staff was friendly and engaging. It was very reasonably priced compared with other hotels in the area. The hotel is suitable for both business and leisure travelers. We enjoyed our stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Man31
Reviews.Content: No suprise. Nice, clean, upscale. Tip : Park in the public parking garage just behind the hotel (200 feet). A lot cheaper than the hotel vallet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location...”
Reviews.Author: brisfam
Reviews.Content: Through Hotwire, we were able to confirm an excellent rate of $137 per night at this four and half star hotel in a convenient downtown location, Union Square area. Checking InterContinental's website, they offered standard rooms at about $189, which is still a very good rate for this caliber hotel and area. Celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, the front desk graciously upgraded us to club level....32nd floor. (thank you!) The room was of moderate size, but the spectacular panoramic view captured our attention...wall to wall windows that framed a breathtaking view of the city and bay! The bathroom was luxurious....glass enclosed shower, large basin area, separate soaking tub with it's own ambiance lighting. Decor was modern with earth tone colors with wood accents.....light sandy tan, dark wood furniture, brushed chrome light fixtures, sage green patterned curtains. Sleeping was divine on an ultra plush pillowtopped mattress....soft and enveloping! Wonderful feather comforter covered in a white cotton duvet. We enjoyed our stay and celebration of 25 blessed years of marriage!

Reviews.Title: “What a letdown!”
Reviews.Author: californiawanderone
Reviews.Content: Wow, where to start? I originally tried to book the InterContinental for a weekend stay but was told that they were sold out on Saturday. I made a reservation for Friday night and got a reservation elsewhere for Saturday. Upon arriving (after dragging our luggage in ourselves with no one there to open the doors) I was told that the room had been booked for Friday and Saturday. Figuring I would stay at the InterContinental both nights, I called the other hotel and cancelled my reservation for Saturday night, incurring cancellation fees. I had booked a King Junior Suite but was now told that they didn't have one available. But they were sure I would like the room they had. Exhausted I took the key. The room was nice, but standard. I booked the King Junior Suite for the floor to ceiling windows which my room did not have. When we got to the room we ordered a rollaway bed, which arrived promptly. However, the phone call at 12:15a.m. to ask us if we had received the bed was not appreciated. We returned to the room Saturday afternoon and were surprised to see that it had not been cleaned. We ordered room service and then the maid knocked on the door and asked us when we were going to check out. When I told her Sunday morning, she asked me to call the front desk. They told me they had no record of us staying Saturday night and by the way, they were sold out completely and we would need to check out. I explained that I had been told at check-in that the reservation was for Friday and Saturday, explained that I had cancelled my other room and had no where to go! (San Francisco marathon that weekend, hotels booked!) The manager agreed to let us stay after several phone calls, but meanwhile room service had put our order on hold! It took more calls to get our order and our refrigerator unlocked. Then as we finally sat down to eat, the phone rang yet again, the front desk was asking me to come down and give them a credit card because apparently they closed out our room tab. In addition to all of the above the pool and jacuzzi were closed during our stay. We were traveling with a child and chose the InterContinental because we knew she would love that pool! I travel quite a bit and I've never seen staff confusion like this. Our stay was not enjoyable and I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good location for tourism”
Reviews.Author: tmolta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend at this hotel. The hotel is fine, with nice rooms. But unless you are attending a convention (in which case it is very well situated), the location is not good for tourists. AT ALL. The hotel is a VERY LONG walk from North Beach and Chinatown, two of our favorite areas. It's even a pretty long walk to Union Square. The immediate surroundings of the hotel are very boring. The hotel is on Howard which is a wide (four lane) one-way street, with cars zipping by at a good clip. In short, the surroundings feel like the warehouse district that SOMA used to be and, in many ways, still is. Maybe in 20 years, the neighborhood will have developed some character. For now, stay closer to Union Square, where the vibrancy of San Francisco is more easily seen.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Situation, Well Handled”
Reviews.Author: RouteBound
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at the Donatello (companion review of this trip over at that hotel as well), and we were bumped due to their overselling the hotel that weekend. The good news is that we were comped a room at the Intercontinental, which was actually a hotel I was originally considering. Anyway, the situation was handled beautifully by the staff at the Donatello and the Intercontinental. We ended up with a free room on the 24th floor. Very nice room, very comfortable bed, very quiet. The breakfast in the lobby was very good, the staff people were friendly and helpful, the place was very clean, and my only gripe is the high cost of parking in San Francisco, but that's a problem everywhere downtown. The location at the foot of Mission Street next to the waterfront is ideal for heading anywhere in town. Coulda' been a disaster, but both hotels handled it very well. We'll give them a call when we are headed that way again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is very clean with great views, however I was dissapointed with the style and design.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: GANikki
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely nice and well maintained. It had stylish decor in the common areas and the rooms. The room we had was pretty small, but then again we didn't spend much time in it since we were out and about. We did not love the location of the hotel. Yes, it is a few blocks away from Union Square shopping. However, it is literally right on the cusp of an "up and coming area" that I'm sure will be very nice in a few years. I'm not saying it's a horrible area, but you do need to be very aware of your surroundings when walking back to the hotel late at night. The hotel is between 4th and 5th on Howard. I would recommend taking 4th to get to the hotel from the Uinion Square area, as opposed to 5th. 4th is better lit than 5th. All in all, it was a nice hotel, but next time we would probably stay elsewhere just because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: srs-seattle
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the economy, I did get a pretty good rate, and it was a lovely hotel to stay in -- clean, new, modern and shiny, without being sterile. The bed truly was the best I've ever slept in, and they also have the courtesy to provide something besides squooshy goosedown pillows, which I can't sleep on. Thank you! The location is fine: Pluses: it's three flat blocks south of the Powell & Market BART station, close to the center of everything without being inside the chaotic fray of Union Square. Minuses: they're three long blocks, and a bit dicey after dark depending on your comfort level. (Let's just say I wouldn't want to be any *further* South of Market.) And, there is a constant, freakish, galestorm wind blowing at 5th and Howard that will threaten to flatten you every time. I would definitely stay there again, but at a premium rate I'd prefer to be north of Market St.

Reviews.Title: “Still some teething problems...”
Reviews.Author: D&D_Holiday_feedback
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to be close to the action in and around union square. We paid around Â£800 for 3 nights - so not cheap by any ones standards. The hotel is based around 10 minute walk from union square and the tram terminous. We decided to stay in this area to mainly get good access to shopping and resturants. The shopping can not be faulted - but the resturants within stumbling distance are limited in this area - you need to catch the bus or tram up to other areas of the city to get a better choice. On arrival (taxi around $40 from SFO) we were not greeted by a bell boy and carried our own luggage in to reception (and to the room as we were not offered help). We checked in without hassle - except for the receptionist trying to sell us an upgrade to some chargeable loyalty scheme (not meeted with great joy after 15 hours travelling!). We stayed at the hotel for a birthday and anniversary trip and as such booked a room on one of the executive floors (top two and offering complementary food and drinks included in the rate (which was great)). When we arrived to the room they had decorated it with rose petals which was a lovely touch - when we got back to the room after dinner there was also a lovely dessert and bottle of sparking wine laid out. This to me is a great sign of a hotel who has taken note of that 'special requests' box on the internet booking site and it was really appreciated. Despite this being a lovely gesture - there was a thorn in the roses - the rose petals and desert left overs were left in the room for the next 3 nights - leaving rotting food and petals laying about. We eventually put the desert out in the corridor, but had no desire to spend out vacation on our hands and knees picking up rotten petals! The staff at the hotel also seemed new and didn't really know thier area. The conceirge desk sent us to the wrong car hire location, gave us wrong phone numbers and when we asked the staff in the lounge for resturant recommendations and details of our booking they could not help us and sent us else where. One of the reasons we booked this hotel was the leisure facilities - to our disappointment the pool was closed as it was broken - and properly broken as it was empty and being worked on and must have been for some time as the hotel offered an alternative a couple of blocks away. Again, while i applaud the hotels ability to arrange an alternaive - its not the same as being able to go downstairs in your dressing gown for an early morning swim. They also didn't mention this on check in - waiting until you were in your room to be greeted by a letter. and one final gripe - the water pressure. This was non-existant in our bathroom. The shower was more of a drip than a whoosh... So - very average...some areas seemed really good, but some were very shoddy!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome choice for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelbug312
Reviews.Content: I had read previously that this hotel was too sterile and business-like for a romantic getaway; however we were pleasantly surprise with its amenities and luxury. The room was extremely comfortable, and came equipped with bath robes and ample towels and pillows, a giant flat screen television, and a bed that was the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in EVER! We had a great view from the 20th floor, and the location was convenient to AT&T Park and downtown. I felt safe walking back to the hotel at night, and the hotel staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. One drawback to the neighborhood is that there are only a few restaurants in the area that serve dinner late. The area caters largely to the daytime lunch crowd, so most of the deliâ€™s and bakeries close up shop early in the evening. This area is excellent for shopping and Westlake Mall is only 2-3 blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FairviewCorporate
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is focused primarily for the business traveller as it is close to the convention centre, we stayed with our three children for four nights and it was perfect. When we arrived at reception, the General Manager came out to welcome us and arranged for ice cream to be sent up to our rooms for the kids. Considering the hotel has 33 floors and is sometimes extremely busy this was great customer service. The rooms are extremely modern and have fantastic views of San Francisco. The hotel is ideally situated with only a ten minute walk required to reach the main shopping and downtown areas. Valet parking is very expensive and I would recommend not taking your car which to be honest is not necessary for San Francisco in any case as the cable cars are great and there are plenty of taxi's. At the end of our stay the General Manger was there again to thank us for staying!.....we would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “New and modern, but otherwise a typical 4/5-star chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaybowl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Intercontinental twice this year, in January and June. For both stays, I was there for only a few days. Rooms: Since this is a new hotel, the rooms are well-appointed and large. The room had a very large flat-screen television, desk, and large king bed. The rooms have large windows (floor to ceiling), but there really isn't much to look at directly by the hotel. Perhaps a room on a higher floor would be worth seeking out if you want views of the city. Service and Amenities: The hotel staff was friendly and polite. I didn't make much use of the staff, but my interactions with them were pleasant. One glaring annoyance is that there is not free internet in the hotel. I realize other chains often charge as well, but this hotel doesn't even offer free internet in the lobby. There is a Starbuck's around the corner you can use for WiFi. Location: The location is fine, just a few blocks from Market and right next to Yerba Buena Gardens, and several blocks from Union Square. The neighborhood is safe considering it's San Francisco. I did walk alone at night, but not everyone would feel comfortable doing so. If I weren't familiar with the neighborhood, I would hesitate to stray too far from the hotel. Value: Both times I booked through Hotwire, so I did not make a deliberate choice to stay here. Based on prices quoted on the web site, Expedia, etc., this hotel is overpriced. If you really want to stay in Union Square, then you will end up paying for it, but even so, there are less expensive hotels of similar quality in the area. I usually try to avoid this area of town because it is packed with shopping tourists, but for both of these trips, it was really convenient. Also, when booking on Hotwire, I try to stick with neighborhoods I know. P.S. Restaurant: I was very excited to try the restaurant, since the chef was recently recognized as best new chef in Esquire, but I was really disappointed. The service was the highlight. Food and wine were served promptly by informed waitstaff. The decor in the restaurant is pretty cheesy (an attempt at chic 1970s retro, perhaps?) I had the tasting menu for $34, so I didn't expect a big meal. I would expect that a seasonal tasting menu would not include things like New Zealand scallops and out-of-season strawberries (in June), especially in San Francisco. It was fine, but even for $34, it really wasn't enough food to be considered even a light lunch. It wasn't so bad that I wouldn't give it another shot, but there are just too many good restaurants in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, new hotel, great views”
Reviews.Author: LuckyDogSJC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I live about an hour from San Francisco and have stayed at the Intercontinental a few times after seeing a show or having a late dinner. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are modern and the beds are very comfortable. Everything is always spotlessly clean. We've stayed in a couple different rooms. The rooms with a queen bed are small, the rooms with king beds are larger. If you just want a bed for the night, a queen room would be fine. The California Stay-cation rate, available on their website, is also a good find. The rate includes valet parking and breakfast for two for CA residents. The hotel has even been able to give us late checkouts so we can wander around the city a bit more before we head back home.

Reviews.Title: “Floor to Ceiling Windows. LIke Floating on a Cloud.”
Reviews.Author: Kabear
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been open only one year. We were there for seven nights including the July 4th weekend. Great view of the bay and city. We even saw some fireworks from our room. Our corner room on the 22nd floor was 400 sq. ft with floor to ceiling windows including in the large bathroom. The bathroom door was a frosted glass inset in a wooden frame. The little tiles framing the bathroom mirror also served as a shelf were beautiful. The bath amenities were very good quality. Everything was new and clean. The king bed was plush and comfortable. We kept the curtains open as we were too high up for anyone to look in (I think). Staying in this room was like floating on a cloud. There was a large (42" at least) LG Plasma TV in HD with all channels including HBO. There was a Keurig coffee maker in the room which made delicious coffee. We have two larger models, one at home and one in our office. Customer service was excellent. The restaurant is good, but expensive as all hotel restaurants. We ate breakfast there a couple of times. Good bar with a vibrant Friday happy hour. Their gym was adequate with great equipment and a lap pool. The location is quiet and a block from Westfield Mall - a very large multi-level shopping center, the Metreon multiplex movie theater at Mission and 4th, four blocks from Union Square. There is a section of town nearby, the Tenderloin, that we were told to avoid as it is a bad neighborhood. We did a lot of walking and also took cabs daily. We will definitely come back to this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 39tacbob
Reviews.Content: We steyed at this hotel over the fourth of july and were very impressed. When we checked in they told us they were sold out of King beds but could give us a king deluxe room for an additonal 40$ a night. I was very upset at this, due to the fact that we needed a king and had reserved one. After suggesting they give us the deluxe room at no additonal cost they agreed. Our room was very large with a large bathroom. The bed is very comfortable and soft and the htel provided robes as well. We did not have floor to ceiling windows as mentioned in other posts but it was still nice. There wasnt much of a view but maybe if we were on a higher floor( we were on the 15th), you might be able to see more. The location is very close to Union Square and is fine for walking during the day. I did feel at night the streets were somewhat dark with very few people. We didn't encounter any problems but I was somewhat nervous. I also felt there was very little outside noise at the hotel which was a bonus for sleeping in.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the corner room!”
Reviews.Author: Dmctimm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental on Howard for five nights over the 4th of July weekend 2009. We were there to celebrate his birthday with a romantic get-away. Before I booked, I spent several hours looking at various hotel options in San Francisco. The Intercontinental seemed to be interesting and we were not disappointed. They offered a great deal which included a buffet breakfast each morning, free parking and daily cable car passes. We specifically paid the extra to get a corner room and it was well worth it. Our room was on the 23rd floor and faced the bay side. The corner rooms offer two walls of floor to ceiling windows. Because the Intercontinental is a few blocks from the heart of downtown San Francisco, the view is not blocked by other large buildings. You do not have a view of the next building, but instead you look out over a city that is even more beautiful at night. We slept with the view fully unveiled each night. The bed was wonderful and plush. A large flat screen TV was a nice touch. The swimming pool was under emergency repair and I was disappointed at first, but honestly we never had time to use it any way. As the breakfast buffet was included with our package deal, we enjoyed it each morning. I would not have paid $28 each otherwise because there are lots of simpler options at local coffee shops. The service provided by each hotel representative was wonderful. I read in other reviews that the service was spotty, but that was not our experience. Everyone we encountered was gracious and helpful. I indicated we were celebrating my husbandâ€™s birthday and they surprised him with a great birthday cake. We enjoyed the treat and he felt special. The hotel is conveniently locate. It is not lumped in with all the other downtown hotels but not too far off the beaten path. You can take the BART from the Airport if you are able to walk a couple of blocks to the hotel. Both the cable car and public buses are easily accessible from the hotel and we were able to cover the city. Bloomyâ€™s and Neiman Marcus are close if you like shopping. The Chieftain Irish Pub is right across the street and we took advantage of that more than once. All in all, we were very happy with our overall experience and are glad we swung for the room upgrade. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected-Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ManOfC0nstantS0rr0w
Reviews.Content: I got it at a real low price, just wanted it to be near nightclub Slims. Did not expect to have such a nice room for the price I paid ($119 plus San Francisco's numerous business killing taxes which made it almost $150). Good bed, Good View of the very distant but still there Bay View Boat Club, never heard neighbors up down or sideways. Very Clean and after thank the maid for extra towels she gave me a 3/4 full bottle of Cyrstal and another open bottle of very expensive wine*, It was still cold and tasted great !!! Tip cheapest City Parking in San Francisco downtown on 5th right next door to hotel at $36. Then a short walk to Hotel- during day use short cut via Minna Alley behind hotel and City run parking lot. My wife is very picky but I could bring her here. Plenty of availbale taxi's to get you where you need to go. * ( The expensive wine----nah not really just had to make that jab from other comment)below )

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy001
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you the amenities of most hotels, but with exceptional service. We were always greeted with a smile. They made an effort to go out of their way to please us. To me, this is the most important asset a hotel can have.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Incredible Views”
Reviews.Author: Candace34
Reviews.Content: We had a Jr Suite which was basically a very large hotel room. There were 2 full walls floor to ceiling windows, including the bathroom. The bathroom lacked adequate counter space, but the impact of the windows and the views made up for the bathroom. The bed was not our comfort preference but it is hard to make a bed to fit everyone's preferences. We did have room service one night and I was very impresses by the quality of the food. We felt the rate was reasonable at $239/night before taxes. Note there are 2 Intercontinental Hotels in San Francisco - this one is on Howard Street. It is within walking distance to Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, and the Ferry Building. We made these walks each day and they were long, but the weather was great and we loved the exercise. We took the trolley car (not cable car) one time and it was so crowded and hot that we preferred to walk.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre, cramped, lame”
Reviews.Author: staccatoprince
Reviews.Content: the lobby is modern and fresh, but small. the rooms are even smaller. housekeeping didn't come to clean the room until we asked one day. parking was 54 dollars a night which is ridiculous but that's not what really pissed me off- we left a bottle of crystal champagne, and a expensive bottle of chardonnay in the room corked, about 2/3 full (celebration weekend) and when the maid service finally DID come... THEY THREW THE EXPENSIVE BOTTLES AWAY. front desk was not sympathetic or eager to compensate for such a mistake i was heated. it's not ghetto, it's not dated, but it's not worth it either. spend 20 more per night and stay at the westin st. francis or the parc 55 & you'll be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “New, Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: claireandchris
Reviews.Content: We kicked off a 3 week honeymoon road trip around California with a 3 night stay at the intercontinental. They have done a good job with this hotel, which is still quite new. It is just on the edge of the touristy areas of SF and is close to Bloomingdales, but a 10 minute walk from Union Square. The hotel has a good pool and gym, the rooms are nice and spacious, and the bar classy and chic. The food is good if a little pricey, but the service is really friendly: the concierge could not be more helpful. If we stayed in SF again we might try the other intercontinental which is a bit more central but we've really no complaints with this place and would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: mom2rk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night during our trip to San Francisco. We have 2 small children (age 3 and 6) and we all loved this hotel. The location could be better. It looked like an up and coming area. The walk to Market Street/Union Square was only a few minutes. The walk to the cable car was also about 5 minutes. There were some shaddy areas if you walk west. We had a room on the 30th floor corner room. The view was spectacular. We could see both the Bay bridge and the Gold Gate bridge. The floor to ceiling windows were awesome. Since we had the corner room, it was a spectular view no matter where you sat in the room. The amenities were great. Everything is new and very contemporary. The bathroom has great fixtures. We booked a package that included parking and breakfast. Normally parking is over $50/per day so getting this included in the room rate was key. The in and out service of the valet was very good. We never had to wait too long. Breakfast was okay. The buffet was not too extensive but it was good enough to start the day. We would definitely go back to this hotel the next time we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueBubble
Reviews.Content: Good location, walking distance from Union Square. Bed is very comfortable, room is clean and quiet. The room is quite roomy compared to other hotels we stayed around union square.

Reviews.Title: “as usual”
Reviews.Author: marco.to
Reviews.Content: this is, as usual, an Intercontinental hotel. best location, best room, best view, best service, superior club floor services. I loooove intercontinental

Reviews.Title: “We found our S.F. Pied-a-terre.”
Reviews.Author: davinna
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night while in town to see an opera. We stay in S.F. 15-20 nights per year and usually book a four star hotel through hotwire. This time we decided to check the Intercontinental website to see how their price compared to the price of the hotel I assumed was the Intercontinental offered on hotwire. We were surprised to find a great bargain for California residents which included both valet parking and buffet breakfast for two. Much better that we could get from hotwire and we had better option on available rooms. We decided to join Intercontinental's Ambassador plan, booked an upgraded room and received a two level upgrade to a one bedroom suite on the 31st floor. This hotel is new, fresh and pretty hip for an establishment which must receive most of its visitors because of conventions at next door Moscone Center. Good bar and restaurant. Suzanne at the front desk was especially helfpul. This is a very reasonably priced hotel for the quality you receive. Do check their website for current offers. I think it is the one of the hotels where you really can get a better package by booking directly. The only negative was all the ambulance sirens one could hear on Howard street on a Saturday night. Next time we will ask to try a room facing towards Market street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: krtiger93
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in San Francisco, and, since I've had great luck with Intercontinental Hotels in other cities, I figured this was a safe bet. The SF Intercontinental is even better than the other ones in which I've stayed. Very friendly and customer-oriented staff. I travel a lot for business, and this was a pleasure trip, so I was even more tuned in to service. They surpassed my expectations by taking care of everything, making excellent suggestions for meals in the area, etc. Loved the modern feel of the room - walk-in tiled shower, sliding door for the bathroom, and a doorbell for the room. Also made use of the I-spa and had the best massage ever. Will I go back? Most definitely yes!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler1111sf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions since they opened last year. Each stay has been fantastic. The staff is professional and extremely helpful. The place is beautiful and since it is brand new, â€œstate of the art.â€� The rooms are lovely and the service extraordinary. If you mention that it is a special occasion they go out of their way to make it special such as complementary wine or treats. The health club and spa, which we use every time, is first class. This is a five star hotel but charges much lower rates. We also always include and use the hospitality suite which has great food and drinks all day long. The restaurant, Luce, is one of the finest in the city and the chief Dominique never fails to stop at our table and explain what is on the menu and makes us feel like she is preparing the food just for us also the prices are well below what you would expect to pay for the service and quality that you get. This place is a must stay if you are looking for a hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days in late May with my wife. Service was superb, even before arrival. I had booked a prepaid advance rate months earlier, but had found a much cheaper sale rate closer to my stay and the hotel refunded my money and rebooked me at the lower rate, even though they had absolutely no obligation to do so. Incredible dedication to secure my business now and later. Received a junior suite upgrade and it was a great corner room on the 30th floor with a great view. Very spacious and clean. Bathroom was large and comfy with tub and seperate shower and a view as well. Shower could have been better designed so as to not spill water everywhere when you get out, but that is a minor quibble. Location was close (5-10 min walk) to Powell street bart station/trolley lines, so you are very centrally located to use various forms of transit. Had an indoor spa/pool/sauna/workout facility and on site spa facility, none of which I used.

Reviews.Title: “Posh & Perfect in SoMa District”
Reviews.Author: jcindc
Reviews.Content: Just did 5 days of "weisuring" here; first couple days of work, and the back end for Memorial Holiday leisure. Positive hotel reviews are spot-on....and an absolute steal for SoMa at $119 promo, or anywhere in SF for that matter. TIP: you must book thru TravelZoo by end of month for summer stay special rate. We liked the style factor the best....minimalist sleek with wood and marble abounding, striking contemporary art, stylish furniture, and floor-to-ceiling windows. More savvy features include pillow-top bedding, super soft terry robes, 42" plasma TV, spanning surface areas, convenient AC outlets in wall mounted light fixtures, and sprawling chic oversized bathroom with translucent tile. If you're looking for demerits, there were few....room service pricing is obscene; the $35 three-day WiFi surcharge is tacky; and Priority Club upgrades are limited to Ambassador members. On the plus side, check-in was efficiently painless; service staff was cordial and informative; and housekeeping was exceptional. Location for transportation simply can't be beat. ....BART, MUNI, and Powell Street Cable Car just a short 5 minute walk. TIP: get an $18 MUNI pass and ride as often as you like for any three day period. We ate all but one of our meals out as there is simply no equal to the City by the Bay for evey choice and fathomable option. But dinner at the Terroir-Tuscan fusion LUCE Restaurant. in the hotel was very good-- delicious fresh-cut paparadelle with slow-braised short ribs in a porchini mushroom reduction-- living up to the raves for award winning chef Dominique Crenn. The wine offerings are inspired by Frescobaldi and Mondavi joint vision, and you will find hard-pressed to get a better super Tuscan value than the "Lucette." TIP: adjoing 888 Bar shares the kitchen with LUCE and offers some of the same fare at lower priced portions. TIP: SoMa technically spreads from the Embarcadero to 11th, between Market and Townsend. The bohemian regentrification of warehouses, nightspots, residential hotels, art spaces, loft apartments, furniture showrooms, and the infamous Folsom BDSM zone can be sketchy in some blocks, especially around 6th & Mission. The areas by South Park and the Giants ballpark, around the MOMA and Yerba Buena Gardens, and over by 11th & Folsom are the better locales. TIP: Weekend Brunch at TripTych on Folsom.....beignets and benedicts are best. Bottom-line: There may be something comparable in high-end properties but not sure the current promo rate can be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: cortoredondo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern hotel. Staff was very helpful, reception did a great job getting us into the perfect room. The only down side was that after a rockin' concert a few drinks in the lounge would have been nice. Sadly, last call was at 11:30.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel by the bay”
Reviews.Author: grantn10
Reviews.Content: Hi We stayed at this hotel for our 1st Wedding anniversary. I chose the hotel because i am a priorityclub royal ambassador member and i used some points for the stay. The hotel is in great location Just behind Bloomingdales and the Westfield Centre on Market street. The hotel is Brand new and spotlessly clean. When we arrived they had upgraded us to a Junior Suite on the 26th floor. A corner room it had floor to ceiling windows on each corner and also in the bathroom!! the styling was contemporary with rich woods and a nice calming color scheme. When we got to the room they had scattered rose petels across the floor and on top of the bed to celebrate our anniversary. They had also provided a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries great touches!! There is a club lounge on 6 which we had access to. they serve a really nice continental breakfast, lunch snack and hors derves in the evening with s self serve complementry bar. The staff were great, really friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The best concierge service ever!”
Reviews.Author: mb
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is a new,clean, modern hotel with very comfortable rooms and a good location (as long as you turn East or North) but the best feature of the hotel is the concierge staff. They were the most knowledgable and friendly staff we have encountered in all of our travels. They consistantly went the extra mile to make our vacation special. It was a good value and I would give it a strong recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinequeen_7
Reviews.Content: The Good Points The hotel is a great modern hotel, which is a lot cheaper than some of the other hotels in the same class which we thought was because of the location, but actually the location was excellent, 5-7mins nice walk from the cable car/shops and a 10mins walk to Union Square, there is a house car which will drop you off within a 2-3 mile radius if you're going for dinner or picking up a hire car which saves having to get a taxi. We went for a club room and the club lounge provided an excellent breakfast, free internet access. Also a great gym and indoor pool. The Bad Point The serivce let the hotel down considerably. On arrival for check-in there was no welcome to the hotel which would have been nice after a 10 hour flight and 20 mins cab journey! when i had a complaint i called the hotel services and no-one called me back, i took my complaint to the club lounge and there was a very nice lady there and she took care of it and upgraded us to a fanastic suite. I called the hotel services twice after that and both times they gave incorrect information and we didn't get turndown service, therefore its the service that lets the hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown SF; and it's brand new!”
Reviews.Author: ndtpunk71
Reviews.Content: By far one of my favorite hotels in SF. I stayed here about a week after they open so it was practically brand new. My room was decent size and the view of the Bay bridge was very cool. For a hotel this size, it's relatively cheap and they always have specials. It's also within walking distance to Union Square, Metreon, and next to Moscone Center. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing 4 star about this hotel is the price”
Reviews.Author: shepherd79
Reviews.Content: we were really excited to stay at this hotel in SF. when we got there the hotel was beautiful. however then the problems started. First problem came the first night. when around 11:30 pm the hotel staff started vacuuming right outside our room. So my fiance called down to the front desk to complain, and was told that was time they vacuumed. They did eventually stop the vacuuming, but not before disrupting our sleep Then the next day when I went to put some clothes in the drawers it was discovered that the previous occupant had left their undershirt and underwear in them. We called the front desk to inform them and they said they would send somebody right up to get them. We waited for 30 mins without anyone showing up, so we left a note and left. The items were removed, but not exactly as they said right away. Finally, the last problem we encountered would not have been even worth mentioning if we already hadn't already had the previous two. Our room Iron did not work and had to be replaced. They got the iron, but once again we had to wait a little while to get it. All in all the Hotel looks very nice and clean, but the service is awful, in addition, everything that you would get for free at a Holiday inn express you have to pay extra for. For example 15 dollars for internet access. Do yourself a favor and skip this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wow, fantastic hotel, best. bed. ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: qaxalot
Reviews.Content: Went there this past weekend for an anniversary getaway. Wow. Fantastically comfortable bed, with down (?) mattress topper, down comforter, etc. Incredible bathroom too! We just remodeled our bathroom at home, and I was surprised to see that the hotel used a lot of the same hardware we got for our own bathroom!! It was nice being in a hotel that was as nice as our house - AND I didn't have to clean it! Yay! Glass tile, limestone tile, heavy glass shower doors, etc. Extremely clean, and I am picky about clean hotel bathrooms. Separate tub, which was nice. We were in one of the 33rd floor rooms, and the view toward SF Bay was to die for!! Wonderful ventilation system, so no steamy bathrooms! Gotta be careful of the heavy glass sliding door to the bathroom - make sure you keep your fingers out of the way when you shut the door! All in all, hands down the best hotel room I've ever stayed in!! (and that includes my previous favorite, the Sheraton Maui!!) Wonderful front desk staff too. We didn't park at the hotel (incredibly expensive). Do yourself a favor and park at the 5th and Mission St. garage behind the hotel and pay half the cost for overnight parking ($30 vs hotel's $52 valet only parking). Didn't try the hotel restaurant (Luce), but it looked good. Didn't have a chance to try out the spa, fitness center or pool, but they looked very nice. The fitness center especially looked to have very new machines and in great condition. As we stayed in the club level rooms, we got to use the 6th floor Club lounge. Nice little amenity with snacks, food, etc. Would absolutely stay here again, and the prices seem to be pretty good comparatively for what you get. We've paid almost as much for not as good a room before in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch! Amazing! Bravo!!”
Reviews.Author: Clearstar
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of Diplomats from the Reno Sparks Chamber of Commerce. We did the Beach Blanket Babylon package and had an amazing time! The hotel staff was so friendly and accommodating. The package price was fantastic. We had the most incredible Chefs Sampler 5 course dinner at Luce.
